loans.name: Sam Or

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Or T. is a tailor in Koh Ras Leu Village in Kandal Province. In this business, she faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to purchase a sewing machine in order to make clothes for her customers. 

She hopes to make better quality clothes for her consumers with this loan. Mrs. Sam Or T. is a 53-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is a teacher who earns a small salary to support the family while the remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine in order to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vickiy M. sells perfumes at her shop. She is requesting a loan to expand the shop. Vicky is 25 years old and single. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a bigger perfume shop.

loans.name: Seidou

texts.fr: Agé de 48 ans, Mr Seidou S. est marié et père de huit (08) enfants. Exploitant de graviers depuis plus de dix (10) ans, il jouit d’une confiance absolue auprès de ses clients dont les demandes ne cessent d’augmenter, obligeant Mr S. à faire face à des ruptures de stocks. Il manque de moyens financiers pour l’extraction à grande échelle et en grande quantité de graviers. Pour y faire face, il demande un financement lui permettant de disposer d’un stock important de graviers afin de répondre à la forte demande des clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Seidou S., age 48, is married and the father of eight. Having a gravel yard for over ten years, he enjoys absolute trust from his customers, whose orders are constantly increasing. This forces Mr. S. to cope with inventory shortages. He lacks the financial means to extract gravel on a large scale and in quantity. To address the situation, he is asking for financing that will enable him to have a sizable inventory of gravel to meet the strong demand from his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extract and sell gravel

loans.name: Sok-Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Sok-heng N., 40 and his wife, Mrs. Hong Kheav, 42, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1984 and have three children: two sons who have full-time employment in Phnom Penh and one daughter. The daughter stays at home and assists her mother in selling flowers.

Sok-heng has been driving a motor taxi for three years. Sometimes he drives in his village and sometimes he drives in Phnom Penh. His wife has been selling flowers for 24 years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She grows the flowers on their farm and sells them at the Derm Kor market in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Hong Kheav hopes to expand her business.

Sok-heng is asking for a loan of $600 in order to build a concrete foundation for his home. This is his second loan.

loans.use: To build a concrete foundation for his home

loans.name: Zoir

texts.ru: Зоир отец троих детей,бизнесмен, который занимается продажей шлангов для полива огородов и другие необходимые для дома товаров.Жена Зоира работает техничкой в столовой рынка города Гафуров.На плечах Зоира лежит вся лепта семейных расходов,заработная плата его жены очень низкая.Для увеличения своего оборотного капитала и ассортимента Зоир хочет взять кредит.
texts.en:
Zoir S. is a businessman and a father of three. He sells garden hoses and other household goods. Zoir's wife works as a maintenance person at a local dinner in Gafurov. The wife's pay is very low. To help better provide for his family, Zoir is seeking a loan to finance business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Lusia S. K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children between the ages of two and five. Lusia has been running a retail shop business since 2007. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, five days per week. Lusia currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Lusia thanks you for her support!
	
Kiva partner SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed noncreditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her retail store in bulk

loans.name: Anhtuya

texts.en: B. Anhtuya is 37 years old and a married mother of one daughter. She has one daughter who goes to elementary school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and auto-mechanic. She has been running a dairy sales business since 2003. She had been selling milk, "airag" (fermented mare's milk, a Mongolian delicacy), yogurt and other dairy products by going door to door in her neighborhood. When she started running her small business, her capital was only 100,000 tugrigs ($1 USD=1,500 tugrigs). But with time and persistence her business has grown, and she in 2006 started renting a food stall at the local market. Her business capital has increased to 800,000 tugrigs. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy more dairy products from wholesalers to increase her business inventory. Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional person and have a rich and happy life.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products from wholesalers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters. Some are in the junior high school while others are into apprenticeships. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and the children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Florence is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetable cooking oil. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell her products in her community. Florence says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Most of her customers are food vendors. She procures the oil all the way from wholesalers in Accra.

Florence has been in business for two years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure vegetable cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
"I am a widow and have 5 children, but that doesn't stop me from dreaming and raising my children well and providing them with a better future," says Genelyn B., a mother of 5 children from Agusan del Sur in Mindanao. "When my husband died, I promised to improve our farm and make it more productive in his honor. My wish for my children is to really study hard to earn a degree, so that when they are older, they will find better jobs for their future children," she added.

Genelyn is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will help a lot to increase her harvest and income.

CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Farzana Aftab Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji and Khadija iram baji each want a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread and clothes) to prepare embroidered dresses to sell.

Farzana baji is a wife of A. A. who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a cloth selling business. He buys clothes for low rates and sells to the community. Farzana baji also has a business of preparing embroidered dresses. She prepares emboridered dresses on order and earns income. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread and clothes) to prepare embroidered dresses to complete the orders of her customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.en:
Abdumutalib G. is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their 4 children. His children are currently in school and help out with the farm work, too. He plans to improve the living conditions of his family. Abdumutalib has been a farmer for 6 years and his hardest time is during the winter when the crops don’t grow well. He began farming with his parents, and now needs a loan to improve production. This is the first time that he will use a loan to improve his crop yield and sales. Abdumutalib will use this loan to buy fertilizers and materials so that he will have a successful crop and he will then sell his production for the best price at the market.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Layla has owned a clothing shop for twelve years. She also sells perfumes and accessories. She requests a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products and clothes for the summer season. Layla has been a microcredit client for eight years and has always paid on time. 

Layla is special in her work because of her competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When Layla first started this business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because she likes trading. In the future, she plans on expanding her work by opening another shop.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Faiziya

texts.en:
Faiziya is married and has three children in school. Her husband works as an employee in a business. His income didn't cover the children's food and education, so she decided to start her own business selling clothing. At first, Faiziya sold to friends and neighbors, then, through referrals, her client list grew and now there is strong demand for what she sells. 

She is asking for a loan of $1400 USD to buy merchandise, because she doesn't have enough stock. Faiziya promises to repay the loan without any violations and counts on your support to continue to grow her business and support her children's education. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Koleta

texts.en: Koleta U. (0) is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga. She is married and has seven school-aged children. Koleta owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. Koleta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Koleta is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will be again used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are girls and are in school. She works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. Elizabeth lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a grocery store in her community. Elizabeth buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que ya no dependen de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos, ubicada en la Plaza de Armas de su Ciudad, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las noches. Nos cuenta que esta muy contenta y satisfecha con su  negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.

Isabel, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus alimentos.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 40 years old and married with seven children, ages 8 to 20 years. Six of her children go to school .She also takes care of additional family members. Prossy resides in and rents a one room house where she is staying with seven people. There is electricity, but no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area in the outskirts of Kampala in Mulago. 

Prossy works seven days a week. She buys cosmetics and other hair relaxers from Kampala city shops and incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She pays a monthly rent of 50000/=.  She sells to all kinds of people Prossy has been in this business for 20 years and has been with MCDT for six years, servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group. She wants to use this loan to buy more cosmetics and hair relaxers. Prossy aspires to grow her business and start importing products directly.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair relaxers

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou B. est une femme de 41 ans elle est mariée et a 8 enfants dont les 5 sont scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE  depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle veut avec son crédit renforcer son restaurant afin de générer des bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou B. is 41 years old, married, and has 8 children, five of whom are in school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (Village Bank) of Tenghory Diamalaye for 7 years and has received 14 loans with them and repaid all of them in full. With the loan she is now requesting, she hopes to bolster her restaurant and make it more profitable, thus allowing her to improve her family's lives.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To become more financially independent

loans.name: Alao

texts.en: M. sells palm oil in drums and gallons. He has been in this business for ten years. He is married with four children, and he is 36 years old. He lives in Uboba, Oyo State, Nigeria. M. is soliciting a loan in the amount of 180,000 NGN to improve his oil business. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo es un hombre que siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro, tiene 51 años, está casado y es padre de 9 hijos, de los cuales 5 de ellos viven en su casa.

Él se dedica a la siembra de papas y olluco en sus chacras temporales (se riegan con la lluvia), pero desde hace 15 años también vende carne, y con estas dos actividades mantiene tranquilamente a sus numerosos hijos. La labor que más le agrada es la compra y venta de ganado, por serle muy rentable; por ello, el fin de semana madruga para comprar los animales que se encuentran a un menor precio y le dejan mayores ganancias al venderlos por kilos. 
Pero, los demás días de la semana están centrados en velar por sus cultivos, ya que cuando suben los precios de la papa también gana muy bien, pues anteriormente con una de esas cosechas pudo construir su casa propia hace poco. Ahora su deseo es incrementar sus cultivos de papas para tener el dinero suficiente para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, Teófilo siempre pagó todas sus cuotas puntualmente, además menciona estar muy contento con sus compañeros de banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra carneros y fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Teófilo always has a smile on his face. He is 51 years old, married, and the father of 9 children of whom 5 still live at home.

He grows potatoes and ulluco in fields that he irrigates with rainwater. For 15 years, he has also been selling meat. These two business activities have enabled him to support all of his children. The work he enjoys the most is buying and selling livestock because it is very profitable. On the weekends, he leaves early so that he can find animals for the lowest price and make more profit when he sells the meat by the kilo.

On the other days of the week, Teófilo focuses on maintaining his crops. When the price of potatoes goes up, he makes very good money. In fact, the earnings from one of his recent crops enabled him to build his home. Now he hopes to increase his potato harvest so that he can have enough money to pay for his children’s education.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Teófilo always makes his payments on time and says that he is happy with the other members of his Communal Bank. The money he requested will be used to buy mutton (sheep) and chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & fertilizers

loans.name: Claudia Ivonne

texts.es: Claudia tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Vive en la casa de su abuela quien ya falleció. Ella vive juntamente con su madre. Claudia se dedica a la venta de cerveza y alquiler de mesas de billar en su domicilio. Claudia se dedica a este negocio hace 2 años. La apoyó su madre para tener el capital de trabajo. Tiene muchos objetivos y metas que cumplir ya que es una persona muy joven. Uno de ellos es incrementar su capital de trabajo e implementar su negocio para darle mejor nivel de vida a su hija. A Claudia le gusta mantener limpia y ordenada su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita realizará mejoras del piso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is 21 years old and a single mother of a two year old daughter. She and her mother live in the house of her late grandmother.

Claudia sells beer and operates a billiard hall inside of her house. She started this business two years ago with the help of her mother, who provided the startup capital. Being a young woman, she has many goals and objectives that she wants to achieve. One of them is to increase her working capital so that she can grow her business and provide her daughter with a better quality of life. Claudia likes to keep her business neat and clean. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to repair and remodel the floors of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and remodel the floors of her billiard hall

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero sells plantains and melons at retail prices. She has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make greater profits. Her husband is a retired civil servant. She is 50 years old and married with five children. She sells for long hours to enable her put food on the table to feed her family members. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more plantains and melons to sell. Vero is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains and melons to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. 40 years old. She owns and manages a small farm. She grows rice and vegetables to be able to adequately provide her family with food, clothing, and other basic needs. She has three children; the eldest is 15 years old.  The income she makes from the farm is very helpful in paying the daily cost in their home. Because of her farm, she is able to send her three children to school.

She needs additional capital in her business. She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way, she will be able to grow her harvest and help her family more in paying the daily expenses.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Silvio Enrique

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica del departamento de León, el señor Silvio Z. se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado llevándola a cabo por medio de la crianza de vacas propias que a diario alimenta y vela por su desarrollo. 
El señor Silvio se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y por mantener su humilde hogar compuesto por sus hijos.
Es importante destacar que las vacas alimenta con rastrojo de maní y la razon por la cual solicita el crédito es para invertirlo en la actividad del rastrojo del maní y pago de alquiler de las tierras ya que no son propias. Es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así logrará continuar engordando a sus vacas para posteriormente sacarles el máximo provecho.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica of the department of León, Sr. Silvio Z. raises livestock and feeds his animals daily in order to ensure their development. He is has developed into a hard worker and maintain his modest household, which consists of his children.

Silvio feels it is important to feed his cattle peanut straw, so he is requesting a loan to purchase this type of feed. He rents farmland since he does not own any himself. For this reason, he hopes this loan will be granted so that he can continue to fatten his cattle and achieve maximum benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his cows

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle fait un commerce de fruits de saison, elle vend des mandarines et des oranges. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et de santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Amy D., 55, is married and the mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for three and a half years. She has a little business selling seasonal fruit; she sells mandarins and oranges. She helps improve the living conditions and health of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintain her little income-generating business

loans.name: Luis Isaias

texts.es: Luis Isaias es casado, padre de 3 niños menores estudiando la primaria, habita en la zona # 6 del municipio de Nueva Guinea, tiene 13 años de laborar como pequeño comerciante, esta solicitando a la instituciòn de AFODENIC su primer crèdito esperando ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para mejorar su casa cambiandole el techo y construyendo la cocina y asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, su mayor sueño es mejorar poco su casa de habitaciòn y de esta forma darles un lugar digno y bonito a su familia. Luis Isaias es bien reconocido en su comunidad por sus buenas costumbres, y por ser muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Luis Isaias is married and the father of 3 children in primary school. He lives in Zone # 6 of the municipality of Nueva Guinea. For 13 years, he has worked as a small-scale businessman. He is requesting his first loan from the AFODENIC organization, hoping to receive benefits from the Kiva fund in order to improve his home. He wants to replace the roof and construct a kitchen, thus improving his family's living conditions. His greatest dream is to make some improvements to the home where he lives, so that he can provide his family with an attractive and dignified place to live. Luis Isaias is well-recognized in his community for his good habits, and he is very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof and constructing a kitchen

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en:
Wahab is happily married with 4 children. He is 60 years old and he is also a grandfather. He sells motorcycle spare parts in Oyo State, Nigeria. He is very happy with his business. He uses his experience in business to attract and retain customers. He hopes to expand his business. 

Wahab needs the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Mr. Bunna N. (pictured with his wife), age 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sumtheary Seng, age 30, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have a young daughter.  

Bunna has been selling rice for a year. His wife stays at home and does housework. He hopes to expand his business and be able to generate more income as well. That’s why he is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase more rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Orquidia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Orquidia, tiene la edad de 47 años, vive en el bario 380, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería que desde hace dos años logro poner para seguir apoyando a su esposo, lo cual inicio con dinero de su liquidación como trabajadora de Enitel. Con el propósito de seguir activa en el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos con lo necesario en los pago del colegio, y poder cuidar mejor de su hogar. Su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi. Con este financiamiento quiere invertir en granos básicos, productos enlatados, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, y otros productos para surtir su venta ya que tiene poco inventario y la demanda es mucha. Las dificultades es que las persona que le da crédito abecés no le pagan a tiempo oh solo le dan un adelanto, el cual tiene que cubrir sus gastos en tiempo y forma. Sus planes a fututo es poder lograr hacer crecer la venta como la  captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orquidia is 47 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood. She runs a small market, which she started two years ago in help support her husband. She started the business with money she received upon losing her job with Enitel. She wants to keep her business alive to help her pay for her children's high school and improve her home. Her husband works as a taxi driver. With this loan she will buy basic grains, canned goods, soda, juices, snack foods, and other products to stock up her store because she has little inventory due to high demand. The person who previously loaned her money sometimes did deliver the payment on time or only gave a small amount which she needs to cover her costs. Her plans for the future are to grow her sales and gain new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, snack foods, dairy products, soda, and other products

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been working as a home and furniture painter. He works on a freelance basis, upon the request of clients. He works hard to satisfy the demands of his job in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better life for his family. 

His previous loan allowed him to purchase new and better tools to improve his work. He is requesting a second loan to purchase paint tools and a car for his business so that he can carry his tools and go from one client to another. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase paint tools and a car for his business

loans.name: Solidarias De Emprender Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO LAS SOLIDARIAS DE EMPRENDER ES UN GRUPO DE CLIENTES QUE SE CARACTERIZAN POR LA DIVERSIDAD DE ACTIVIDADES QUE REALIZAN, TENEMOS DOS VARONES DENTRO DE ESTA BANCA.

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SRA. VICTORIA,  ES CASADA, TIENE TRES HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE SU PROPIA MOVILIDAD, ELLA REALIZA COSTURA DE BUSOS Y CHALECOS DEPORTIVOS DEL MATERIAL DE POLAR, ESTA TELA ES BARATA Y CALIENTITA, AUNQUE TIENE SU CASA PROPIA ELLA DESEA DARLES MAS COMODIDAD A SUS HIJOS Y SU SUEÑO ES HACER CONSTRUIR SU CASA Y CONTAR CON TODOS LOS SERVICIOS BASICOS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA TELA AL POR MAYOR PARA LA REALIZACION DE LOS BUSOS DEPORTIVOS YA QUE ESTA TEMPORADA DE FRIO TIENE MUCHA VENTA.

EL SR. HERNAN  TIENE UN SNACK DE POLLOS A LA BROASTER SU NEGOCIO ES COMPARTIDO CON SU HERMANA, EL JOVEN ES SOLTERO Y ES EL QUE MAS LE AYUDA A SU MAMA SU SUEÑO ES INDEPENDIZARSE  Y TENER SU PROPIO LOCAL Y A SU NOMBRE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE LOS POLLOS.

LA  SEÑORA LILIAN TIENE EL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE COMIDA, ES DIVORSIADA, CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD SUSTENTA A SUS TRES HIJOS, LA MAYOR ESTA A PUNTO DE SER ABOGADA Y LOS OTROS MENORES AÚN ESTAN EN COLEGIO, ES UNA PERSONA MUY LUCHADORA,ALEGRE Y EMPRENDEDORA SIEMPRE TRABAJANDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SUS HIJOS. 

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y DINAMICAS QUE QUIEREN SACAR ADELANTE A SUS FAMILIAS PARA ASI PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILILA, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Solidarias de Emprender” is a group of clients who are known for their different business activities. The group includes two men.

Sra. Victoria is the group president. She is married and has three young children. Her husband is a chauffeur who has his own vehicle. Victoria is a seamstress who makes sweatshirts and pullovers made of fleece. This type of material is warm and inexpensive. Victoria wants to make her children as comfortable as possible, so she wants to have her own home. Her dream is to build a house and have all the basic services installed. Using the proceeds from her loan, she plans to buy fabric in bulk so that she can make sweatshirts in order to generate more sales during the cold season.

Sr. Hernan owns a snack business in which he sells roasted chickens with his sister. This young man is single and supports his mother. His dream is to become independent and acquire his own location under his name. The money from his loan will be used to buy supplies for cooking chickens.

Sra. Lilian has a business selling food. She is divorced, so her business helps to support her three children. The oldest child is close to becoming a lawyer, while the two younger children are in high school. Lilian is a determined, cheerful, and enterprising woman who always works for the welfare of her children.

All of the members are responsible and dynamic individuals who want to succeed on behalf of their families so that they can improve their quality of life. They are extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric in bulk

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cayetano está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforzadas pertenecientes del barrio Las Torres. La coordinadora del grupo es  Carmen A. quien vende frutas y verduras en el M. de Masaya. Ella inicio en este negocio desde pequeña ya que su madre se dedica a esto y desde hace cuatro años se independizó.
 Además en la casa vende frescos y chiverías negocio en el que sus hijos le ayudan. A. invertirá especialmente en frijoles, maíz, arroz y papa entre otros productos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Mayra M. F. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace cuatro año y la cual surtirá en granos básicos y Pabla T. que tiene tres años de ganarse la vida haciendo tortillas el bastimento de preferencia de los nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
This group consists of three hardworking and enterprising women from the neighborhood of Las Torres in Masaya, Nicaragua. The group's coordinator is Carmen A., who sells fruits and vegetables at Masaya's market. She has been involved in this business since she was small, working with her mother, but has been independent for the last four years. She also sells drinks and other products out of her home, with the help of her children. A. will buy beans, corn, rice, and potatoes, among other things. The other members of the group are Mayra Molinares F., who has had a small general store for the last four years, and Paula T., who for the last three years has earned a living making tortillas, a favorite staple of Nicaraguans.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, corn, rice, and potatoes

loans.name: Petrona Isabel

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Sabanagrande localizado en la región centro oriental del Departamento del Atlántico a 20 kilómetros de su Distrito Capital Barranquilla, vive y tiene su negocio Petrona M.: una mujer, madre de 3 jóvenes de 18 a 27 años, que a fuerza de trabajo en su negocio, los ha sacado adelante; Petrona   fabrica     fritos  como arepuelas, caribañolas y empanadas y también una especie de amasijos de maíz blanco o amarillo  llamado bollo limpio y de mazorca respectivamente, usando como materia prima el mismo maíz y adicionándole ingredientes como el queso, el aniz entre otros que inventa día a día; este es su negocio principal del que recibe ingresos todos los días, pero también prepara pasteles y sopas los fines de semana y días festivos para las familias, que tienen por costumbre descansar de las actividades domésticas alimentarias los domingos y días festivos y comprar la comida ya elaborada.

Petrona aplicará a su tercer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por valor de $2.000.000 COP,  y lo utilizará para comprar materia prima por volumen y lograr adecuaciones locativas y nuevos enseres para la cocina; está muy contenta de haberle podido inyectar capital de trabajo a su negocio  pues ha tenido muchos beneficios y ha mejorado su vida personal y familiar 
 
Ella sueña con construir un local independiente con todas las normas de salud exigidas porque su desafío mas grande es la falta de un local y el dinero suficiente para adecuarlo como ella sueña, sin embargo dedicará todos sus esfuerzos para mas adelante lograrlo.
texts.en:
In the Municipality of Sabanagrande located in the central eastern region of the Atlántico Department, 20 kilometers from its District Capital Barranquilla, Petrona M. lives and has her business: a woman, mother of 3 from the ages of 18 to 27, who by working in her business, has given them a good start in life. Petrona makes fried food like arepuelas (corn bread), caribañolas (dumplings) and empañadas and also a type of bread with white or yellow corn called "bollo limpio" and "de mazorca" respectively, using the same corn as a raw material and adding ingredients to it like cheese and aniseed among others that she makes up day by day. This is her main business from which she receives a daily income, but she also prepares pies and soups in the weekends and holidays for the families, whose custom it is to have a rest from domestic cooking activities on Sundays and holidays and buy prepared food. Petrona is applying for her third loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to the value of $2,000,000 COP, and will use it to buy bulk raw materials and manage to adapt the premises and have new fittings for the kitchen. She is very happy to have been able to inject working capital into her business as she has had a lot of profits and has improved her personal and family life. She dreams of building independent premises with all the required health regulations because her biggest challenge is the lack of premises and sufficient money to adapt it as she dreams of, nevertheless she will put all her efforts into achieving it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bulk raw materials and manage to adapt the premises and have new fittings for the kitchen

loans.name: Thim

texts.en: Mr. Thim S. 58 years old and is a villager who lives in Saom village in Takeo province. He is a village chief, which allows him to receive a small income to support his family's costs of living. His wife, Mrs. Than Paen, is a farmer who owns 1-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farm, Mr. Thim S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support his farming crop. This couple has three children; one is a seamstress in the garment factory and one is a beautician while the youngest one is a student in the local school. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province, in the western part of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She has purchased fenced-in land where the family lives. Her two children attend a local middle school while her husband runs a raw materials trade business in their town.

Tuya makes felt products such as slippers, hats and seat cushions.  She also makes a variety of souvenirs which are sold at a souvenir stall at the town market. Tuya began her craft business in 2006 and has since expanded her product line.  Her plan is to buy a spinning machine in order to produce more items.  She also plans to participate in trade fairs which are organized in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Tuya is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy a spinning machine in order to keep her business growing.

loans.use: To purchase spinning machine

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley P. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirley farms rice, and has done so for over 9 years.  Shirley joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is now requesting her second loan, for 8000 PHP, in order to buy fertilizer such as manure.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy manure for fertilizer.

loans.name: Isolda Elena

texts.es: La señora Isolda Elena, tiene 24 años es casada y tiene 1 hija, de 2 años de edad. Ella está solicitando crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, el cual es la venta de productos varios, ropa, zapatos, alhajas, artículos personales, cosméticos. Su esposo trabaja en Managua como albañil. Ella vive viajando también a los departamentos para entregar sus mercancías, cabe señalarse ella dio inicio con este negocio desde hace 3 años, que fue cuando se dio cuenta que estaba embarazada y que necesitaba un medio para subsistir. Ella desea seguir continuando con su negocio. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener un local propio para vender en el mercado y poder establecerse para tener ingresos fijos para brindar mayores facilidades económicas para su hija
texts.en:
Isolda Elena is 24-years-old. She's married and has a 2-year-old daughter. She's asking for this loan to invest in her retail business. She sells various products, such as clothing, shoes, jewelry, personal items, and cosmetics. Her husband works as a bricklayer in Managua. She also makes a living by traveling to departments to deliver her merchandise. She began this business 3 years ago when she realized she was pregnant and needed a way to support herself. She hopes to continue with her business. Her dream has always been to have her own shop where she can sell in the market and establish herself and have a stable income to provide an easier economic situation for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Darmaabazar

texts.en:
Darmaabazar G. is 58 years old and lives with his wife and one son in Bayanhongor province in Mongolia. Life conditions are normal. His wife receives a pension amounting to 81,000MNT every month. 

Darmaabazar operated a transport business in his local area using his own large Russian transport truck. He used to transport various heavy loads for people and local businesses. Due to old age, he gave up driving the heavy truck and bought new small car after selling his old truck. 

Now he operates a taxi service in his town using his car. He is a friendly and hardworking person and plans to provide tuition fees for his son. Darmaabazar is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase firewood and resell it.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is a 38-year-old sole proprietor shop owner and a widow in Mikindani Mombasa.

Supporting her young children, she gets help from the elder children. She lives in a family of six people. Being a member of KADET LTD, she is applying for a loan of Kshs. 40,000 which she plans to use to add more stock of goods for her retail shop. She plans to use the anticipated profit to open up a wholesale shop.

Mary K. hopes to be able to educate her children and provide them with the necessary basic needs for her family. She would also like to venture into transporting goods to Rwanda in future.

loans.use: To add more stock of retail items

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is 39 years old and is married with four children. He is well-known in the business of selling Irish potatoes and has been in this business for a long time. He is very proud of his business. His business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Elie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to satisfy the demand of his customers by purchasing a large quantity of Irish potatoes for sale. With these additional sacks of Irish potatoes, he will hopefully earn more profits than previously. He really hopes that he will be able to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and continue taking care of his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Fely's Group

texts.en:
Fely F., from the village of Embargo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, is 47 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Fely is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fely F.’s Group.

To make a living, Fely owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for two years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her second loan for 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Fely plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each group member receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is divorced with an 8-year-old son, Norbert. She is a clothing sales entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Eva sells men’s and women’s clothing in her little store at the local mall called ‘Image’. She launched this venture five years ago. Presently, she has already invested 40,000 grivnyas in the trade. Her monthly net profit amounts to 4,000 grivnyas.  

Eva is requesting a loan of 10,000 grivnyas to purchase seasonal clothing in bulk for retail sale in her store. She usually buys inventory from wholesalers in Hungary; therefore, her merchandise is good quality and comes at a balanced price. Eva is very energetic and hardworking. She always tries to keep her business standards high which has helped her keep loyal clientele.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida, wife of S. M., resides in a city named Sahiwal in Pakistan. She is a caring wife and a mother. She is not an educated lady but she has raised her children with great care and discipline. She has two children: a son and a daughter. Her son got an education until 5th grade standard and now works in a private organization for a monthly wage. Her daughter is enrolled in school and reads in 5th standard grade level. Her husband drives a rickshaw prociding transportation services. He has been doing this for many years. 

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw because now his rickshaw is creating problem and doesn’t work well. Rashida is hopeful that with a fully repaired rickshaw will make her husband's work better and make him more income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client and always paid her installments on time. Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: To repair a rickhsaw

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie P. is a 52-year-old married who supports her family by operating two businesses, a general store and fish-selling business. She lives in Sitio Mabini I, Brgy. Tajao, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8800. 

Lanie is now borrowing PHP 20000 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lanie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Los Dos Olivos Group

texts.es:
La señora María Elizabeth González Juárez, vive en la  colonia Juan Sabines, Municipio de Copainalá, Estado de Chiapas México, María Elizabeth vive en unión libre con el señor Juan Diego López Guzmán  y ellos tiene tres hijos aún a su responsabilidad y son: Juan Daniel de diecisiete  años, Eduardo de trece y el más pequeño es Francisco Javier de diez años.
Ella se dedica a su hogar como también a vender y tamales, tortas entre otros, con esta actividad lleva cinco años y comenta que le va bien con su actividad ya que con ello ha sacando adelante a su familia.
En este trabajo comenzó  por unos hermanos que viven fuera de la ciudad, quienes la incitaron a practicar ésta actividad en la ciudad, así ella inicio y hasta le fecha lo práctica.
Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte comprando ingredientes para realizar su actividad tres veces a la semana y así obtener más ingresos en su hogar, para que con ello también logre ahorrar  y tenga puntualmente sus pagos en Fundación Realidad.
El sueño más grande que ella quisiera realizar, es comprar unos terrenos para dejárselos a sus hijos para el futuro.
En el grupo formo parte ya que la señora Antonia la invitó a unirse y así  poder sacar un préstamo del cual se puedan apoyar. El grupo se llama “los dos olivos” éstos son los símbolos de Moisés y Elías dos personas que se narran en la biblia y con ese nombre se identifica su grupo.
          Las personas que integran el grupo son:
Antonia Hernández López: invertirá el préstamo en la compra coco y utensilios.
María Elizabeth González Juárez: invertirá el  préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para elaborar, tamales y tortas.
 Edali M. Vázquez: invertirá el préstamo para la compra de elotes y luego venderlo hervido.
texts.en:
Señora María Elizabeth González Juárez lives in the Juan Sabines district in the town of Copainalá, in Chiapas, Mexico.  María Elizabeth lives with her common-law husband Señor Juan Diego López Guzmán and their 3 children, Juan Daniel, 17, Eduardo, 13 and the youngest, Francisco Javier, 10.  She takes care of the household and also sells tamales, sandwiches and other things.  She has been doing this for five years and says that it is going well since it supports her family.  This business was started by her brothers who live outside the city.  They encouraged her to do the same in the city and this is how she started.   With the loan she plans to purchase more ingredients so that she can work three times a week and bring in more income for her household, save some money and make her payments to Fundación Realidad on time.  She dreams of buying some land to leave to her children for the future.  

Señora Antonia invited her to join their communal bank and now she is able to take out a loan to support her business.  The group is called "The Two Olive Trees"  because they are the symbols of the Biblical figures Moses and Elias.   The members of the group are as follows: Antonia Hernández López, who will use the loan to buy cocoa and utensils; María Elizabeth González Juárez who will buy ingredients to make tamales and sandwiches; and Edali M. Vázquez who will use the loan to buy corn on the cob to cook and sell.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make and sell tamales and sandwiches

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes, ella vende toda variedad de juguetes para mujer y varón la socia tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de juguetes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the José Carlos Mariategui community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Roxana is 31 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling toys.  She sells all kinds of boys' and girls' toys and has a store where she works from 9.00am to 8.00pm.  Through her business, she manages to get her children ahead in life.

Roxana would like to improve and expand her toy business and is requesting this loan to buy more toys.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (toys)

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. is 48 years old and a basket weaver and seller. She has been selling her woven bamboo baskets since early 2007. She normally earns US $2.50 per day to feed her family. She is married and has three children, all of whom are no longer in school. One of her children works for a bread company and the other two are basket makers. Her husband stays at home to help braid the baskets. As the harvest season is coming, Chan S. will use her loan to purchase more rice to stock for selling and eating. She hopes to use the rest of this loan to care for her ill elderly mother.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell and to eat

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel se dedica al transporte de servicio publico trabaja en una  línea de taxi trufi, vive en casa de sus padres tiene un hijo de meses de edad el señor anteriormente trabajaba en un radio taxi con el dinero dle credito comprara llantas para vehículo y mantenimiento del vehículo, y ahora se compró una línea de taxi y con esta herramienta genera ingresos para el y su familia su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio y de alguna forma también ayuda a la manutención de su familia,  en  un futuro no muy lejano esta familia pretende comprarse un lote y hacer construir su casita propia para independizarse de sus papas y de esta forma vivir solos, es un joven con muchas ganas de superación y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Daniel works as part of a taxi fleet providing public transportation services. He lives at his parents’ house and has a son who is a few months old. This gentleman previously worked with a radio taxi and used the money from a loan to buy tires for the vehicle and pay for maintenance. He now has a fleet taxi that he bought and uses the vehicle to generate income for himself and his family. His wife has a neighborhood store in their home and also helps with supporting their family. In the near future, this family intends to buy a lot and build a house so that they can become independent from his parents and live by themselves.

Daniel is a young man who is eager to improve and grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase tires & pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 30 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abelardo de 32 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Anthony de 9 y Verónica de 11 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los verdes campos del poblado de Cumutay (Distrito de la provincia de Tarma), han sido en la vida de Yolanda, un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar arvejas y choclos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 30, is a kind, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Abelardo, 32, and her two beloved children, Anthony, 9 and Verónica, 11, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

The green fields of the Cumutay settlement (district of Tarma province) have been Luzmila’s life; a very pleasant place to work.  Since very young, her parents taught her this work and now she owns her own fields that she cultivates with much dedication and sacrifice. 

What she most enjoys about the work is cultivating peas and corn.  She’s been in this line of work for 12 years and considers transporting her crops to the Tarma market which is where she sells them to be the most difficult part of it.  In time, she hopes to set up a small stand in the market because she feels that she loses a lot selling at wholesale.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She knows that she has the responsibility to repay on time and is willing to do so.  She is always very aware of all the agreements reached in her communal bank.

She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy pea seeds since this legume is selling very well in the market.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house

loans.name: Solidario El Rosario De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Solidario el Rosario D. Vista Hermosa: La señora Maria Susana, es la encargada del grupo ella venD. ropa y joyas pero su actividad principal es el corte D. cabello,hace barios años que practica su talento la mayoria D. sus clientes la visitan a su casa para que les corte el cabello su sueño es tener un salon D. belleza,y contar con los objetos nesesarios para poder dar un mejor servicio,el credito lo solicita para comprar cosmeticos para su barberia.
La señora Olga Marina: quien venD. verduras, y desea seguir creciendo en su negocio su sueño es tenr un local propio y bonito solicita el credito para la compra D. mas verduras y agrandar mas  su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.
La señora Alicia U.: ella tiene una tienda y tambien venD. refacciones a los trabajadores del area aun le falta algunas cosas en la tienda y por ello decea comprar mas producto comestibles para si tienda,su sueño es que su tienda siga creciendo para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes mas bariedad en productos.
texts.en:
Solidario el Rosario D. Vista Hermosa: Sra. Maria Susana is the head of the group.  She sells clothing and jewelry but her main source of income is dressing hair, a business that she's operated for some years.  Her customers come to her house because she operates the business there.  She wants to own a larger salon some day, with all of the equipment that she needs to proviD. a better service.  She will use this loan to buy beauty supplies for her business.
Sra. Olga Marina sells vegetables and wants to continue growing her business.  She wants to own her own store eventually.  She is applying for a loan to stock her business and, in turn, increase her income.
Sra. Alicia U. has a grocery store and makes extra money selling spare parts to workers in the area.  She doesn't have a large inventory for the grocery business so she wants to buy additional merchandise.  She wants to continue growing her business and needs a wider range of products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for retail businesses.

loans.name: Polline

texts.en:
Polline is a 49 year old lady. She is a mother of three grown children who are above the age of 25. She has been able to raise her children on her own since she separated from his husband.

For a living, she runs a chemist. She was previously employed as a nurse. She has managed to improve her business with the loans from Faulu Kenya. She hopes to open a clinic in the future. She has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy more medicines.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Oanh Thi Kim Hoang's Group

texts.en:
Oanh T. K. H. is 22 years old, has 1 child, and lives in Hoi Phu village. Having been a farmer for two years, she saw that the income from agriculture was not sufficient to cover her family's expenses. Therefore, she opened a small shop that sells ready-made shirts and trousers. Her business generates a profit of 100,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND) per day, helping to improve her family's standard of living. As a client of the SEDA (Small Enterprise Development Assistance) credit program, she is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy new designs to attract more customers.

Thuong T. H. is 45 years old and has 2 children. She is making brooms to sell wholesale. She needs 6,322,000 VND to buy broom-making materials.

Dung T. N. is 49 years old and has 2 children. She is raising 50 chickens for meat. She needs 2,398,000 VND to buy food for them.

Anh T. N. is 30 years old and has 1 child. She is making brooms to sell in the local market. She needs 5,014,000 VND to buy broom-making materials.

Luong T. V. is 29 years old and has 1 child. She is growing vegetables to sell to small restaurants. She is requesting a loan of 5,104,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

Huong T. D. is 37 years old and has 2 children. She is making brooms to sell wholesale to some merchants. She needs a loan of 5,104,000 VND to buy broom-making materials.

loans.use: to buy new designs to attract more customers

loans.name: Linh's Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people have made a village bank loan group. Mrs. Linh was born in 1956 is the village bank president; she was selected by the other members. Each member of this loan group will use their portion of the loan differently.

Her husband, Mr. Ngin, who was born in 1952, is a teacher and earns a small salary. He also helps his wife to farm. They have three children: one is a wedding beautician, one works for an MFI, and one is a student. 

Mrs. Linh is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice and taro. She would like to ask for a loan to buy taro root for growing on her farm.

loans.use: to buy taro root for growing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella realiza tejidos y mantas y también lleva a diferentes lugares como Urubamba y lo vende en forma independiente y lo vende en ferias, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los tejidos y mantas para comprar hilos y telas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Mateo Pumacahua". It is located in the district of Chinchero, belonging to the province of Urubamba and to the department of Cusco.

Her name is Victoria. She is 55 years old and she is single. She alternates her daily activities with her crafts business. She knits wraps and she makes her sales in locations such as Urubamba, selling independently. She makes her sales at the fairs. She wants to expand and improve her business selling crafts. She requests a loan to purchase materials to make her knits and wraps, that is thread and fabrics.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase materials she needs to weave, including thread and fabrics.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 26 and 21. Her husband works as a farmer.

Beverly is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land where they grow rice crops. According to Beverly, they currently earn about 2,800 PHP per month from farming. Beverly works hard to improve this income. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Agripina

texts.es:
Maria Agripina tiene 49 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, soya, naranja y platano. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener buena salud y comprar mas terrenos.

Le gusta pasar los domingos en casa de sus padres con la familiz.
texts.en:
María Agripina is 49 years old living with her husband and children in Agua Clara which belongs to Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is the second loan request to the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and also are merchants.

María farms cocoa beans, corn, soya, oranges and bananas.  Her purchases take place in Chillanes and San Pablo and her sales take place at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

The loan will help her buy farming supplies.  The loan has helped her increase crop yields.  The challenges she’s faced are illnesses among the laborers and infestations and illnesses of the crops.  

Her dream is to have good health and to buy more land.  She likes to spend Sundays at her parents’ house with her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Alex's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Blama, a village close to Kenema city in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org for a loan of 7,500,000 SLL in order to improve on their standard of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children and so on. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount and pays SMT.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Alex is the leader of this group of teachers. The 50-year-old Alex was born in a place call Limeh-Small-Bo, a village situated fifteen miles from Kenema. He is the head teacher at the school and has been in the teaching profession for 27 years now. Alex is married to a housewife and they have six children, four in Junior Secondary School I (JSS I) and two in Senior Secondary School II (SSS II). 

Alex has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to advertise his business and create a direct marketing campaign

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre honrado y trabajador de 59 años de edad. Él vive junto a su esposa e hijo en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Sullana- Piura, en la parte rural de es te.

La actividad que desarrolla  Luis  es la agricultura, el cultiva limón desde hace 4 año. Además, se dedica a la crianza de animales que luego comercializa en el mercado de su localidad. Su familia lo ayuda en las actividades y esto ha llevado al progreso sus negocios.

Luis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón, también comprará alimento balanceado para que sus animales tengan un óptimo desarrollo que le permita comercializarlos a mejores precios.

Luis tiene muchos deseos de superación y de mejorar su calidad de vida, goza de buenas referencias por parte de sus conocidos y  vecinos.
texts.en:
Luis is an honest and hard-working man of 59. He lives together with his wife and son in a house located in the district of Sullana-Piura, in the rural eastern part. 

The activity which Luis pursues is agriculture: he has grown limes for 4 years. He also works raising animals, which he later sells in the market of his community. His family helps him with his work, and this has led to the progress of his business. 

Luis is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles, which he will use to buy fertilizers for his lime crop, as well as balanced feed so that his animals will have optimal development, allowing him to sell them for better prices. 

Luis has a great desire to get ahead and improve his quality of life. He has excellent references from his neighbors and others who know him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel. She is married with two children. 

Rosita has a palm tree business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a bundle of palm trees. 

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Rosita hopes to build a concrete house.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of palm trees for retail sale

loans.name: Dolores Serafina

texts.es:
Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropas y también hace panes, alquila un horno, lo que desea es poder invertir para poder hacer panes.
Dolores es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 20 años, gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido a podido educar a sus hijos, ella tiene una meta a largo plazo que es poder irse a la selva y con un horno propio trabajar haciendo panes, pronto estará abriendo una bodega en sus casa, agradece las capacitaciones que recibe porque aprende a invertir y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the Communal Bank “Llapanchik”. She has a business selling clothes, but she also makes bread. Dolores rents an oven and wants to invest in her ability to make bread.

She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 20 years. Thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to provide an education for her children. Dolores has a long-term goal of going into the jungle with her own oven so that she can make bread. She hopes to open a store in her house very soon. Dolores appreciates the training she has received because has learned how to invest in her business and make it grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Mercedes se dedica al negocio de una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 dependen de ella. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 10 años, inicio primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a sus hijos, sin embargo este negocio les ha servido muchísimo para salir adelante, ya que sus hijos pueden tener la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de mercancías principalmente desea invertir en los granos básicos, golosinas, jugos, galletas, pan y gaseosas.
texts.en: Mercedes runs a small grocery store from her home.  She has four children, two of which are her dependents.  She started this business ten years ago, mainly selling candy for children.  Little by little, she reinvested in her business in such a way that she was able to sell staple grains, which is what people buy the most.  She asserts that her goal in starting this business was to find an alternative resource to be able to take care of her children.  Nevertheless, this business has done a great deal to help them get ahead, since her children can have the opportunity to go to school.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  She wants to invest mainly in basic grains, candy, juice, cookies, bread, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, candy, juice, cookies, bread, and soft drinks

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mrs. Tol is a 38-year-old married woman who currently resides in Baray District of Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Mr. Ry and they have 2 children. The children are single, but one of them is now living apart from the family, working as a laborer in Korea.

Presently, Tol and her husband are cultivators as well as fishermen. They can earn about 8 USD per day to support their family's living condition. She would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase a piece of fertile land to enlarge her farming business both in rainy and dry seasons.

From her loan, Tol hopes that she’ll use the increased income to expand her house size and send her youngest child to be educated in a university and earn a degree.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of fertile land

loans.name: Japherson

texts.en:
Japherson is a 30-year-old married man. He is a food vendor.  His business has been in operation for the last three years.
