Japherson was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to expand his business premise and to purchase more chicken for roasting. 

The profits that will be generated from his business will be directed into the gradual expansion of his business and the repayment of the loan. His  dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to expand his business premise and to purchase more chicken

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 26-year-old enterprising business lady who is married to James. They are blessed with two children ages four and two years. She has been running a green grocer business in an open-air market for the past four years, with a monthly income of KES 14,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced to it by a KADET staff member. Beatrice will use the loan to buy vegetables, green maize, and fruits to add to her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a grocery store and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, green maize, and fruits to add to her business

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is 51 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Eustaquia is a food vendor. She makes banana and camote cue, rice cakes and other local delicacies. Eustaquia earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested this loan to purchase oil, sugar, bananas and flavoring. Eustaquia plans to use her profits to pay her children's school fees and save for a new house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, bananas and flavoring

loans.name: Purna Maya

texts.en:
Purna Maya is 35 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged 15, 11 and 4. In 1998, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Purna Maya plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Saut

texts.en: Mrs. Saut is 55 years old and lives in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. Saut has a life partner in her husband. She has five children, three of whom are living under her care. To earn a living, she operates a small business. She sells some kinds of fast food like fried bread and skewers of grilled beef in the village. From this business, she is able to earn approximately $2.50 per day to cover the daily expenses. Currently, Saut needs some funds from Kiva’s lenders in order to build a bathroom in her backyard behind her house. She is very grateful to the quick response of lenders and she is confident about paying her loan back.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in her backyard behind her house.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, 27, is single and lives in Jiminez, in the province of Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for one year and every month he earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. 

Armando has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. He has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Nacer, tiene un taller de confección de faldas, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año y medio, con el primer préstamo que recibió compró telas para su taller, le gusta trabajar con Finca por la facilidad de créditos y porque aprendió ahorrar, le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseña a ser puntual, responsable con su familia y los créditos.
el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra telas. Su meta es vender sus productos fuera de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Nacer” (To Be Born). She has a workshop where she produces skirts. Margarita has been a member of FINCA Peru for a year and a half. With the first loan she received, she bought fabrics for her workshop. She enjoys working with FINCA for the loan services and because she has learned how to save. Margarita likes the training classes because she has learned how to be punctual and responsible with her family and the loans.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of fabrics. Her goal is to sell her products outside of the city.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es:
El señor Leocadio tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa en la ciudad de Ybycui. Leocadio tiene una despensa bien surtida. Comento que empezó con su actividad junto con su señora hace aproximadamente 10 años, montando primeramente una pequeña casilla en donde vendían empanadas y bebidas, gracias a  la buena atención pudieron ir creciendo día a día, en la actualidad también venden frutas y verduras, realizando repartos de estos productos por compañías vecinas, ya cuenta con clientela formada.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, hortalizas y demás productos, los cuales tienen mucha salida en su negocio. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Leocadio is 53 years old and lives with his wife in the city of Ybycui. Leocadio has a store with a good array of merchandise. He explained that he began this activity with his wife some 10 years ago, originally opening a small stall where they sold stuffed buns and drinks. Thanks to their good service, they grew day by day. At present, they sell fruit and vegetables, and supply these to nearby companies. He can now count on an established clientele.

Leocadio is requesting a loan to buy food supplies, drinks, milk products, garden vegetables, and other products, which are in much demand in his store. He is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity it offers.

loans.use: buy groceries, drinks, milk products, garden vegetables and more for his store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 27-year-old clothes dealer from Mombasa. She is married.
Ruth has been selling clothes for the last two years and she is doing great. This loan is her first to expand her business since she was introduced to Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more bales of clothes. Ruth will use the anticipated profits to build up capital for her business. 
She plans to further expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, pues es desplazada por la violencia de su municipio desde hace cerca de 14 años, y además es madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 4 hijos, pues se separó del padre de sus hijos desde hace un tiempo. A pesar de esto, Fabiola es una persona muy luchadora que ha tenido la fortaleza para trabajar fuertemente por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y tener mejores condiciones económicas. Desde el momento en que llegó a la ciudad, Fabiola viene ofreciendo la venta de comidas; en un principio lo hacía de manera ambulante en un sector de la ciudad, pero en este sector su negocio no estaba prosperando y se trasladó entonces hacia otro sector de la ciudad donde su negocio si empezó a crecer poco a poco. Posteriormente entidades del Gobierno organizaron el sector donde trabajaba Fabiola y le ofrecieron una choza donde puede ofrecer un mejor servicio de comidas a sus clientes, sin embargo, las mismas entidades le exigen bastantes mejoras por cuestiones de sanidad, por lo que ahora Fabiola busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de 2 mesones de acero inoxidable y así poder cumplir con los requerimientos de las entidades de sanidad.
De esta manera podrá seguir teniendo su negocio y así podrá seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Además, Fabiola sueña con poder algún día tener un gran restaurante y también sueña con brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Compra de 2 mesones de acero inoxidable y así poder cumplir con los requerimientos de las entidades de sanidad.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela is married and has 6 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela. Miguela manages a gardening business for a living and she has been in business for 11 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2011, Miguela joined GDMPC. In the future, Miguela wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Bernard Joko, a married father of three, owns a music disc and tape shop in Abura that sells dvds, audio cds, and video cds.   Bernard has been in this business for some years now, using his income for the general support of his family. He will use this loan to acquire a variety of discs to satisfy his customers. With the new profits arising from this loan, he hopes to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: to acquire a variety of  dvds, audio cds, and video cds to satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Ms. Otgonbayar is a 40-year-old, married woman who has three children. She lives with her family in the outer Ger district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her eldest two children attend secondary school and the other attends a local kindergarten. 

She supports her family by operating a retail stall business. Currently, she has approximately 4,500,000 MNT in working capital. She really wants to increase her working capital by applying a 2,000,000 MNT Kiva loan through Transcapital MFI. She is a very hardworking and ambitious woman who desires to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakira is 26 years old and a mother of two children. She lives with her parents and children in Morogoro District, Tanzania. Shakira is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to students in her nearby secondary school. 

She is also running a business selling women’s clothes known locally as Vitenge and Kanga. Profits that Shakira obtains from her business help her to buy household goods and expand her business. 

She requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by adding a variety of clothes to her shop. She plans to use her profits to buy additional clothing in bulk.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding varieties of   clothes in her shop

loans.name: Brenda Leticia

texts.es: Brenda, tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y es madre de un hijo quien tiene una edad de 4 años. Ella estudio únicamente la primaria ya que por la falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar, sus padres no pudieron seguir apoyándole. Ellos cultivan café una actividad que aprendió hace muchos años gracias a sus padres y hermanos y luego de casarse con su esposo dedicándose ambos a cultivar café ya que sus familias también se han dedicado a este rubro como única fuente de ingresos. En temporadas también cultivan granos básicos maíz y frijol pero no con el mismo auge que el café. Parte de la propiedad es por herencia y lo demás lo han adquirido gracias a sus ahorros ya que la cosecha cuando la sacan lista para vender busca como estrategia el mejor precio de compra. Sus metas dar el mantenimiento adecuado a su plantación de café ya que quedo un poco dañada después que paso la roya y si es posible sembrar unas dos manzanas de tierra inculta para completar 2.5 ayudando esto a generar más ingresos y así producir más café mejorando las ganancias y generar mejores ganancias. Para su hijo, ella desea que estudie, se prepare y estudie la carrera que al mejor le parezca para que pueda superarse en la vida y ser un hombre preparado.
texts.en: Brenda is 26 years old; she is married and she is the mother to a son who is 4 years old. She only studied in primary school, and due to financial resources she was unable to go any further, as her parents could not continue supporting her. They grow coffee, which she learned to do many years ago thanks to her parents and brothers. After she got married to her husband, they both began making a living growing coffee, because their families had also made a living in this field as a source of income. In the right season they also grow basic grains such as corn and beans, but not as much as coffee. Part of the property is inherited, and they acquired the rest thanks to their savings and the harvest when they pick it, ready to sell and by looking for the best buying price as a strategy. Their goals are the appropriate upkeep of their coffee plantation, as it was somewhat damaged after being worn away, and if possible, to plant two apple trees in the countryside to complete 2.5 This would help to generate more income, and thus to produce more coffee, which would improve income. She wants her son to study, and prepare himself by studying for a degree which would best help him to excel in life and be a prepared man.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers (over 100) to apply to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of produce.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has three children; two of whom attend school. She also cares for her brother’s child. Grace lives with her husband and children in their own house which was built by her husband. She attended school until level 8 and then was forced to drop out because she could not afford the school fees. She started her food business in 2000 with capital $100 and has managed the business to date.

She seeks a loan to increase her stock and sell it in wholesale and retail.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business.

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mr. El S. O. is 63 years old and works weaving clothes near a market in Phnom Penh.  He earns $4/day in this job, and his wife operates a small grocery store out of their home which helps with the family income.  El S. O. and his wife have 6 children, 2 of whom work in a garment factory and 4 of whom are still students.  The couple spends a lot of money supporting their 4 children in schoO., and they would like to take a loan out to purchase 10 weaving machines.  The machines will be used to increase Mr. El S. O.'s business as he will be able to hire workers for each machine.  In the future, the family plans on building homes to rent to garment factory workers.

loans.use: To purchase 10 weaving machines

loans.name: Christian De Jesus

texts.es:
"I have an internet cafe in my home and would like to invest in stationery and office supplies since my clients have asked me for them and I don't have any to sell. If I do, I think that my sales will increase and therefore, my income as well. I am seeking a loan of $1200 to buy more merchandise for my business."

Translated from Spanish from Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo un ciber en mi casa y me gustaría invertir en la compra de material escolar y de oficina, ya que mis clientes me lo han solicitado y no tengo nada de eso en venta, pienso que mis ventas aumentarían mucho y por lo tanto mis ingresos también. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar mercancía para mi negocio."

loans.use: to invest in my business

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: The 23-year-old Makerita, from the village of Vaimoso, just joined SPBD 3 weeks ago. She is a single mother of one child. She is looking forward to this loan which she hopes will allow her to start up her barbecue business. She plans to use her earnings to help her family and also for her child’s schooling.  She plans to run her barbecue on Wednesdays and Fridays. She expects to earn $60 profit daily.

loans.use: To buy mutton flaps, turkey tails, potatoes, plastic plates, and other supplies for her BBQ business

loans.name: Thi Binh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Binh, 39 years old, is married and have 3 kids, all of whom are currently going to school. She is a very active woman. In the morning, she goes to the market to sell pork, then in the afternoon she comes back to work on her frog-raising business. Her family has 8 frog-cages which start continuously so there are always big frogs to sell. She usually sells them to local restaurants. Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whoL. family. Mrs. Binh would like to request some loan to expand her business, increase family income and will use the profit generate from the business to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bình 39 tuổi, đã có chồng và có 3 con đang đi học. Chị là người phụ nữ khá năng động. Buổi sáng chị đi chợ bán thịt lợn, chiều về chị nuôi ếch tại nhà. Gia đình chị có 8 chuồng ếch nuôi gối nhau nên trong nhà lúc nào cũng có ếch lớn để bán. Chị thường bán cho các nhà hàng lân cận. Tuy nhiên, quy mô nuôi còn nhỏ nên chưa đủ cung cấp. Chị vay vốn để nuôi thêm, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình và sẽ sử dụng tiền thu được từ việc kinh doanh ếch để hoàn vốn đúng kỳ hạn.

loans.use: Mua thêm ếch để nuôi / Buy more frogs to expand the business

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born at Bè in Lomé (Togo), Mr. Kodjo A. is a bicycle mechanic. He lives in Hédzranawoé-Sokpanou in Lomé with his wife who does not work outside the home and their two children. As the only breadwinner for his family, Mr. Kodjo A. does not know where to turn to satisfy everyone's needs. He does not have capital to invest in buying more sophisticated tools or the spare parts he needs to sell to his customers. He would like to receive a loan of US$ 800 to use as business capital so that he can improve the service he offers his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né à Bè à Lomé et âgé de 24 ans, Monsieur Kodjo A. est un mécanicien à deux roues. Il habite le quartier Hédzranawoé-Sokpanou à Lomé avec sa femme sans emploi et leurs deux (02) enfants. Se trouvant seul face aux besoins de sa famille, monsieur Kodjo A. ne sait à quel saint se vouer pour pouvoir les satisfaire tous. De même, il manque de fonds pour se procurer des matériels de travail bien sophistiqués et des pièces de rechange qu’il vendait à sa clientèle. Il aimerait avoir un crédit de $800 comme fonds de roulement et d’équipement pour améliorer le service qu’il offre à sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Procuring spare parts for bicycles for re-sale

Ravitaillement en pièces détachées

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Z. Shavkat is 27 years old and married.

Since he was 15 years old, Shavkat has been working in the livestock sector. Currently he has ten cows. Once every two months he sells the raised cows and buys young ones for breeding. The mother of Shavkat helps him in the business. The business generates the main income for the family. 

Today Shavkat requests a loan of 600.00 US Dollars over a term of 12 months which he will use to purchase another cow. This is the first loan of Shavkat and he is sure he shall be able to pay it back on time and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
For the past 5 years Ramón has worked as a security guard at the Treasury and Public Finance Ministry, where he works 12-hour shifts daily. The income he receives allows him to maintain his family decently. His wife takes care of household chores and raising their son.

This family lives in a housing project, their home is small and shows signs of deterioration because they have not been able to make any improvements due to lack of resources. It is urgent for this family to build a wall on the left side of their house, which currently is in poor condition. Because this part of their house is open, with no security or protection, Ramón fears that delinquents will break in and take all of their possesions which he has worked so hard to obtain.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Don Ramón tiene 5 años de desempeñarse como guarda de seguridad en el Ministerio de Hacienda y Crédito Público, trabaja por turno de 12 horas diarias, los ingresos que percibe este señor le ha permitido mantener a la familia con decoro, su esposa realiza los quehaceres del hogar y la manutención de su hijo.

Esta familia habita en un asentamiento, su vivienda es pequeña, presenta malas condiciones debido a que no han podido mejorar por completo la vivienda por la falta de recursos, la urgencia de esta familia es de construir el muro lateral del costado izquierdo de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones. Al tener esa parte de la casa abierta, sin seguridad ni protección, el señor teme que los delincuentes se le metan a despojarlos de sus pertenencias que tanto trabajo le ha costado obtener.

loans.use: Buy cinder blocks, sand, rocks and metal to build a wall.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Since she was young Rita has done many different jobs, and now she is married and has 4 kids, she has even more reason to work hard for her beloved family. She has joined with her sister to make bricks, and she has seen the possibility to go it alone as in a short time she has made many acquaintances in the city. Rita would like a loan to put together a workshop in her small home and to start to work independently.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

RITA, es una mujer que desde joven estuvo desempeñándose en diversos trabajos, ahora que se ha convertido en esposa y madre de 4 hijos tiene mayores razones para desempeñarse en bien de su amada familia. Se ha asociado con su hermana para elaborar ladrillos y ha observado la posibilidad de independizarse ya que en poco tiempo se han hecho muy conocidas en su ciudad. Rita solicita un préstamo para ambientar un taller en su pequeña casita e iniciar su labor de manera independiente.

loans.use: To get a workshop to make bricks/Implementación de un taller para elaborar ladrillos

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Dương Thị Tình is 40 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2007. She is married and has 2 school aged children. They used to be farmers before. Since joining TYM, they use the loan to start up a glass & frame shop. With hard work and determination, they had steadily built up their business. They sell out all the stock that they produce. Their living condition has improved. On average, their monthly income is 200-250 USD. This year, everything has gone up in prices. Mrs Tình is seeking a loan of 575 USD to buy glass & aluminum.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Tình, 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước đây gia đình chị Tình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Sau khi vay vốn, chị đầu tư vào việc đóng khung nhôm kính. Nhờ chịu khó học hỏi, tích lũy kinh nghiệm nên chất lượng sản phẩm ngày càng được nâng cao. Hàng làm ra đều được tiêu thụ hết, đời sống gia đình được nâng lên. Bình quân thu nhập hàng tháng của cửa hàng từ 200-250USD. Năm nay giá thành nguyên vật liệu đang tăng, chị Tình muốn vay 575USD để mua thêm nhôm, kính làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy aluminum and glass

loans.name: Trezia

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Trezia M..  She is married, and has two children ages 1 and 8. In 2004, Trezia established her general store business. Trezia has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, water, juice, oil, sugar, and soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soda, water, juice, oil, sugar, and soap in bulk.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Mr. Ousmane Cissé is a 22-year-old young man, single, and without children. He lives with his parents and his five brothers and sisters in the Sécoura district of the city of Ségou. Despite attending school regularly, he used to work in small-scale commerce at the same time with his brother. Tending towards commerce, he quit school to become specialized in selling various goods, something he has been doing for almost 13 years.

Familiar with Soro Yiriwaso through his mother, Mr. Cissé is on his first loan. Already having operating capital, he intends to use this loan to buy three sacks of sugar, two boxes of tea, two boxes of pasta, five boxes of soap, and other different articles for his shop located along an easily accessible boulevard. He gets his inventory locally and in a few rare instances in Bamako, from specialized wholesalers. His great experience, the look of his shop, and the diversity of articles has resulted in Mr. Cissé earning loyal customers and realizing significant sales. He expects to increase his monthly profit with the support of this loan and to earn 60,000 francs CFA.

For the future, he expects to have another shop in another district and to invest in hydrocarbons.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mr Ousmane Cissé est un jeune homme de 22 ans célibataire sans enfant et vivant avec ses parents et ses 5 frères et sœurs dans le quartier Sécoura de la ville de Ségou. Malgré sa fréquentation de l’école, il faisait du petit commerce parallèlement en compagnie de son frère. Ayant eu le goût du commerce, il abandonna les études pour se spécialiser dans la vente d’articles divers depuis bientôt 13 ans.

Ayant connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa mère, Monsieur Cissé est à son premier prêt. Disposant déjà d’un fonds de commerce, Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat de 3 sacs de sucre,2 cartons de thé ,2 cartons de pâtes alimentaire 5 cartons de savon et différents autres articles pour sa boutique située au bord d’un boulevard avec un accès facile. Il s’approvisionne sur place et quelques rares fois à Bamako auprès de grossistes spécialisés. Sa grande expérience, la présentation de sa boutique et la diversité des articles font que Monsieur Cissé fidélise sa clientèle et réalise des ventes importantes. Il compte augmenter son bénéfice mensuel avec l’apport de ce prêt et atteindre 60 000 CFA.

Pour l’avenir il compte avoir une autre boutique dans un autre quartier et s’investir dans l’hydro carbure.

loans.use: To buy boxes of different articles

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana baji is the wife of N. A.. She has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, for the last 9 years. She is the mother of four children: three daughters and a son. Her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her son is a driver by profession. Ramzana baji has an animal food business and she also takes care of her children. Her husband has a soft drink business. Ramzana baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan for her new business which is a cloth selling business.

Ramzana baji is joined in her loan group by a few other members. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy animal food (wheat fiber). Safia baji wants a loan to buy more garments for her garment business. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Roma baji wants a loan to buy a chopping machine for her sugarcane business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel C. is from the municipality of Condega, of the city of Esteli, and he has been working for the past 10 years in agriculture and cattle; he is well known as a small producer in his community. His young son is the motivation for his many efforts and the reason why he is always looking for ways to work hard and get ahead.

He has applied to Ceprodel with the goal of obtaining a loan to buy cattle and to invest in his crops. He confidently waits for his loan to be approved; in this way he and his family will benefit.

Translated by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Manuel C. es originario del municipio de Condega y se dedica desde hace 10 años a la actividad de ganadería y agricultura destacándose como pequeño productor en su comunidad. Su pequeño hijo es el motivo de sus múltiples esfuerzos y por este motivo busca la manera de trabajar fuertemente para salir adelante.

Hoy en día él acude a Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito para la compra de ganado e inversión en la agricultura. Por este motivo es que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado y así podrá beneficiarse tanto él como su familia.

loans.use: To buy cattle and invest in his agriculture

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad. Eulogia es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, su casa esta ubicado en el distrito de Carmen Alto, Eulogia junto a su hijo se dedica a la elaboración de bellos tejidos en telar como pasadizos, individuales, para lo cual utilizan lana de ovino, y también confeccionan gorros, correas, carteras, cojines que luego son bordados para lo cual cuenta con trabajadoras a quienes renumera de acuerdo a su producción, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad a través de pedidos y en algunas oportunidades lo venden en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja su hijo.

Eulogia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, hilo y tintes. Eulogia sueña con mejorar su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales, producir más tejidos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of "Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad". She is married, 42 years old and has 3 children. Her house is located in the district of Carmen Alto. Eulogia, together with her son, makes beautiful woven fabrics such as ponchos and place mats for which she uses lamb's wool, and she also makes hats, belts, wallets, and pillows which are embroidered by workers who need to be paid according to their production. She sells her products through orders at the local craftworks market and sometimes she sells in the town of Lima when her son travels there.

Eulogia needs a loan of 1000 soles to be invested in buying wool, yarn and dye. Eulogia dreams of improving her house, of her children becoming professionals, of making more fabrics, and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, yarn, and dye to increase production of woven fabrics.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed owns a small store in the market where he sells furniture. He sells sofas, chandeliers and windows.

Now he wants to expand his business by borrowing money. He is asking for $500 to grow his business. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture to sell

loans.name: Sakina Ghulam Rasool Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a 54-year-old lady and has lived in a city named Shah Rukn, Pakistan for the past 50 years. Sakina baji’s husband is G. R. and he is a mason. She has four sons.Two sons are cobblers and make shoes, and the other two are daily wage laborers. Sakina baji has been a hardworking seamstress for the past 20 years. She charges $2 to $3 for her services and successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (leather, nails and shoe polisher) to expand her sons' shoe making business.  

She is joined in her loan group by: Tasleem baji who requests a loan to buy more clothes to sell for her business;  Zareena baji who requests a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop; Nasreen Akhtar baji who requests a loan to buy a motor bike for her motor bike rental business; and  Afshan baji who requests a loan to buy plastic bottles and papers for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for shoe making

loans.name: Pierre

texts.fr: Né vers 1973 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur   A. Pierre est marié et père de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisés. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GM SENABLO DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 180 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. Pierre A. is married and the father of 5 children, of whom 3 attend school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the GM Senablo group of Glahouna.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the Ouémé River is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay laborers who are indispensible to them in getting their land sown.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Pierre A. has requested a loan of 180,000 F CFA which will allow him to farm about 2 hectares, growing the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 2 hectares in corn and hot peppers

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: El señor Dionisio Busto A.,  tiene la edad de 46 años habita en el barrio San Ignacio ubicado en La Concepción, junto a su compañera de vida, ella no trabaja pero le apoya con la agricultura , ellos tienen cincos hijos todos mayores de edad los cuales le aportan  con los gastos de la casa , el desde hace veinte  años se dedica a la agricultura , se siente muy contento con el apoyo de Afodenic ya que a través de sus financiamiento a logrado establecer mas cultivos ya que le han asesorado para que aplique sus insumos en tiempo y forma para que obtenga los resultados que lo tienen muy contento. Con la solicitud de crédito va comprar insumos agrícola para tener una buena producción y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Dionisio Busto A. is 46 years old and lives in the San Ignacio district of La Concepción. He lives with his partner, who doesn't work but helps him with farming. They have five adult children who help them with their living expenses. Dionisio has worked in farming for 20 years, and is very happy with the support of Afodenic, as thanks to the loans he has received he has been able to plant more crops. He has been advised to use agricultural supplies such as fertilizers leading to better results, which makes him very happy. He will use this loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to have a good harvest and be able to sell his crops for a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies including crop fertilizers

loans.name: Irsalat

texts.ru: Эрматова Ирсалат женщина 48 лет , мать шестерых детей, муж работает в колхозе трактористом. Ирсалат занимается откормом скота, в основном коровами.Сейчас у неё 4 дойные коровы. которые дают в день 20 литров молока.Для покупки корма и ещё двух коров она решила взять кредит.Днём Ирсалат выводит коров на поле , а вечером они сами возвращаются.Поэтому при мониторинге нам не удалось снять на фотографии её коров.На снимке Ирсалат в день выдачи.Но при отчёте обязятельно её скот будет на фото.
texts.en:
Irsalat E. is 48 years old and the mother of six children. Her husband drives a tractor at the collective farm. Irsalat raises livestock, cows in particular. At present she has four dairy cows, which produce 20 liters of milk a day. She has decided to take out a loan to purchase feed and two more cows. During the day Irsalat puts the cows out to pasture, and in the evening they return home, therefore when MLF MicroInvest visited it was not possible to photograph her cows. Irsalat's photograph was taken the day the loan was disbursed, however the cattle will certainly be in the photograph when the accounting is done.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg S. is married with two children. Her family lives in a "ger" (a traditional nomadic Mongolian home) on a plot of land, that the family owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest son, Buyant, is studying in Erdenet city to become a Buddhist monk. Her youngest son, Buyanbat, is studying in elementary school in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband, Lutbaatar, works in construction. However, construction work for the most part only takes place during the warmer months in Mongolia. Temperatures far below zero make it nearly impossible to work in winter. In the cold months, he stays at home and makes wooden chairs and plates to sell. 

Their family used to live in Erdenet city before 2005, but moved to Ulaanbaatar to improve their living conditions. As soon as they moved, Oyunbileg began to run a retail business. She bought a retail stall to sell socks and other small items in "Narantuul," the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. She is planning to expand her business by buying another stall at the same market. With her loan, Oyunbileg will invest in more socks, which she buys from wholesalers.

Oyunbileg is a very polite and humble person. Oyunbileg said, in Mongolian, that "I and my husband are thinking about buying another piece of land from our future business profits."

loans.use: To buy more socks to invest in her retail business

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Titi A N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children between the ages of 12 and 23. Titi has been running an African traditional cloth business  since 2006. She sells African traditional cloth called “VITENGE”. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Titi currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the stock. Titi thanks you for her support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase stock of vitenge in bulk

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs to her customers within her community in Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cereza Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Linda Urania F. L., Suyen de los Angeles H. S. y María Milagros A. M. .

El grupo solidario Cereza está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías. 

Doña Linda Urania es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, vende en el mercado municipal comidas derivadas del cerdo como caldos de carne. El crédito lo usó para comprar cerdos en pie y luego procesar los caldos, así como especies y bolsas de plástico. Ella es madre de un hijo pequeño y su esposo es carpintero y le ayuda con los gastos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia.

Doña Suyen de los Angeles es una joven mujer vende helados, gaseosas, frescos, con esta actividad ayuda a los gastos del hogar, con el crédito compro frutas, azúcar, bolsas. Sus ventas se han mejorado porque ofrece de todos los sabores. Su esposo le ayuda ya que vende truchas en Costa Rica y viaja tres veces a la semana.

Doña María Milagros vende productos varios como: pan, café, leche preparada, etc.es casada pero no tiene hijos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda para cuando tenga un hijo. Con el crédito ella ha logrado capitalizarse en su negocio.

El grupo está comprometido con quedar bien a Adim para seguir obteniendo créditos y seguir trabajando mejor.
texts.en:
The Cereza group has three members, all of whom come from Masaya city. They are, as seen left to right in the photo, Linda Urania F. L., Suyen de los Angeles H. S. and María Milagros A. M.. They began borrowing from Adim after speaking with other members of the bank who assured them that they could have access to loans despite not having any collateral. Doña Linda Urania is the group's coordinator and she runs a business selling meals in the local market. She makes many types of pork dishes, including stews. She will use this loan to buy live pigs, which she will butcher for her stews. Linda's husband is a carpenter and supports her business. Together, they have a young son. Linda dreams of bettering her quality of life so that she and her family are more secure. Doña Suyen de los Angeles is a young woman who sells ice cream, soft drinks and juices, thus contributing to her household's income. With this loan she will buy fruit, sugar, and plastic bags. Her sales are continually increasing because she offers a large variety of flavours. Her husband has also been doing well. He sells trout in Costa Rica and travels there three times a week in order to do so. Doña María Milagros sells a variety of products like bread, coffee, milk etc. She is married but has no children. She dreams of having her own home for when she has a child. She will use this loan as working capital for her business. As a whole, the group is committed to keeping in good stead with Adim so that they can continue receiving loans and bettering their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and a variety of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Zaitunamo

texts.en: N. Zaitunamo is a married woman and the loving mother of three children. She is an active entrepreneur selling clothing for women. She has a circle of loyal clients and a variety of merchandise in her shop. She has gained rich experience working in this sphere of trade for the last five years. All of Zaitunamo's business endeavors have been characterized by commitment and reliability. She tries to please each of her customers’ tastes and is always seeking to expand the assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her shop. She started this business on her own, but now her children are actively helping her run this family venture. Today Zaitunamo is requesting a loan of $1400 to re-stock her inventory and continue expanding her trade. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Milafe

texts.en:
Milafe O. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 49 years old. Milafe is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Milafe owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Milafe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Milafe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milafe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Milafe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Milafe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme  est mariée, elle n’a pas d’enfants, elle aide beaucoup son  mari dans les charges du foyer. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a ouvert à cet effet une boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS ASSACK ». sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, elle veut agrandir son stock pour mieux les servir c’est pour cela qu’elle demande un crédit à WAGES pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs , 5 bidons d’huile de 25 litres, 2 cartons de tomates en boîtes de conserve et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman is married but has no children. She helps her husband a lot in paying household expenses. She sells foodstuffs to earn money. To do this, she has opened a little store that she calls « ETS ASSACK ». Her clientele is growing by the day, so she wants to expand her inventory to better serve them. That is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 5 sacks of maize, 5 jerry cans of 25 liters of oil, two cases of tinned tomatoes, and various other grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery inventory for resale

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 36, es una mujer muy sencilla y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Roger 10 y Samaith de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy niña le gustó trabajar, actualmente tiene un puesto de mercería en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en el cual vende botones, cremalleras y otro artículos similares. Magdalena es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe con una sonrisa a las personas que concurren a su negocio y refiere que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo, puesto que el camino a sus metas no es sencillo. Espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo préstamo de Magdalena con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea implementar mejor su puesto y ofrecerle una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 36, is a very unassuming and responsible woman. She lives in her own house with her two children; Roger is 10, and Samaith is 2. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. She has liked to work since she was a little girl. She currently has a notions stand in the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells buttons, zippers, and similar items. Magdalena is a cheerful sales lady, and she always greets her customers with a smile. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers. She has had this business for ten years. The hardest part for her is having to stay in her stand all day. Even so, she knows she has to do it because the road to her goals is not easy. In the future she hopes to expand her business and get improved earnings. This is Magdalena’s seventh loan with MFP. She expects to be able to pay it on time. She does not want to cause problems with the other members of her Community Bank, where she is well liked and respected. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to improve her stand and offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 35 years old. She is married and has one child. She raises and sells poultry. She is hoping for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more poultry to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa T.  is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Tuanai A.  She is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Palepa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Palepa has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Palepa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Palepa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Palepa is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business.   Palepa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 43 years old. She is married and has four daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. Mercy lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Mercy has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Su fuerza  y su anhelo de salir adelante y progresar, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Las ganancias que genera a diario, la ayuda al ingreso económico  en su familia. 

Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Aurelia, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y prepararse para hacer frente a las adversidades de la vida  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Aurelia belongs to the communal bank “Picota,” in the District of Picota, Picota Province, Department of San Martin. She is married, 53 years old and is a mother of 3 children, all of whom are independent. Her strength and desire to succeed and progress motivated her to start her own grocery business. Her business is located in her house and is very well equipped to serve her customers. The revenue that she generates daily helps with the financial income of her family. From its inception to date the business has been gaining customers and currently has regular customers who come to the house daily to make purchases and it is she who personally attends to them with her characteristic charm. With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN she will buy bags of rice and sugar, packaged noodles, canned fish, cartons of milk from a variety of brands, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products to continue giving her customers the best attention.

Aurelia feels very strongly about continuing to work and prepared to face the adversities of life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in their own spheres.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase inventory

loans.name: Mary Joe

texts.en:
Mary Joe V. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. She is 21 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. Mary Joe has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 pesos a month.

In 2009, Mary Joe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mary Joe is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Yoisiy Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal “8 de Septiembre” del distrito de Acora, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01  hijo, vive en el Sector Suancata, estudio educación superior.

La señora inicia su trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. y su préstamo inicial es de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permite incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de abarrotes por tanto ella va a comprar  arroz, azúcar, huevos, galletas, golosinas diversas, aceite, etc para venderlo en su pequeña tienda.


Su mayor deseo es ejercer su carrera.

A ella le  gustan  las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maribel is a member of the September 8th Communal Bank which is located in the District of Acora, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 1 child. Maribel lives in the region of Suancata and is currently pursuing a college education.

She just started working with Manuela R.. Her initial loan of 500 soles will enable her to increase the capital for her grocery business. Maribel plans to buy rice, sugar, eggs, cookies, different varieties of candy, cooking oil, and other products to sell in her small shop. Her greatest wish is to pursue a career. Maribel enjoys the simplicity of managing her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, eggs, cookies, candy, cooking oil, and other products

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona has three children; the eldest is 21 years old. Alona is 43 years old and married to Porforio. She works hard for her family, especially for her children’s education. She ventured into the rice farming business and has asked for a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She needs 12,000  PHP to fund her farm. Receiving this loan will be truly helpful to Alona and her family.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Rosa Elmira

texts.es: La señora Rosa Elmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Diamantes”, Distrito de Eslabon, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Comidas y lleva 12 años en el negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y pensionistas. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Elmira is a member of the communal bank called Los Diamantes (The Diamonds), located in the Eslabon District of Huallaga in San Martin. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children who attend school. Rosita, as she is affectionately called, has been preparing and selling meals for the last 12 years. She runs her business from her home, where she set up a small restaurant to serve her customers. Rosa is well known and liked, and her daily business is good thanks to the delicious meals she prepares. She is very content with the work she does each day, personally attending to her customers with the charisma she is known for. With this loan, she will purchase more of the ingredients she uses each day, such as rice, oil, chickens, vegetables, as well as some utensils to provide better service to her customers. Rosa feels full of energy and is motivated to continue working towards her goal of having her own well stocked grocery store. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the support they provide to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her small restaurant business

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana M. trabaja como docente desde hace veinte años, durante el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda, logro poner una pulpería que con ayuda de su esposo y ahorro comenzó, luego con prestamos en  Afoenic para incrementar el inventario y vender con la variedad de productos. Tiene 62 años y su esposo es guarda de seguridad, procreo tres hijos de los cuales trabajan y ayudan con los gastos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz, teléfono. Con este préstamo quiere comprar zinc y cambiar el viejo ya que en invierno se le pasa mucho el agua y desea mejorar esta necesidad en su casa, solo gracias al financiamiento de la institución ha logrado poder hacer todos estos logros por el plazo y sus bajos intereses que ha muchos hogares le ha cambiado para una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Juana M., 62, has been a teacher for 20 years. During this time she has managed to make improvements on her house. She set up a small, general store with which she helps her husband with household expenses and she began to have some savings. Then, with loans from Afodenic she managed to increase stock and sell a variety of products. Her husband is a security guard. They have three children who are employed and help pay household utilities. With this loan she wants to buy zinc metal sheeting to replace her roof because in Winter it leaks and she wants to improve this aspect of her house. It has been solely thanks to help from the institution that she has managed to meet her goals because the terms and interest rates are such that they have helped many homes change for the better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting to replace roof.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 38 años, es madre de cuatro hijos (2 mayores de edad), es casada y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde su casa, por tal debe levantarse temprano y preparar los platos que ofrece a sus clientes (caldo de gallina, tallarines, asado de pollo, lomo saltado).
Carmen forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos con los que comprò productos de belleza para vender.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1400.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para implementar su pequeño restaurante(compra de sillas, mesas, platos, manteles)y a la vez para comprar productos para el restaurante(aceite, arroz, azúcar, etc). 
La meta de Carmen es tener un restaurante màs grande y una tienda de abarrotes en general(venta al por menor).
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a dynamic hard working woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children (2 are adults). She is married and depends on her husband who is a farmer. She sells food from her home and she must get up early every day to prepare the dishes that she sells to her customers (chicken soup, noodles, grilled chicken, meat stew). Carmen has been a part of the "Las Rosas" communal bank for the past two years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to invest in beauty supplies for resale. She is asking for a loan of 1400 PEN ($500) to start a small restaurant (buy chairs, tables, plates, tablecloths) and also to invest in supplies (cooking oil, rice, sugar, etc.). Carmen's goal is to have a larger restaurant and a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant furniture and supplies.

loans.name: Todjiddin

texts.en:
M. Todjiddin is 25 years old. He is married but has no children yet. He has been running his own business for 4 years. He sells perfume for women and men, air fresheners, tooth pastes and brushes. Todjiddin is the client of IMON since June 2007 and has neither violations nor delinquencies in payment of the loans. Today Todjiddin requests 12200 Somoni as he is planning to expand his business and increase his capital, and after receiving this large income, he would like to thank all those supporting him, and promises to pay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
la señora Ana Lilian C. R. tiene 32 años de edad y esta casa con el señor Jose Antonio 
Cruz, quien se desempeña como pastor de la iglesia cristo salva, tienen 3 hijos y los tienen estudiando, Ana se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 2 años y la vende en la comunidad de Laure Abajo San Lorenzo, solicita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia ya que en la epoca de navidad vendio mucho producto y casi no tiene en inventario. las ganancias que obtuvo en navidad las invirtio en su casa de habitacion y sus hijos.
necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Lilian C. R. is 32 and is married to señor Jose Antonio Cruz, who is a pastor. They have 3 children, who are in school. Ana has sold new clothing for 2 years in the Laure Abajo San Lorenzo neighborhood. She is requesting a credit to buy more merchandise since she sold a lot of her product during the Christmas season and she almost doesn't have any inventory left. She used the profits that she made during Christmas to invest in her home for her children. She needs a credit to be able to take care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys, children's clothing, socks, skirts, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plumbing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly M. (pictured above), is a 55-year-old widow with two sons and four daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, while another is a garment factory worker and other two attend university and high school respectively. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Ly has been a farmer since 1979, growing rice and vegetables on her farmland in the village. She hopes to continue increasing the volume of her productivity and so is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed for her farm.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a 44-year-old farmer and a married father of three children, aged 11, 15, and 16 years. He lives near Murang'a in the Central Province of Kenya. Arthur cultivates a mixed crop and is also a dairy farmer, selling his milk to the Wanjengi Dairy. He has been farming for 20 years but also earns some extra income as a carpenter. The challenge to his business is managing fluctuations in price and demand in the milk market.
Arthur successfully repaid a previous loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 25,000 KES. He has requested a new loan of 31,800 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says that Juhudi Kilimo is doing an incredible job of helping low-income farmers to acquire assets. With the additional income he will earn from the new dairy cow, he believes he will be able to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mrs. La Lach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 13 people who all live in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. La L. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes. 
Mrs. La L. and her husband, Mr. Seng Yorn, are farmers who hire a plot of land to grow vegetables to sell in order to support their family. Although they work hard, they do not earn sufficient income. Therefore, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. La L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in a local public school, while the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Kitoola Womens Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
With benefit of hindsight, 29-year-old N. Harriet carried early firm conviction that she could not fail in her first business endeavour. She felt she owed it to herself not to falter like many of her colleagues had, trying to take root in business. Just like her father who battled all odds to succeed in business, she had to blaze her own trail and true to her word she did.

It is ten years down the road since she began her beauty salon business in Kitoola, Lugazi. She and her family have been basking in the glow of this business since then. Downsides have been there in her business but she has managed to nip them in the bud with the assistance of friends.

Harriet’s well-rounded experience has helped her a great deal as she plans and consolidates for the future. All her five children are now in school. She is also happily married to her husband of seven years.

In a month, Harriet says she earns to the tune of 200,000 shillings and is anticipating a scenario where she will be able to significantly improve on her business operations. With this loan, she is very upbeat that she will be able to bring some of her plans to bear. She wants to buy new salon equipment with the loan.

loans.use: To buy new salon equipment like hairdryers, shavers and weavers

loans.name: Mrs. Eng Ly Nget Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people who live in Ampil Lech village in Takeo province make up a village bank loan group. Mrs. Eng Ly N. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mrs. Eng Ly N. is a weaver and her husband, Mr. Roeurn Yen, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support his family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Thus to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Eng Ly N. is seeking a loan to buy silk. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a weaver, while another one is enrolled in local public school, and the youngest one is only three years old.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita B. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in the sale of spices and vegetables. She lives in Magsaysay St., Poblacion, Cauayan, Negros Occidental with her husband and their four adult children. Merlita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1991 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her spices and vegetables retail business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000. Merlita is now borrowing Php 29,500 so that she can use the loan as additional working capital for her spices and vegetables business. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 28,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Merlita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca tiene 42 años, es separada, tiene un hijo, juntos vive en casa de su madre que ya es anciana. Inicialmente vivía de manera precaria, con esteras y sin servicios básicos en este terreno, es por ello que se mudo a casa de su madre, de quien ahora Blanca se hace cargo. Es multifacética, parte de sus renumeraciones se ve reflejado en esta construcción que de a poco levantó  las vigas y paredes con el apoyo moral de su hijo, es así que durante 15 años viene forjando arduamente su fin.  Blanca está feliz  por sus logros, pronto retornaran con su hijo  a esta su casa y vivirá dignamente. Por el momento su mayor anhelo es que instalen el  agua y en seguida proseguirá  con el vaciado del piso de esta su casa. Este es primer crédito que tiene con MFP y sabe que este préstamo le será  muy beneficioso para el acabado del piso de su casa, por ello se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arena fina y bolsas de cemento, asimismo desea pagar el trabajo de albañil.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old, and she is separated. She has one child, and they live together in her elderly mother’s house. She initially lived on the land in a meager way with a straw mat and without basic services. That is why she moved to her mother’s house. Now Blanca takes charge of her mother. It is multifaceted. Part of her remuneration can be seen in this construction. A little while ago she raised the beams and the walls with her son’s moral support. During 15 years she has been arduously building towards the end. Blanca is happy with what she has achieved. She and her son will soon move to this house, and they will live decently. For the moment her greatest desire is to install water, and then she will build the floor in this house. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that this loan will be very helpful in finishing the floor of her house. She pledges to make all of her payments on time. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy fine sand and bags of cement. She also wants to pay the labor expenses for a bricklayer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand and bags of cement

loans.name: Lorna
