texts.en: Lorna L. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Lorna is single. To make a living, Lorna runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2006, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 26-year-old married man with three children.  His wife earns a living through tailoring while he does carpentry. He belongs to the Mijingo Self Help Group whose members guarantee each other's loans.  In the group, he also saves his money on a weekly basis.  

Edwin has been operating his business for three years. Because he wants to buy more timber and hardware tools, he has requested a loan of 20,000 KES.  He hopes to own a furniture showroom in the future.

loans.use: To buy more timber and hardware tools

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the village of Upper Disakan. She is 41 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Liloy-Upper Disakan, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Rolando; el socio tiene 38 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, el socio es natural de Puno,  El socio se  dedica a administrar su bodega, el tiene junto a su conyugue una bodeguita, es una especie de tienda abarrotes pero más surtida. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar e implementar su negocio.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rolando, 38, is a member of the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank; he lives in Urubamba, Cusco department. He lives with his significant other and their two children. He is originally from Puno. He and his spouse have a small store which he runs. It is sort of a grocery store but more widely stocked. He is asking for funds to increase the stock in his store. He values and appreciates the loan granted and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM  est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame Ndèye, debout à droite de la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe bleu claire, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de la vente de bétail constitué essentiellement de moutons. Elle fait ses transactions commerciales dans le marché hebdomadaire de sa localité qui se tient tous les lundis.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle aura la possibilité d’acheter régulièrement des moutons lors des marchés hebdomadaires afin de bien mener son activité de vente de bétail.

Son objectif est d’assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et de participer à l’achat de la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Bokk Jom was created on December 5, 2007. It is composed of eleven women who are all friends and neighbors living in the same village. The group uses the Village Bank, SIWAL. Mrs. Ndeye, in the front right of the photo, wrapped in a light blue scarf, is responsible for the group. She is fifty years old and a married mother of six children. She sells livestock, consisting mostly of sheep. She conducts these commercial transactions weekly in the local market that takes place every Monday. With her new loan she will have the possibility of buying sheep regularly for the weekly market, in order to better manage her business of selling livestock. Her goal is to be able to pay her children's school fees and to help buy food for her family.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and resell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence O. is 40 years old, married to Samuel and they have four children. They live in Katito town where Samuel has a taxi business to help with the upkeep of the family. Florence sells a local delicacy made out of wheat flour locally known as mandazi (a donut-like pastry). She is applying for her third loan from KADET to add more stock to her business including buying wheat flour and cooking oil. This will enable her to cook enough food to sell. Her customers normally consist of passersby in her neighborhood and the local hotels too. Her monthly income adds up to 10,000 Kenyan shillings per month. She is planning to use the profits to pay school fees for her school-going children. She hopes to see her business expand and to open up a hotel (restaurant) in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and flour to enable her to cook enough food for her clients

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel J. is a 58-year-old widow who lives in a house in Darhan-Uul city, Mongolia. Her two children, ages 26 and 22, are both are students and currently live and study in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. 

Narangerel operates a raw material trading business in her town, where she sells things like the intestines of livestock. She used to work as a specialist in Mah-Expo company between 1973 and 2002. She started her own business in 2000 with the help of her children and since then, she has built a successful and stable business operation. She processes livestock's intestines in her home. 

Her earnings are the only source of income in her family and they have enabled her to pay her daughters' tuition fees. 

Narangerel is a very modest and hardworking woman and says, “I wish to have my children (have) a good education and living accommodation as well as decent jobs." 

She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of cow intestines at a wholesale price for the upcoming busy season.

loans.use: To purchase large amount of intestines of cows

loans.name: Pot

texts.en:
[L. was not available, so her husband appears in the photograph instead.]

Pot L., 58, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. This area is known for pre-Angkorean Temples. L. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Three of their children are employed, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family spends USD 35 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.  

L. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more supplies to produce shoes to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: purchase more supplies to produce shoes

loans.name: Nafisha

texts.en: Nafisha G. is currently in the business of selling beans, bread and tomatoes at Gabat market and is requesting a loan to stock more bread and tomatoes to sell.  Nafisha is 48 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a concrete house and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bread and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Elvia Noemi

texts.es:
Elvia, reside en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán,  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, se dedica a la confección y venta de hamacas, tiene 28 años de edad, y de estar al frente de este negocio lleva 6 años trabajando todo el día, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre quien se lo enseño muy bien.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la confección de las hamacas como hilo de seda de diferentes colores, con esta inversión ella pretende incrementar su producción y sus ventas, ofreciéndoles a los clientes hamacas de diferentes colores y tamaños.
Su aspiración es mejorar su vivienda y dar a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que se preparen  y puedan optar por un estilo de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Elvia is 28 years old and lives in Delicias de Concepción in the department of Morazán with her husband and her two children, who are 8 and 10 years old.  She manufactures and sells hammocks.  She has had this business for six years, and she learned it from her mother, who taught her very well.

She is asking for this loan to purchase materials to manufacture hammocks, such as silk thread in different colors.  With this investment, she would like to increase her production and sales by offering her customers hammocks in different colors and sizes.

Her dream is to improve her home and give her children the necessary education so that they can choose a different way of life.

loans.use: Purchase silk thread

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is a 25 year old widow. To make a living, Jean owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish & shrimp in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jean is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Sara Yvanna

texts.es: La Sra. Sara vive en el municipio de el Torno,   es nacida en el departamento de Potosí, hace unos 20 años que se vino a la ciudad de santa cruz, trabajo desde muy pequeña ayudando a su Mama,  su actividad es la venta de bisutería en el mercado central de la comunidad, hace bastantes años que se dedica a esta actividad, su es poso con el cual tiene dos hijos , se dedica al transporte, de personas(taxi) hace unos 5 años; el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería de fin de año en cantidad  ya que las ventas se elevan y es en esta época que ella puede ahorrar algo de dinero ya que en los demás meses solo le alcanza para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Sara lives in the town of El Torno. She was born in the Potosi department and has been living in the city of Santa Cruz for about 20 years. From a very young age she worked helping her mother. She sells costume jewelry in the community's central market. She has been doing this work for many years. Her husband, with whom she has two children, has worked as a taxi driver for about five years. She will use this loan to buy merchandise for the end of the year in large quantities because her sales increase during this time of the year which allows her to save some money since during the rest of the year she only makes enough to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise by the dozen.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Reynaldo; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de minero que es un trabajo arduo y muy duro y por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de transporte que utiliza. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar un motor para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Reynaldo is 43 years old.  He lives with his partner and has two children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his job as a miner which is very hard work.  Through his work, Reynaldo gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to improve the transport service that he provides.

Reynaldo is requesting this loan to buy an engine for his car.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his car

loans.name: Kitita

texts.en:
Kitita K. is 45 years old. His wife is named Maria and together they are blessed with six children. Kitita is a farmer, and he has been doing this for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learnt about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming, so that he can increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land, and build a permanent home. Kitita is a rigorous man who can achieve more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Patrick Gerald

texts.en:
Patrick Gerald A. is fifty-one years old and married. He owns a tailoring shop in which he makes and repairs clothes for ladies, gents, and children. His business is located at Ondieki Estate near Kisumu Social Hall and is well-known as Lucky Tailoring.

Patrick has been in business for fourteen years now and has two employees. His business is profitable, but his major challenge is financial constraints. He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He plans to use his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more materials and a sewing machine so he can grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He also sees himself opening a college to impart skills to others. He describes himself as very focused, determined, and innovative.

loans.use: To buy materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Mary Mabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mary  tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 9 años los mismos que estudian  el mayor en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido es albañil.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta además también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja cinco días de la semana en  las tardes y el sábado que es cuando cobra sus productos trabaja todo el dia ya que deja a crédito. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Tosagua y también en Portoviejo porque allá es más barato.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas. Ella  esta en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos pero ya estuvo en otro Banco en Tosagua donde antes vivía. Sus sueños son tener un almacén y seguir creciendo en su negocio dia a dia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the "Virgen de Monserrate" communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto.  This location is well-known for its traditional culture and the fact that it is only minutes away from the best beaches in the province such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we find Mrs. Mary who is 34 years old and has a common-law marriage and three children ages 15, 11 and 9 who are all in school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She sells all kinds of clothing, based on customer orders, on a door-to-door basis and out of a small area in her home.  She works five days a week in the afternoons.  On Saturdays she goes around and collects payment for the orders she delivers on a credit basis.  She buys her merchandise in Tasagua and Portoviejo because it is less expensive there.

She plans to use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, lingerie and other articles.  She has been in the communal bank for four years and used to be in another one in Tosagua where she lived before.  Her dream is to grow her business and one day have a warehouse of her own.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothing, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Map

texts.en: Map I., 50, is a widow who resides in a district of Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. She is a good mother who takes care of two school-aged children, while another one is now married and lives independently. Map I. stays at home to do housework and cooks delicious meals for her children. The family is supported by her daughter, who earns income by providing small loans wI. specific repayment schedules to people who live nearby. Map I.’s son-in-law is a motorcycle taxi (tuk tuk) driver.  His motorbike and is getting old and he often spends his money on repair costs so many times. Map I. really wants to assist him, but she doesn’t enough money to do that.  So she has decided to ask for a loan of $1000, which she will use to buy a new motorcycle for her son-in-law so he can run his a taxi service as usual.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle for son-in-law's taxi business

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila A. is from the village of Santo Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Teofila is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Teofila owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling clothing and shoe products fron NATASHA, AVON & BOARDWALK in the local community. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Teofila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for resell like t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teofila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for resell like t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Alawally Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Alawally group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.
The leader of this group is Salamatu B.. Salamatu is aged 40. She was born in Kenema city where she lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children attend school. Salamatu sells shoes and has been in this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy dozens of shoes to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of shoes for resale

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a single-room brick house for the past nine years.

She is the mother of six children. Only two of them are able to attend school and get their education. Shahnaz is an embroidery expert and earns a reasonable amount of income every month from her community clients.  
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business of agriculture. He started this business six years ago. He grows different seasonal crops such as wheat and cotton.  

Through the loan, he will buy supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for getting maximum output from his work and to earn better profits. 

Shahnaz is very hopeful about the future growth of her husband’s business and about the better financial future of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Maria Liz Carina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Liz Carina de 29 años de edad, vive con el padre de su hijo Thiago Santiago de 8 meses de edad, la señora es comerciante de la ciudad de Villarrica y propietaria de una conocida casa de Venta y Reparación de celulares.
Además se dedica a la venta de accesorios electrónicos en general.
Su negocio es conocido en la zona por su buen inventario de mercaderías y ella es catalogada por su buen trato, gracias a su carisma posee clientela variada y abundante.
La señora agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por haberle aceptado como clienta de la institución y solicita este préstamo para poder adquirir un stock más variado de mercaderías, es decir, comprar más artículos electrónicos novedosos para la atracción y venta a las personas.
texts.en:
Maria Liz Carina is 29 years old.  She lives with the father of her son 8 month-old Thiago Santiago.  Maria is a saleswoman in the city of Villarrica and owns a well-known business selling and repairing cell phones.  She also sells general electronic gadgets.

Maria's business is well known in her area because of her good stock of merchandise.  She is also known for her good customer service.  Thanks to her charisma, she has a lot of customers.

Maria is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for having accepted her as a client.  She is requesting this loan so that she can acquire a greater variety of merchandise.  That is to say, she will buy more of the latest electronic appliances to attract customers who she will sell to.

loans.use: to buy electronic appliances

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de bebidas calientes como mates y también se dedica a la venta de artesanías, el negocio de venta de bebidas calientes lo vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de bebidas calientes y venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar las bebidas calientes y para comprar artesanías.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Paulina is a member of the communal bank "Mateo Pumacahua".  The bank is located in the district of Chinchero in the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.  

She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities between her business of selling hot drinks such as mates and her craft sales.  She sells her drinks in an itinerant manner and through these businesses she is able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand her hot drink and craft sales.  She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to prepare her hot drinks and to purchase crafts. 

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make hot drinks such as mates and to purchase crafts.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a talented lady who operates a sewing business to support her family financially. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son has a garment-selling business. The next one sells cosmetics while the youngest one has a clothes-selling business. They all work hard and contribute to their family financially from their earnings. 

Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her produce quality work and fulfill orders on time. She has been operating this business for many years. She has a lot of business contacts. She hopes that an investment will help her business to grow further. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application with Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene de 23 años, es soltero,  vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con solo servicio de luz  en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertnece al departamento de Piura. La zona se caracteriza por ser de mucha actividad agricola, ganadera y artesana.

Rene se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas está en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño ideal las ofrece en el mercado de Tambogrande y Piura.  Con eldinero que va adquirir por sus ovejas podrá atender sus necesidades personales.  Su padre le a dado en herencia unas tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1800 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados    asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales.  También lo utilizará para la compre de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y su producto.  Rene es una persona responsable y trabajadora con la única intensión de ayudar económica a sus padres en la casa como para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rene, 23, is single living in his parents’ house which only has electricity in Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  The area is known for having much farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

Rene has raised sheep for several years.  The corral holding his sheep is in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed like natural grasses and once they reach ideal size he sells them in the Tambogrande and Piura markets.  Money he gets from the sale of his sheep is used to cover his personal expenses.  His father has passed on some farmland to him where he grows lemons.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for an 1800 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed thus insuring good growth and development of his animals.  He will also use it to buy fertilizer to improve his farmland and thus his crop yields.  

Rene is a very responsible, hard working person whose only aim is helping his parents his parents economically at home to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and crop fertilizers.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha comes from the village of Kisiskhevi, Kakheti District, East Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, Ani and 18-year-old daughter. Ani is a housewife and their daughter goes to school. 

Vazha requested a loan to till and fertilize his plot, where vine tree saplings are grown. He grows saplings every year and then sells them. In addition, he has a 0.3-hectare plot of the land where he grows strawberries. The harvested strawberries are sold on the local market. Tilling and fertilizing is essential for the land in order to get quality saplings. 

In the future, Vazha plans to save for house renovation, as it is already old and needs some repair. In addition, he will pay the fee for his daughter's education.

loans.use: to pay for tilling of the land and to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Koko

texts.en:
Koko is into multiple businesses; hair dressing, selling cooking utensils, tops and jeans at Abura.  Koko went to a vocational school.  She is a single parent with a child. 

She is responsible for the well-being of the home.  Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to use on her customers hair.  Her new profit would be ploughed back into her businesses for further growth.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to use on her customers hair.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer de  41  años de edad. Es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos en el distrito de Lambayeque. En una comunidad pequeña de gente emprendedora y trabajadora. 

Josefina se dedica, desde hace 5 años,  a la venta de pescado fresco. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulatoria (a través de una mototaxi) o en un pequeño puesto ubicado en su propio domicilio. Josefina cuenta con clientela establecida, que se siente contentan con el producto y servicio que ella brinda.

Josefina tiene muchos deseos de superación y desea invertir en un segundo negocio. Es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar una mototaxi de segunda, que le permitirá iniciarse en este nuevo servicio de transporte público y también utilizarla para transportar su mercadería.

Josefina es una mujer trabajadora conocida por nuestra entidad y goza de un buen récord de pagos. Este crédito le permitirá seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de sus hijos poco a poco.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 41 year-old woman.  She is a single mother and lives with her two children in Lambayeque district.  She lives in a small community of entrepreneurial and hard-working people.

Josefina has been selling fresh fish for five years.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner (using a motorcycle taxi) or from a small stall located in her own home.  Josefina has an established customer base who feel happy with her products and the service she provides.

Josefina has a great desire to do well and she would like to invest in a second business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a used motorcycle taxi which would allow her to start out in a new business, providing a public transport service.  She would also use it for transporting her merchandise.

Josefina is a hard-working woman who is already known to our institution.  She has a good payment record.  This loan would allow her to continue gradually improving her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 34 years old and has two children. The eldest child is in class one and the second child is not of school-going age yet. Her husband works in the factory at a meager income. In order to fulfill the needs of her family, Samina does embroidery. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. She prepares beautiful dresses by crafting beautiful embroidered clothes. She also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well and has proved herself as a very responsible housewife. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk quantity, which will allow her to offer better quality work to her customers and earn more profits. She is very experienced in her work and has been doing it for past seven years. She hopes that an investment will bring even more profits to her and help improve the living standard of her family. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Samina.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 49 years old and has 5 children. Carolina is married and has 5 children who are in school.

Carolina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Carolina has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her pigs.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: David Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio David tiene 23 años de edad,  el socio es soltero; el socio es comerciante minorista, el socio compra y vende verduras, el socio tiene un proveedor que le abastece al mes  sus diferentes verduras como cebollas, espinacas, lechugas, tomates entre otras y el socio los vende en el mercado Virgen Asunta, el socio también es bailarin del centro Qosqo de arte nativa, el socio baila todos los días ene l teatrín para turistas en general. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras para la venta.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Siempre Unidos", meaning "Always Together". It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the market of Virgen Asunta, in the province and department of Cusco.

David is 23 years old and he is single. He is a retail merchant. He buys and sells vegetables. he has a provider that supplies him once per month with a variety of vegetables such as onions, spinach, lettuce, tomatoes and other products. He sells them in the Virgen Asunta market. He also a dancer in the Centro Qosqo of native arts. He dances every day in the theatre, primarily to a tourist audience. He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables for resale.

He is thankful for the support given to him and he is committed to making his loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of vegetables for resale.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia integrante del Banco comunal “Amaican” perteneciente a la comuna de Pudahuel, ciudad de Santiago. Se dedica al rubro de las costuras desde hace 8 años. Comenzó cosiendo con una máquina de coser básica, en la actualidad cuenta con una máquina de coser eléctrica.
Sus costuras principalmente son productos para el hogar, entre los cuales se encuentran cojines, almohadas, manteles, pañuelines, capas para perros y esclavinas (prenda en forma de capa), para la festividad de cuasimodo (celebración religiosa católica). 
Sus materiales los compra en un barrio en la comuna de Independencia, ya que estos son a bajo costo.
Con el crédito comprará telas, hilos, cintas y flecos, para sus confecciones.
Su horario de trabajo es flexible, sin embargo solo se dedica a las costuras de lunes a viernes. 
Comenta que le va muy bien. 
Sus metas en su negocio son tener algún día una paquetería, en la cual pueda ofrecer y vender todas sus confecciones. Además le gustaría tener una máquina overlock, para realizar sus costuras. 
María Eugenia vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos de 28 y 23 años de edad, además de un sobrino de 20 años de edad que proviene de Isla de Pascua. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son que terminen sus estudios para que logren ser unos profesionales, además María Eugenia fomenta la unión familiar, comenta que la familia es lo más importante. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos y servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, sobre todo por las capacitaciones, ya que le han servido para organizar su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy bueno, ya que tienen mucha tolerancia y respeto entre todos. 
Pudahuel es una comuna del sector poniente de Santiago (capital de Chile), región Metropolitana. Es un vocablo del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) que se traduce como “lugar donde se juntan las aguas” o “lugar de charcos”, debido a que posee una variada red fluvial compuesta por el río Mapocho y los esteros Lampa, Carén y Las Cruces, lo que favorece sus suelos para la producción agrícola por la existencia de abundante agua subterránea.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is a member of the village bank "Amaican" in the community of Pudahuel in Santiago. She has worked as a seamstress for 8 years. She began sewing with a basic sewing machine and now has an electric one. She mainly sews things for the home like cushions, pillows, tablecloths, handkerchiefs, cloaks for dogs and capes for the festival of Quasimodo (a Catholic religious celebration).  

She buys her materials in the neighborhood of Independencia where they are of lower cost. With her loan she will buy fabric, thread, tape and fringe for her creations. Her schedule is flexible, but she only works Monday to Friday. She says that it's going very well. 

Her goals for her business are to have one day have a parcel service through which she can offer and sell all of her products. She would also like to have an overlock sewing machine. 

Maria Eugenia lives with her husband and two children, ages 28 and 23, along with a nephew, 20, from Easter Island. Her dreams for her family are that they finish their studies and become professionals. She also encourages family unity and says that family is the most important thing. 

She is very happy and grateful for these loans and services from Fondo Esperanza, above all for the trainings that have helped her to organize her business. She thinks that her village bank is very good because they are very tolerant and respectful of each other. 

Pudahuel is a community in the western sector of Santiago (Chile's capital), in the metropolitan region. "Pudahuel" is a ord from mapudungun (the Mapuche language) that translates as "where the waters meet" or "place of puddles" because it has a network of rivers made up of the Mapocho river and the streams of Lampa, Carén and Las Cruces. The conditions for agriculture are favorable because of abundant subterranean water sources.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, tape and fringe for her garments.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing, 41 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns $5 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is working in the garment factory earning  $2.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $6 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to use to travel to work. She plans to have a new career besides doing farming but now doesn’t know what kind of career she can do yet. For her children, she wants to support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter

loans.name: Oosor

texts.en: Mr. Oosor is 51 years old and the father of three daughters. He lives with his wife and youngest daughter in an apartment that they just bought. He has been working for Ulaanbaatar Railway Company as a serviceman of the train for 15 years. His wife is an accountant in a private company. They have another apartment located on the first floor of the building, and it is possible to use it as a cafeteria. Oosor wants to renovate that apartment for a cafeteria business. He is requesting a loan to make renovations to this apartment.

loans.use: To make renovations to his apartment for a cafeteria.

loans.name: Raqif

texts.en: Raqif, a livestock breeder, lives with his family: his wife, two children and his parents. He purchases and resells cattle with his wife. Rafiq would like to request a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to purchase additional cattle to increase his inventory and meet customer demands. He believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for his family. In the future, Rafiq would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into his business to purchase additional cows and increase the family's income further.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Her primary crop is rice, for which she earns about 3,000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. She hopes this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Los Lagos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Lagos” lo conforman 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran locales establecidos con la venta de abarrotes, frutas secas, repostería, venta de joyas, perfumes, disfraces, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Luz integrante del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, en el lugar de en medio, vistiendo una chaqueta negra con cuello de chiporro blanco y quien además usa su cabello suelto. Ella se dedica a la vitrofusión (arte con vidrio fundido a gran temperatura) y también se dedica a comprar disfraces para arrendarlos. Se dedica a estos dos negocios desde hace 4 años. Vende y arrienda desde su casa y promociona sus productos y disfraces por internet.  
La materia prima la compra en vidrieras y los disfraces en tiendas comerciales y tiendas de remate. 
Comenta que las temporadas más altas de venta son a principio y final de año, el resto del año vende de manera esporádica.
Con el crédito comprará materiales para su negocio de vitrofusión, entre  vidrios catedrales de distintos colores, espejos, marcos, pegamento y para el negocio de disfraces comprará telas.
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido para ofrecer sus productos de artesanía y disfraces.
Luz vive junto a sus dos hijas de 25 y 9 años de edad, su hija mayor trabaja y estudia la carrera de educación diferencial y en sus ratos libres le ayuda a cortar vidrios. Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener mejores ingresos con sus negocios para postular al subsidio habitacional y concretar el sueño de su casa propia. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que están muy afiatados y se ha generado una relación de compromiso. 
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Los Lagos' and it has 19 entrepreneurial members who all work in different fields.  Their businesses include established  premises where they sell groceries, dried fruit, confectionery, jewelry, perfumes, costumes, etc.  All the members live in the city of Puerto Montt. 

Luz is a member of this community bank.  In the photo she is standing in the first row, in the middle, wearing a black jacket with a white sheepskin collar.  She is wearing her hair loose.  Her business is glassblowing (art with glass which is melted at high temperatures) and she also buys fancy dress costumes to hire out.  She has been working in these businesses for four years.  She sells and hires her products from her home and promotes her products and costumes on the Internet.  She buys her raw materials from glassworks and her costumes from commercial stores and auction stores.  She comments that her peak sales seasons are at the beginning and end of the year.  The rest of the year she sells sporadically.  

Luz will use her loan to buy materials for her glassblowing business: different colored cathedral glasses, mirrors, frames and adhesive, and she will also buy fabric for her costume business.  Her goal for her business is to have an established sales premises where she can offer her handicrafts and costumes.  

Luz lives together with her two daughters who are 25 and 9 years old.  Her eldest daughter works and is studying for a degree in special needs education and, in her free time, she helps her mother cut glass.  Luz's dreams on a personal level are to make better income from her businesses to apply for housing subsidy and complete her dream of owning her own home.  She is very happy about and grateful for the services delivered by Fondo Esperanza.  As regards the community bank that she is a member of, she comments that they are very well-organized and have developed a committed relationship.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile which is located in Los Lagos region.  Some of the attractions of Puerto Montt are its beautiful green landscapes, its quiet beaches, its cuisine (especially the reputation of its seafood and fish) and its handicrafts.  It is also the gateway to Isla Grande de Chiloé which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy materials for her glassblowing business (cathedral glasses in different colors, mirrors, frames, adhesive and fabric for her fancy dress costume business

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun, 28, is a responsible and hard-working woman who has been living in the Kompong Speu province. She is a local famer, cultivating rice crops during the rainy season of the year. Besides agriculture, she keeps her time free at home to take care of her two kids. And now she intends to use this free time to earn more income at home by acting as a seamstress, yet she doesn’t have the necessary funds to buy a sewing machine and clothes for operating this business. That’s why she is coming to Kiva for support and hopes that she’ll achieve her goal through using this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and clothes.

loans.name: Muungano B Group

texts.en:
Abraham is the facilitator of the Muungano B group. Abraham and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Abraham takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to improve food production and hence ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Abraham had a very good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Abraham was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abraham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Abraham will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Muungano B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Abraham is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nidia De La Paz

texts.es:
Nidia, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, por la necesidad de comprar más materiales para la elaboración de sus productos, como barro, nacazcol, leña, paja y transporte, estos materiales son los que en su día a día utiliza para la elaboración de ollas, comales, sartenes.
Ella considera que su experiencia con estos préstamos ha sido buena, ya que en la época de el invierno es más difícil obtener los materiales pero a través del crédito logro comprarlo y realizar la producción.
texts.en:
Nidia is asking for a new loan because she needs to buy more supplies, like clay, nacazcol, firewood, straw, and transportation service for making her products.  She uses these materials daily to make pots, hotplates, and pans.

She considers her experience with these loans to have been good.  Now that the winter is approaching, it’s more difficult to obtain the supplies, but she was able to buy them with the loan and continues to produce.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Gavino

texts.es:
Gavino pertenece al banco comunal “Los Chaccoc” y las reuniones de las socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pilcopata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. 

Gavino es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a sus hijos, él vive en la ciudad de pilcopata donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, Gavino tiene un pequeño taller de repuestos de artefactos como por ejemplo licuadoras, radios, televisores, computadoras y otras actividades. Gavino también en el mismo local vende artefactos y repuesto de artefactos.   

En esta oportunidad Gavino requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos de artefactos y artefactos como por ejemplo radios. 

Gavino agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Gavino belongs to the “Los Chaccoc” communal bank.  The members of the communal bank meet monthly in the city of Pilcopata in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.

Gavino is an enterprising, hardworking person who supports his children.  He lives in the city of Pilcopata where he carries out his economic activities.  Gavino has a small appliance like blenders, radios, television sets, computers and others, repair shop.  He also sells appliances and spare parts for appliances there.

On this occasion, Gavino needs the loan to buy spare parts for appliances and appliances like radios, for example.  Gavino is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for appliances and appliances.

loans.name: Njombu

texts.en:
He was born in May 1983. He is happily married with one child who is under 15 years of age, and they live in a one-room house. The death of his father when he was as young as seven and the theft of his truck are some of the difficult times he has encountered in life. He faced the challenge of the death of his father which caused him to be homeless since he is from a polygamous home.

He join GHAPE in 2009.  He has manage and successfully repaid a loan. He used the profit to expand his business and take care of his family and saved the rest for rainy days. His business is located at hospital roundabout where he sells provisions like savon [soap], sardines, drinks, sweets, sugar. He believes that, if the loan is given to him, his business will succeed because he will stock more goods which will attract more customers. He has done this business for a long time and has so many customers and the experience needed – this makes him believe that the business will be a success. Furthermore, people from the community will be relieved of the stress of moving from one area to another looking for goods, since many things will be available in his store.

The profit from the loan will be used to buy a plot of land and build a house for himself and to support his family. He will save the rest.He  prefers a loan from GHAPE because they have low interest rates and provide ample time for repayment.

loans.use: to buy savon, sardines, biscuits and sweets

loans.name: Shiella Mae

texts.en:
Shiella Mae is 22 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has three children. Shiella Mae used her last loan to expand her production of fish. She reaped a good harvest and that's made her become successful. 

As to prove it's success, she's been able to raise crabs. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to further grow up her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise.

loans.name: Reina Rafaela

texts.es: Reina es soltera, tiene 41 años y vive Guayaquil. Nació en Manabí pero al casarse se mudo a Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Cuando se separo de su esposo decidió y con la responsabilidad de criar a sus hijos decidió empezar a vender. Al principio lo realizaba de manera informal pero poco a poco con esfuerzo reunió dinero y  abrió una tienda. Vende gaseosas, recargas telefónicas, cosméticos etc. El negocio lo administra sola empezando desde las 8:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm, cierra un poco tarde porque la no tiene preocupación por la delincuencia. Sus hijos asisten a la escuela fiscal y espera poder apoyarlos hasta la universidad. Con el préstamo incrementara su negocio comprando Jugos, snacks, tarjetas etc. En  5 años ella planea mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Reina is 41 years old and single, and she lives in Guayaquil. She was born in Manabí, but moved to Guayaquil when she got married. She's separated and has two children under her care. When she separated from her husband, she had the responsibility to raise her children, so she decided to start selling. At first she had an informal business, but through her hard work she saved money little by little and opened a store. She sells soft drinks, phone recharges, cosmetics, etc. She manages her business by herself from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. She closes a little late because she doesn't worry about crime. Her children attend public school and she hopes to support them until they go to college. With the loan she will increase her business by purchasing juices, snacks, cards, etc. In five years' time, she plans to improve her home and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cards, soft drinks, juices, snacks.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis Alonso  de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, ya tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de siembra está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, un lugar apto para el crecimiento y desarrollo de los cultivos, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Luis Alonso es un hombre inteligente, muy activo y con muchas metas por alcanzar siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades que lo lleven al camino del éxito; en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas debido al clima, quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción necesita invertir en insumos por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Luis Alonso tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable por eso asegura que podrá pagar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, sorgo, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en: Jenifa is 22 years old. She is not married, and she lives in Kilombero district with her parents. Jenifa is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to students. Jenifa runs a business of renting bicycles near her village. The profit obtained from her business will help Jenifa to cater for her life needs. Jenifa requests a Kiva loan to increase the number of bicycles, and rent a frame where she can store her bicycles, especially during raining seasons. The profit will be used to pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to increase the number of bicycles and rent a frame

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
My name is Ramona Zanchez. I have a store that sells hamburgers called Paraiso de la Hamburguesa (Hamburger Paradise). I have several years in this type of business. It provides me with the income to cover my family’s expenses and my kid’s education. Right now, I need to buy more products so I can satisfy the existing demand.

Loan Use: Purchase red meat and chicken, bread, vegetables, butter, oil, salt, spices, mayonnaise, mustard, tomato sauce, glasses, dishes, napkins, chili peppers, and refreshments.

MI nombre es Ramona Zanchez, cuento con un negocio de venta de amburguesas, yamado Paraiso de las Amburguesa, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos, actuamente necesito comprar mas producto para poder satisfacer la demanda existente

loans.use: compra de carne de res y pollo, pan, vegetales, manteca, aceite, sal, especias, mayonesa, mostaza, salsa de tomate, vasos, platos, servilletas, chile, refrescos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lillian would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Allah Gul

texts.en: Allah Gul is 35 years old. He lives in a household of five in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children. He has a retail-food business. He wants to improve his economic situation. He wants to take a loan to buy extra things for the shop to increase his number of customers as well as make good relationships with people. He is trying a lot to make good business.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for shop.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience L. is 47 years old, married, with six (6) children. She comes from an urban area of Delta State. She has a dream of increasing the stock of goods in her store. She is therefore asking for a loan of US$750.

loans.use: Purchase of more plastics for sale

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en: Suraya is a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Ashagi-Zeyid. This 46-year-old has one year of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of $825 to purchase a cow. She wants to increase the number of cows and get  more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung M., 33, lives with her husband and three children in SiemReap Province, Cambodia. To help support her family, she runs a stand at her home selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her community, where she can typically earn around $5 each day. Her husband works as a tire repairman on the roadside, earning around $ 2/day of profit.  In order to meet her growing customer demand, Mrs Kung M. needs a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet growing customer demand

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S., 28, is married with one school-aged child and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a broker purchasing rice crops from the grower and sells them out, making on average around $2 each day of profits. Her husband, therefore, drives a motor-taxi, making about $3/day in revenue. Mrs. Sok S. hopes this loan will help her to expand her inventory by purchasing more rice crops.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of rice crops to resell

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim A. lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is marriend and has six children: three sons and three daughters. She works as a cook for a local family, and her husband is a daily wage laborer. One of her sons is a textile artist, and he embroiders clothes for a small wage. He has seven years experience in his work, and Shamim, the leader of her group, will use her loan to help her son start his own shop and hire a few workers. The other members of her group are Shamshad R. who will also help her son with his embroidery business; P. J., who will help her son improve his paint business; Meena A., who will use her loan to improve her husband's fruit business; and Rubina P., who will use her loan to improve her beauty salon. All of these women are very brave and are trying very hard to uplift their family's financial status.

loans.use: To start a business and improve other businesses

loans.name: Kabawo I(A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Leila is 36 years old, married and has five children. Her husband has a butchery business. Leila owns a public pay phone and also sells airtime cards. She wants to use the extra profits to reinvest in her current business.

Resty has a restauant business and wants to use the loan to buy a refrigerator and saucepans.

Berna sells new clothes.

Milly is a poultry farmer while Aisha sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Adrian De Jesús

texts.es:
In the El Sauce municipality in the Valle San Antonio region, Adrian de Jesús Mejia is in the agriculture and livestock business with the goal of maintaining his household, which consists of his wife and his two small children who, despite their age, are a great support in the labor involved in agriculture and livestock breeding.

The Valle San Antonio region has always faced the problem of not having electric power. They have no electricity because they are situated in a rural zone. For this reason, Adrian has acquired a solar panel to have access to two lamps and a small television. When he acquired this solar panel, he was left with the obligation of paying this debt. This is why he turned to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan that will allow him to pay this debt, and in that way have access to electric power in his humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce en la comarca Valle San Antonio, el señor Adrian de Jesús Mejia es dedica a al negocio de la agricultura y ganadería con el fin de mantener su hogar que consta de ella y sus dos pequeños hijos que a pesar de su edad son un gran apoyo en el trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería.

La comarca Valle San Antonio siempre ha atravesado un problema como lo es la ausencia de energía eléctrica, no poseen luminarias por estar ubicados en una zona rural. Es por este motivo que el señor Adrian ha adquirido un panel solar para tener acceso a dos lámparas y un pequeño televisor. Al adquirir el panel solar queda en la obligación de pagar esta deuda y es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan salir de esta deuda y de esta manera tener acceso a la energía eléctrica en su humilde casa de habitación.

loans.use: Acquire a solar panel to have electric power in his home.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor S. O., age 28, is a mother of four children. Together with her husband Mr. Tay Sokalenine, 31, they run a goldsmith shop. Normally they earn around $5 a day in profit. Their children are students.

To improve the goldsmith business, this couple needs to purchase more goldsmith tools to assist in their work.

loans.use: To purchase more goldsmith tools

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es:
Eladia is a young mother of an enthusiastic family. She is a very hard worker, who rises early in the morning to harvest herbs from her fields, feed the cow, and farm potatoes. She wants to increase the set up of her business to improve production and earnings. She works for the well-being and happiness of her 2 small children. In order satisfy her goal for a higher quality of life, she needs to improve upon potato planting and also improve cow feeding, for which she seeks this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Eladia, es una joven madre de familia entusiasta y muy trabajadora se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas para recoger el pA. de sus campos y así poder alimentar a su vaca, también se dedica al cultivo de papa y quiere acrecentar las instalaciones de su establo para tener mayor producción y ganancias, trabaja porque quiere ver a sus 2 pequeños hijos bien y muy contentos, para alcanzar su objetivo con satisfacción necesita mejorar su siembra de papas y también alimentar mejor a su vaca para lo cual solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of natural fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 41-years old and the mother of three children. She also has one adopted daughter who is currently in school. She sells slippers and babies’ dresses. There is the demand for children’s clothes and she will use her loan to increase her inventory and sales. Her previous loan from Sinapi helped a lot and she was able adopt a little girl to who needed a home. Joyce is a member of the group called “Adom Mmrodo” meaning Abundant Grace. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. Margaret in the photo with her adopted daughter.

loans.use: To buy more ladies slippers and children’s dresses.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a 40 year old business woman. She is a divorced mother with five children. She has been a single parent for seven years, and has to be very resourceful for her children. Two of the children have completed senior high school.

Helen trades in clothing. She buys clothing materials at wholesale price and retails them to her customers.

She wants to use the loan to include the sale of sponges and towels for additional income. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school.

She belongs to the community group called, ‘Nyame Nnae’ (meaning God is not asleep) Trust Group, where members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments. In case of default by a member, the other members contribute to make up the repayment amount.

This is Helena in the photograph.

loans.use: for the sale of sponges and towels.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has owned a small business in Zanzibar since 2002. She is hoping to take out her first loan in order to increase her inventory. Right now, she earns a monthly profit of about $50, but she hopes the loan will help her increase her profit. She works every day from 7:00am to 6:00pm.

Asha is 29 years old and is married. She has two children, ages 2 and 8.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy leather, thread, paint, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Amaquella” que significa “No seas Flojo” en quechua. Victoria es casada. Tiene 59 años y 5 hijos, Victoria vive en el Distrito D. San Juan Bautista, Victoria tiene una tienda surtida donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carne, pollo, bebidas y también tiene un teléfono publico, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijas en sus ratos libres.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, cerveza. Victoria sueña con mejorar su negocio, apoyar a su hijo menor hasta que sea profesional y realizar paseos, viajes para distraerse.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Amaquella" Communal Bank, which means "Don't be Lazy" in Quechua. Victoria is 59, married with 5 children. She lives in the District of San Juan Bautista. She has a variety shop where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat, chicken and drinks, and also has a public telephone. She carries out this activity with the help of her daughters in their free time. Victoria needs a loan of $525 that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, and beer. Victoria dreams of improving her business, helping her minor son to become a professional, and taking trips for her personal enjoyment.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of $525 that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, and beer.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is 27 years old. She has been selling clothing and perfume in Zanzibar for two years and is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $60 from her shop.

She is hoping that this first loan from BRAC Tanzania enables her to expand her inventory and increase her profit. She will use the loan to buy more clothes and perfume for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and perfume for her shop.

loans.name: Chhaim

texts.en: 59-year-old Mr. Chhaim C. lives in Srae Vong Village in Takeo Province. He has two children: one is working in a garment factory and the other is a manager of the family businesses. Mr. C. is a farmer who owns and cultivates rice on a small plot of land, while his wife, Mrs. Yin Toem, is a pig breeder. Since Mrs. Toem's business is going well, she wants to expand it. Her husband is asking for a loan to buy four more piglets and pig food to feed to her pigs. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy four more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Greetings from Therese N. in the northern province of Rwanda! Therese is 48 years old and married with three children.

She owns a small shop in Ruhengeri town. She sells domestic materials like soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, kilograms of beans, Colgate, paraffin, biscuits etc.

Besides shopping, Therese grows beans, wheat, and sweet potatoes, which are commonly grown in this area. From all her business activities, she earns about $105 per month. She employs two people to help her to run this business.

This entrepreneur is requesting for a loan of 515,000 Frws to buy more stock for her shop, because of the number of clients is increasing. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace G. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Peace sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Denu near Elmina, which she has done since 1992. Her husband is a mason.

Peace uses her income for taking care of the family's financial needs notably paying school fees and utility bills. Peace will use the loan to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Peace plans to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mrs. Sary U. lives in Chhoer Teal Phlos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. She also sells rice. She is facing a problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice to resell. Thus, Mrs. Sary U. has decided to seek a loan to make this possible. She is 31-year-old widow and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.en: A. Maisara has been an active client of the MicroInvest loan program since 2004. She showed herself as the reliable and exemplary client. She has never missed a loan repayment date. Maisara was born in 1968 in Khujand. She is married with 3 children. Maisara is engaged in the commercial service. She sells food products from her home where she has a food shop.She buys her supplies in “Panjshanbe” the local bazaar, and then re-sells them. Her business has a good turnover and she dreams of some day opening a food-market. Maisara has made a  request for a business development loan of 1000 STJ over 4 months to purchase a refrigerator. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Pelagio

texts.en:
Pelagio Bordón works as an upholsterer in Itá, Paraguay. He primarily works repairing seats in cars, trucks, motorcycles and the many buses that pass through Itá on a daily basis.

His work is well known in town, and he said he gets most of his customers through word of mouth. He is also known for his ability to work quickly. Pelagio stated that he never needs more than a day to complete a job, and often he completes his work in much less time.

While he said he has seen a slowdown in business due to the current economic situation, Pelagio is focused on helping his business grow and he remains confident that he will continue to be able to support his six children.

Pelagio is requesting this loan to purchase more material, mostly synthetic leather, at better prices in order to be prepared for large jobs.

loans.use: The purchase of material to be used in the repair of seats in trucks and buses

loans.name: Khidir

texts.en:
T. Khidir was born in 1961 and is married with 4 children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. For the past 15 years Khidir has grown wheat and corn on his land. His sons help him with the business. 

Khidir wants his children to get a good education, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future. This is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. Thanks to his effort and diligence now his elder daughter is studying at the University. 

Currently Khidir requests 2500 Somoni in order to buy wheat and corn seeds and mineral fertilizer. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.

About Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Andrea

texts.es:
La Sra. ROSA ANDREA K. G., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su negocio ubicado en el Jr. Cahuide Nº 101 del Distrito de Manantay; tiene 36 años, 03 hijos menores, y su esposo labora como docente en una prestigiosa Institución Educativa.
