Hace 06 años que trabaja con Manuela Ramos y recuerda que su primer préstamo fue de 300 Nuevos Soles con lo cual ella empezó con su pequeña bodega, gracias a su carisma y dedicación ha sabido salir adelante para el bien de su familia.

Con este préstamo es de S/.3000.00 Nuevos Soles,  implementara aun más su negocio con la compra de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, leche,. etc), así como también en el arreglo del local (Pintura, anaqueles, etc) que le ayuden a generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única institución que nos brinda apoyo y capacitación lo cual nos ayuda a hace crecer nuestra pequeña empresa.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Andrea K. G. is a member of the “Mujeres Talentosas” (Talented Women) Microfinance Institute. Her business is located on Cahuide Street in the district of Manantay. She is a 36-year-old mother of 3 young children, and her husband woks as a teacher at a prestigious educational institution.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 6 years, and she remembers that she set up her small general store with her first 300.00 PEN loan. Thanks to her charisma and dedication, she has been able to get ahead for her family’s benefit.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will restock her store with goods (rice, sugar, milk, etc.), as well as fix up her business space (paint, shelves, etc.), which will help her generate better profits for her family.

She states that Manuela Ramos is the only institute that gives people support and training, which is what helps them develop their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods (rice, sugar, milk, etc), and remodeling materials (paint, shelves, etc.)

loans.name: Nelybeth

texts.en: Nelybeth P. is registered as a resident of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is twenty-four years old and married with one child. Her spouse is a motorcycle-taxi driver. Her business was started with savings from her husband's income and the status of her business is quite good. The purpose of this loan is to buy basic medicines, tablets, salt, sugar, etc. Her loan through the Kiva field partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, will really help her business because it will provide additional capital to buy more inventory, which is needed by her customers. Her future plans for her business are to separate the space in her building for a variety store and to build a concrete house.

loans.use: To buy more medicines, salt, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Laydou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Laydou est composé de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales monogames avec leurs enfants et époux dans le quartier Hèrèmakono de la ville de Bougouni qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des relations  socio professionnelles et font généralement  le commerce des condiments alimentaires.
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière et de faire assez de stocks enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles sont à leur  premier prêt de groupe, qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter, 50 boites de 2 kg de concentrée de tomate, 20 sacs de 25 kg de sel de cuisine, 30 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et divers  sortes de condiments. Les produits sont payés auprès des grossistes de Bougouni pour être ensuite revendus dans le grand marché de la même ville à une  clientèle  composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail au comptant ou à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes  espèrent réaliser chacune  un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA  qui sera  investis  dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Laydou group is made up of married women who are on average 32 years old and have an average of four children. They are married and live in monogamous families with their children and husbands. They live in the neighborhood of Hèrèmakono in the town of Bougouni that is part of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

These women met each other through socio-professional relationships and they usually sell condiments [spices, seasoning].

Their intent is to increase their financial resources and obtain enough stock to meet the needs of their customers, thus they decided to be a part of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwasso.

This is their first group loan, and they are planning to use it to buy 50 2kg cans of tomato concentrate, 20 25kg bags of table salt, 30 boxes of 100 pieces each of Maggi cubes [all purpose seasoning condiment] and various kinds of seasonings. The goods are purchased from wholesalers from Bougouni to be sold on the grand marketplace of the same town. They sell retail to customers made up mostly of women who pay either by cash or on credit.

With this loan the women hope to each make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA [about USD 30], which will be invested in the business.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Kesse

texts.en:
Kesse is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. They are a very humble family who wants to invest in their future. She lives at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fishes, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. Selling these products, she says they move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi.

With her three years of experience in her business, she wants to add other foodstuffs like maize, eggs and other items which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore, she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc. She is very much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria T. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high school. Victoria sells panties, brassieres, and cosmetics in Abura, which she has done since 2008. Her husband is an electrician. Victoria uses her income to pay fees and housekeeping expenses. Victoria will use the loan to expand her business. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.en:
Since she was young, Ruzigul N.  has enjoyed the countryside. Her family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables and Ruzigul always imagined she’d be in the business of selling produce.  Fortunately she has realized this dream. She began to sell vegetables in small markets.  Little by little, she saved money so she could set up her own shop. Thanks to her efforts and the love she has for this business, Ruzigul’s business has been growing. Now Ruzigul believes it is the time to inject more capital into the business so that she can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices.  She is soliciting a loan of 1500 Somoni. With your help, Ruzigul will be able to move her business forward and offer her family a better future.    
        

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase capital to be able to buy wholesale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. sells materials, clothing, shoes and bags Cape coast. Sarah has received senior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a phone cards dealer. Sarah has been selling materials, clothing, shoes and bags since 2007. She is responsible for paying up keeping of her family. Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more cloths, bags, shoes, and weavon for resale on the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy to purchase more cloths, bags, shoes, and weavon for resale on the market.

loans.name: Diana Elisa

texts.es: La joven Diana Elisa P. , tiene la edad de 31 años , habita en el barrio La Conchitas , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y brindarle facilidad de estudios a  sus pequeños , doña Diana desde hace 15 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en variedad, la dificultad que se le presenta es la demanda de las ventas son mayores a su capital , doña Diana sueña con poder comprar su propio local de ventas , para así obtener mayor ingreso . Con el préstamo va a incrementar su inventario y poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes en las ventas. Da las gracia Afodenic por la oportunidad de los prestemos ya que lograra invertir en su negocio lo cual traerá mayores ventas con mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Diana Elisa P. is 31 year old and lives in the neighborhood of La Conchitas, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. She and her husband have two children, ages 12 and 8. They plan to improve their living conditions and provide a suitable environment for their children to study. For 15 years, Doña Diana has been selling a variety of fruits and vegetables. Her greatest challenge has been high demand, since she does not have enough capital to acquire more products.

With his loan, she will increase her inventory so that she can provide better service to her customers through her sales. She thanks AFODENIC for the opportunity to invest in her business with these loans so that she can bring about better sales and higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fruits & vegetables to increase her sales

loans.name: Felisicima

texts.en: Felisicima Y. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin. She is 50 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Felisicima owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Felisicima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Felisicima is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia, es natural de la provincia de Quillabamba, ella pertenece al banco comunal,” Fuerza Compartida”, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, ella es casada y la socia tiene 3 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la enseñanza, ella ama a los niños por lo que su pasión la llevó a estudiar educación inicial, trabaja como auxiliar en un jardín para niños llamado corazones felices. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para uso personal y el cuál irá cubriendo con su sueldo mensual.

Nuestra socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado comprometiéndose a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia is a native of the province Quillabamba and a member of the Community Bank "Fuerza Compartida", located in the city of Cusco, Huanchaco District. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates her household activities with a teaching job. She loves children. Her passion led her to study early childhood education and to work as an assistant in a preschool called “ Corazones Felices”.

She is asking for a loan for personal use, which She will repay with her monthly salary. She appreciates the loan and is committed to repay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Use

loans.name: Diana Del Rocío

texts.es:
Diana tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el caserío El Imperial, distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y cuarenta minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Es propietaria de un pequeño negocio ubicado en el terminal terrestre de Olmos desde hace un año; se dedica a la venta de comidas, golosinas y bebidas que ofrece a los pasajeros y choferes que frecuentan el terminal. Con el dinero percibido en este negocio apoya al sostenimiento de su familia.

La gran acogida que tiene su negocio en la zona ha hecho que piense en ampliarlo con la venta de más productos y preparación de más platos diarios con los cuales pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de los insumos que necesita para seguir adelante con su negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es estudiar la carrera técnica de enfermería para poder apoyar a las personas que viven en su caserío. Ella es muy solidaria y siempre está pensando en el bienestar de las personas que la rodean.
texts.en:
Diana is 18. She is single and lives with her parents in the El Imperial village in the Olmos district, which is located one hour and forty minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For one year she has been the proprietor of a small business, which is located at the Olmos bus station. She sells food, sweets, and drinks to the passengers and drivers who frequent the station. She helps support her family with the money from this business. Her business has been so well received in the area that she intends to expand it by selling more products and preparing more dishes daily. This way she could satisfy her customers’ demands. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for 700 PEN to buy the supplies she needs to get ahead with her business. Her biggest desire is to study a technical career in nursing to be able to help the people in her village. She is very supportive, and she is always thinking of the well being of those around her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food prepartion and sales

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda E. is from the village of Mabuhay in Iligan  City. She is 44 years old. Emmalinda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emmalinda sells charcoal made from coconut shells in the local community. Emmalinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emmalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to purchase new items to sell. Emmalinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Emmalinda's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: La Señora Consuelo S. Es originario de la comunidad de Coxom del municipio de activida ella manifiesta  que cuando tenia quince años sus familiares lo llevaron ha Tapachula Mexico atender un negocio, trasncurrie el tiempo  ell contrae matrimonio  y regresa a su comunidad de origen ya conjuntamente con su esposo decide iniciar su propio negocio en la venta de productos Mexicanos ella solicita de un credito para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y aprovechar la época de frio en el municipio de Totonicapan
texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo S. is from the community of Coxom. She tells us that when she was fifteen years old her relatives took her to Tapachula, Mexico to look after a business. Time goes by, she gets married and returns to her community of origin and together with her husband she decides to set up her own business selling Mexican products. She requests a loan to buy merchandise to supply her business and take advantage of the cold season in the municipality of Totonicapan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase work capital.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora SANDRA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de una hija. Su hija Guadalupe tiene 5 años y estudia en el jardín “URPICHA”.    

La socia trabaja en una empresa de cadena de boticas “ALBIS” como vendedora de medicamentos. Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio abriendo su propia botica “LUPITA” donde vende  medicamentos con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a comprar a su tienda y les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más medicamentos.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is a member of the Community Bank “Nueva Luz del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s New Light), which is part of the Arariwa Association of the Province and District of Cusco. She lives with her common-law husband; she’s 28 and she has a 5-year-old daughter, Guadalupe, who goes to kindergarten at “Urpicha”. Sandra works at one of “ALBIS” Pharmacy Chain Stores as a sales person. Her character and desire to fulfill her dreams have motivated her to also start her own business, called “Lupita” Pharmacy Store, where she sells prescription drugs, using the money as an extra home income. Since her beginnings she has made more and more customers, some of who have become regulars, going to her store every day, just to receive her candid service. She’s being her own boss for several years now. Her business has been successful thanks to her hard work. Sandra is a working mother and an entrepreneur who is able to support her family in spite of the hard times. She would like to receive this loan to increase her resources by buying more drugs for her store. She is very thankful for the opportunity she has been given through this means and she is also committed to fulfill the payments according to her payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She would like to receive this loan to increase her resources by buying more drugs for her store

loans.name: Maria Aida

texts.en:
Maria Aida G. is from the village of Sibula Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Maria Aida is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Aida owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, candies,sugar, and toothpaste in the local community. Maria Aida has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Aida successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Aida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maria Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the needs of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es: La señora Maribell J. F., tiene 45 años de edad y habita con sus hijos en el Barrio Laureles Sur es madre soltera, de dos hijos de las edades de 17 y 22 años, la menor estudia la escuela secundaria y el mayor esta en la universidad estudiando Abogacia, la señora F. ha podido con su fuerte trabajo, financiarle a su hijo su carrera univesitaria, el mayor anhelo de la señora sería el tener las posibiilidades de ofrecerle a sus hijos la preparación univercitaria para que sean ciudadadanos de provecho, con este prestamo ella podra construir un cuarto en el patío de su casa para brindarles a ellos mejores comodidades de vida y mejor privacidad a ella.
texts.en:
Ms. Maribell J. F. is 45 years old. She lives with her children in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is a single mother of two children, aged 17 and 22 years old. The youngest studies at high school and the oldest is in college studying law. Ms. F. has been able, with her hard work, to finance her son in his college major. Her biggest wish is to be able to offer her children a university education so that they can be good citizens. With this loan she will be able to build a room in the patio of her home to make their lives more comfortable and give her more privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room in the back part of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing accessories

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en:
Theodosie is 42 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 6 and 14. Theodosie also cares for another person in her family. Theodosie lives in Gasabo District in Kigali Province, where her business is located. 

Theodosie owns a small shop that sells ikigage, a traditional beer made from sorghum. This business is profitable. Theodosie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to buy more sorghum to make the ikigage. 

Theodosie's husband is a farmer, but his farm does not generate enough income to support his family, so Theodosie has decided to contribute to her family by selling the sorghum beer. Theodosie has an experience of six years in this field. Her business is open from 6:00 in the morning to 8:00 in the evening every day except Sunday.

loans.use: To buy sorghum to make into a traditional local beer

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Adelaide Paulino M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 32 anos de idade casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 6 e 1 anos de idade, apenas o de 6 anos é que vai a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
Nunca saiu da cidade, cresceu e sempre viveu em Maputo. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 5 anos, não possui nenhum empregado, trabalha das 06 as 23:00horas. Esta actividade aprendeu da sua mãe há 14 anos, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.200.00mt por dia, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum no Xitique mensal (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua vizinha que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 4.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 9.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e outros para aquisição de uma viatura.
texts.en:
Adelaide Paulino M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She is 32 years old, married, and is the mother of 2 children who are 6 and 1 years old. The 6 year old attends school. Adelaide only studied through 6th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her family and she isn't responsible for supporting anyone financially besides her children. Adelaide never left Maputo, she grew up there and has always lived there. She has owned her own business for more than 5 years and doesn't have any other employees. She works from 6:00 AM to 11:00 PM. She learned about this business from her mother 14 years ago, and earns approximately 1200.00 meticales a day. She uses this money to pay for household expenses, and also saves some money each month through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings). Adelaide has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through a neighbor who also works with the institution. This is her 5th loan, for the amount of 15,000.00 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (sand, cement, iron, and other items) in order to continue with the construction of her home. Her earlier loans were for 4000.00, 8000.00, and 9000.00 Meticales, and were used for the same purpose. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish building her house and to buy a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement and other items)

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy H. and her husband, Mr. Phalla Mok, 42, were married in 1990 and have three children: two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. They live along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Chanthy has been a tailor for more than five years, while her husband is a rice farmer. By the way, one of her sons just finished his baccalaureate and continues his studying at University in Phnom Penh as well. He is a first year student of IT (Information Technology).

Chanthy hopes to support her children’s further education so that they will have good jobs when they finish their studying. So she is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a computer for her son.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her son

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Six people, who live in Krang Roluos village in Kandal province, make up this group loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Thavy S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She owns a general store in the local village and she is also a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it but does not have the money. Thus, she decided to seek a loan to buy more groceries to sell. The rest of the loan she will use to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Thavy S.’s husband, Mr. Mouv H., is a farmer who owns 2-hectares (5-acres) of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family. The couple supports a child who is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo sortilegio está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de D.S quien aprendió desde pequeña el arte de hacer pan y reposterías ya que proviene de una familia de panaderos la cual ella ha continuado. Con el préstamo comprara materia prima como harina, huevos, leche etc.

Sus compañeras de grupo son E. D quien vende tropigas y alquila sillas y C. G. A. tiene una pulpería. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The group Sortilegio ("Charm") is made up of three hard-working women. One of them, D.S., learned at a very young age the art of making bread and pastries. She comes from a family of bakers and has continued in their footsteps. With this loan, she will buy ingredients like flour, eggs, milk, etc. Her partners are E.D., who sells propane tanks and rents chairs, and C.G.A., who owns a small convenience store. They will invest the money into their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients like flour, yeast, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Sarem Long Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen people who live in Prech village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sarem L. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sarem L. is a soft drink seller in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve her business, Mrs. Sarem L. is applying for a loan to buy more soft drinks to resell. Her husband, Mr. Siy S., is a palm fruit collector and a farmer. Mrs. Sarem L. is the mother of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruit in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase more fruit to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es enfermera de profesión y adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar en la crianza de vacas, ella trabaja en esta actividad junto a su esposo, actualmente cuenta con dos vacas en producción; la leche que producen la ofrece en venta a los vecinos de la zona y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se generan algunas ganancias adicionales.

Alejandrina desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus vacas y obtener mayor rentabilidad, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Alejandrina es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, sus hijos ya están independizados. Ella desea dedicarse por completo a la crianza de vacas cuando se jubile. En la zona donde vive es una persona muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 48, married and lives with her husband in the district of Cayalti, an agricultural zone an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is a nurse and also raises cows with her husband. They currently have two cows; the milk that they produce is sold to neighbours, and the earnings from this activity generate an additional income. Alejandrina wants to buy balanced feed to improve the production of their cows and obtain higher returns. For this reason she is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal. Alejandrina is a responsible and hard-working woman. Her children are already independent. She wants to fully devote herself to raising cows when she retires. In her area, she is well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Balanced food for cows

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle S. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years-old and married with four young children. To make a living, Annabelle owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Annabelle joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand the provided service. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant built with bamboo and an ironsheet roof. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant.  

Rose is 39 years old and is married to an auto-mechanic engineer. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cement the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant

loans.name: Nhelajean

texts.en:
Nhelajean C. is from the village of Balok. She is 33 years old. Nhelajean is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Nhelajean owns and operates a business selling fish. Nhelajean has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nhelajean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nhelajean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Nhelajean is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nhelajean from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin C. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 30 years old, married, and has one infant child. To make a living, he buys and sells coconuts in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Elvin is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his 2nd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Dang

texts.en: Dang T. Ngo is 42 years old. She is living with her family in Xuan Non Comune. She is a farmer. Her main income generating activities are rice growing and raising pigs for meat. She has run her business for 5 years. Since joining our credit program in 2003, she has been a good client. Currently, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in pig raising.

loans.use: to invest in pig raising

loans.name: Umitker

texts.en:
Umitker M. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. She and her family have been living together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, at their permanent address for the past twenty-one years. Her oldest three children attend a local secondary school while her youngest son goes to the local kindergarten. 

She operates a dairy product retail business in her town at the local market. She started her business in 2003 by selling various kinds of dairy products at an indoor stall at Turlik market, one of the main markets of her town.  She purchases all of her dairy products from the countryside's herders at wholesale prices and resells them.  From now on, she plans to purchase large amounts of dried curd cheeses and melted butters at wholesale prices and resell it during the upcoming winter months when prices for those products traditionally rise. 

For the future, she hopes to open her own dairy products shop. She smiles all the time and makes people happy even though she works very hard. "I want to provide my children with a good education and also establish my own dairy shop." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products when prices for such products are cheap.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia resides in the city of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan which is known for its history and culture. She is a supportive and kindhearted woman. She operates a stuffed toy selling business which is very popular among children, who love to play with the stuffed toys. She receives orders from different gift shops and earns a good income by completing them on time.

Her husband, M. S., runs a tailoring business in the market where he sews both ladies' and men's clothes. He has been in this profession for the last six years and now has a good clientele base. He has hired a worker who assists him in completing the orders on time. Shazia and her husband both manage the family's financial expenses.

Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s tailoring business. With this loan, her husband will buy another sewing machine which will help him complete the orders on time and receive more orders. At present, with a single machine, S. has to refuse his customers' orders, which is not good for his business or his image. Shazia is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that their financial condition will become far better.

Note: In the photo, Shazia is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda E. is from the village of Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Luzviminda's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishepeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Let God Be Group

texts.en:
Lawrence M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Let God Be.  He is 35 years old, single, and has two children who are between the ages of 3 and 8 years old. He is a college student. 

For ten years, he has been operating a foreign exchange bureau in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to add more money to his business.  He describes himself as a friendly man whose goal is to own a drug store.

loans.use: To add more money to his foreign exchange business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le permitió  incrementar el capital de su negocio de confección de polos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para incrementar su mercadería de su negocio de confección de polos.
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener más telas para la fabricación de su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the “Las Mensajeras” (Messengers) community bank which is located in Juliaca district, in San Román province, in the department of Puno.  She is 48 years old, married and has 4 children.  She completed her primary education.

Eugenia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which allowed her to increase the working capital of her business making polo shirts.

She is requesting a new loan for 700 nuevos soles which she will use to increase the merchandise of her business.

Her dream for the future is to have more fabric for her business.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of payment.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise of her business making polo shirts

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica A. is from the village of Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old, married and has 1 infant. Angelica owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she buys and sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snack food. She decided to change her business from fruit vending to running a retail store because she finds it more profitable. Angelica is just starting this business.

In 2010, Angelica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Angelica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Catalina Arely

texts.es: Catalina Arely L. de 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo de 73 años, con el cual reside en el departamento de San Vicente. Catalina posee una venta de productos de belleza tales como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo y el cabello y otros más. Mucho de estos productos se comercializan por catalogo, de los cuales se venden a crédito, esta es una estrategia que Catalina utiliza para poder asegurar sus ventas aunque en muchas ocasiones es bastante riesgosa. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos, cremas y perfumes, la cual debe pagar al contado para obtenerla, es por ello que es de mucha importancia obtener el préstamo dado por Integral, para que este le permita aumentar el inventario de su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Catalina es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual siempre se ha esforzado al máximo por contar con una vida estable.
texts.en: Catalina Arely L., 52 years old, lives with her husband, who is 73 years old, in the department of San Vicente.  Catalina has a business selling beauty products such as perfume, body and hair creams, and other items.  Many of these products are marketed through a catalog, and are sold on credit.  This is the strategy Catalina uses in order to secure her sales, although in many cases, it's rather risky.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics, creams, and perfumes.  To obtain these items, she has to pay for them in cash upfront.  This is why it's very important that she obtain the loan from Integral.  It will allow her to increase her business' inventory and improve her family's living conditions.  Catalina is a very hard-working woman, and has always worked as hard as possible in order to have a stable life.

loans.use: Purchase of personal use products for sale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina,  tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Amadeo de 46 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Marina, es una de las más visitadas, desde las cinco de la mañana abre su tienda de abarrotes en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar los variados productos que vende. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y dispuesta a ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar atender a sus clientes; lleva cinco años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie  todo el día. Pero todo esfuerzo es valido, ya que le va muy bien, y gracias a este trabajo obtiene muchos bienes. Con el tiempo espera poder ampliar  su  tienda  y abastecerse de más  mercadería, para así poder ofrecer  a sus clientes  una mejor variedad de productos. Es su 22avo con MFP y  esta dispuesta  a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los tres mi soles solicitados, comprará más productos; para poder implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes y  poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina, age 48, is a hard-working woman who leads a simple life. She lives in her own house together with her husband Amadeo, who is 46, and their 4 beloved children, whom they wish to offer a better standard of living.

Marina’s shop is one of the most visited in the neighbourhood. She opens her grocery store at 5am and waits for neighbours to arrive to buy the goods she sells. She is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman, who always welcomes her customers with a smile and helps them with their purchases. What she likes most about her work is being able to assist her customers. She has had the business for 5 years. She thinks the most difficult aspect is being on her feet all day. But all the effort is worth while, because it is going well and she gets a lot of benefit from this work. With time she hopes to expand the shop and to stock more merchandise, because that way she will be able to offer her customers a better variety of products. This is her 22nd loan from [field partner] MFP. She likes to make her repayments on time because she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank, where she is well-liked by the other members. With the 3,000 Soles she is looking for, she will purchase more products so she can improve her grocery store and be able to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie owns a business that sells boutique items. She is 32 years old, married and has four children who are between four and nine years old. Her husband works as a constructor. Pascasie has been selling boutique items for four years. Her loan will be used to add more foodstuffs and cooking oil in her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to renovate her house. In the future, she would like to increase the loan amount for better business turnover.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Ivania Patricia

texts.es:
Ivania madre soltera, ya que su esposo murió, mujer emprendedora tiene a sus hijos estudiando y su plan es que ellos se profesionalicen, trabaja como conserje en una empresa privada, tiene como proyecto la construcción completa de su vivienda, para cumplirlo se le ha presentado dificultades de falta de financiamientos. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, laminas de zinc, bloques, arena, clavos y otros materiales. Así construir un cuarto que obtendrá seguridad y protección para su familia.
Agradece a la financiera por la oportunidad del crédito ya que fomenta el desarrollo al nicaragüense.
texts.en:
Ivania is a single mother because her husband died.  She is an enterprising woman and she has her children in school.  Her plan for them is that they become professionals.  She works as a caretaker in a private firm.  Her project is to finish building her house but this has been difficult for lack of funds.

The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: cement, iron rods, zinc metal sheeting, concrete blocks, sand, nails and other materials to build a room that will provide security and protection for her family.

She thanks the financial institution for the opportunity of credit because it fosters Nicaraguan development.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Bayarmunh

texts.en:
Bayarmunh, 38, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife works as a salesperson for a company and his older son attends a local school; their younger son stays at home. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

In 2005 he opened a sports club where he works as a trainer. His students have won medals at several local and national competitions. He wants to expand his club in the future. Bayarmunh is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase exercise equipment for his club and to finish his winter house which has almost been completed.

loans.use: To purchase exercise equipment for his sports club

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is 30 years old and her husband is a soldier. Violette owns a shop from which she sells several item such as rice, sugar etc. and she has been in this business for 4 years. She is now requesting a loan in order to buy more items for her shop and hopes to reinvest in her business with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy items such as rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen A. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Ellen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ellen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as snack foods, canned goods, biscuits & detergents in the local community. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ellen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ellen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HHSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to supply the business

loans.name: Razia Nadeem Masih's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 23 years old and married to N. M.. The couple has two daughters. Razia lives in Mian channu, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, that is known for its agriculture industry. For the past twelve years, she has been living in a two-room brick house with her family. Both of her daughters are enrolled in a local school to get an education.

Razia is a housewife who fulfills her responsibilities and takes care of her family. Razia’s husband is a street hawker who sells items such as toffees and candies from a cart. Most of his clients are children and he visits different areas of the city to sell his goods. Razia is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah so that her husband can buy a new cart, as his current cart is worn and needs to be replaced.

Razia is hopeful that this investment will be productive for her husband and will help him to do his work better.

loans.use: to buy a new cart

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
From the province of Battambang, Yin P. is a 52-year-old widow who earns a daily income by sewing at home. Yin P. provides her service to her neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. 

She lives with two children who are employed in a garment factory. 

Yin P. will use her loan to add to her current savings for purchasing a new motorbike because her old motorbike often has broken down during use.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel P., tiene la edad de 46 años, habitante del municipio de la concepción,  barrio San Ignacio, junto a su esposa la cual se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras para poyarlo con los gastos del hogar,  ellos tienen tres hijos de 13,10 y 8 años, todos estudiantes de primaria , los planes hacia un futuro  es poder llevar tubería de agua potable hasta la vivienda , don Víctor desde hace veinte y cinco años se dedica a la agricultura   como productor de pitahayas , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es la caída de botones florales , ya que estos carecen de fertilizantes necesarios para poder crecer bien . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para la plantación de pitahayas.
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Manuel P., 46, lives in the town of La Concepción’s San Ignacio neighborhood with his wife who sells fruit and vegetables to help him meet household expenses.  They have three children who are 13, 10 and 8 years of age, all in elementary school.  His future plans are to bring potable water tubing to his house.

Víctor has been a farmer for 25 years, he grows dragon fruit.   His greatest challenge is when the flower buds drop off due to lack of fertilizer to insure their proper growth.  He wants the loan to buy fertilizer and needed supplies for his dragon fruit crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat sews clothes for her community clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and operates a rickshaw.  He provides transport facilities to his passengers and to school children. 

Nusrat has given birth to three sons. Her youngest son is studying in class 7 while others left their education after the 8th class. Her eldest son sells rice while the 2nd one works in a factory.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Her husband is currently driving a rented rickshaw and pays almost one third of his profits in rent. With the loan, he will buy a new rickshaw which will help him increase his profits. 

He has been attached to this business for the past 10 years and Nusrat is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for transportation business.

loans.name: Orquideas Silvestre Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "ORQUIDEAS SILVESTRES", ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES UNA DE ELLAS ES LA SEÑORA EDALI, ELLA TIENE 38 AÑOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN MORELOS, MÉXICO. LA SEÑORA EDALI VIVE EN UNION LIBRE SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA ALBAÑILERIA ACTUALMENTE, TIENEN TRES HIJOS 2 HOMBRES Y UNA MUJER, LA SEÑORA EDALI LLEVA DIEZ AÑOS DEDICANDOSE AL COMERCIO. LA SEÑORA EDALI COMENTA QUE ELLA COMENZO VENDIENDO ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS POR CATALOGO SOLO EN SU COLONIA Y POSTERIORMENTE EMPEZO A VENDER MAS VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS Y EN OTROS LUGARES A SUS ALREDEDORES DE SU COLONIA, COMENTA QUE CON SUS VENTAS PUEDE APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA Y EN LOS ESTUDIO DE SUS HIJOS, ELLA A FUTURO QUIERE PONER UN LOCAL PARA TENER UN  POCO MAS DE INGRESOS. CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR MÁS MERCANCIA COMO ZAPATOS Y COSMETICOS PARA TENER MÁS VARIEDAD EN SU NEGOCIO Y ASÍ PODER OFRECER TODO LO QUE NECESITAN SUS CLIENTES. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA QUIERE SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO Y AHORRAR PARA OFRECERLES UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA A SUS HIJOS. OBSERVACIONES LA SEÑORA QUE NO SE VE BIEN EN LA FOTO SE LLAMA MARIA.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Orquídeas Silvestres' (Wild Orchids) and it has nine members.  One of the group's members is 38 year-old Edali who lives in Morelos, Mexico.

Edali lives with her common-law husband who is a construction worker.  They have three children: two sons and one daughter.  Edali has been in the sales business for ten years.  She tells us that she started out selling some products through a catalog, just in her district.  She then started selling a wider variety of products in neighboring districts as well.  She tells us that, through her sales, she is able to support her husband with their household expenses and is able to help pay for her children's education.

In the future, Edali would like to set up business premises so that she can make a little more income.  She would like to use her loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes and cosmetics, so that she can offer a wider variety of products in her business and thereby be able to offer her customers everything they need.  With the profits that she makes, she would like to continue investing and also saving so that she can offer her children a better quality of life.

(Note: the lady who can't be seen very well in the photo is called Maria).

loans.use: to buy footwear and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 42 years of age and married with four children. Eseta owns & operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Eseta needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Eseta's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Maribel Antonia

texts.es: Maribel Antonia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 3 años de experiencia con este negocio. Inicio por una amiga que le sugirió que empezara a vender poco productos ya que Maribel no tenía mucho capital para  comprar variedad en sus productos, fue así que ella decide iniciar este medio de vida para mantener a su familia pues tiene un hijo a su cargo. Con el crédito comprara productos como bolsos, cremas, perfumes, calzado, joyas, ropa en general y otros.
texts.en:
Maribel Antonia's business is selling general merchandise.  She has more than three years experience in this business.  She started out through a friend who suggested she start selling a few products since she didn't have a lot of capital with which to buy a wide range of products.  She decided to start out in this line of work in order to support her family as she has one son in her care.  

Maribel Antonia will use this loan to buy products such as bags, creams, perfume, footwear, jewelry, clothes, etc.

loans.use: to buy bags, creams, perfume, footwear, jewelry, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Olga Natividad

texts.es:
Olga Natividad tiene 41 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 17, 13 y 10 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Olga se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es trabajar mucho para comprar terrenos por trabaja en terrenos arrendado.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo y compartir las cosas buenas con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Natividad is 41 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children, aged 17, 13 and 10, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  

The 'Tierra Nuestra' (Our Land) community bank is located in San Luis de Zapotal, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing crops such as corn and rice.

Olga is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.  She is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as pests on her crops and a lack of money with which to pay more workers.  Her dream is to work hard so that she can buy land as she currently works on rented land.

Olga enjoys working in the fields and sharing good times with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling dried fish and salt in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her business for two years. She also earns an income by providing motorcycle transportation services and by raising pigs. Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Som Ol

texts.en: Som ol (in the photo with his grandson) is a soldier, while his wife, Norm, sells small trees and flowers in her village. They have been married since 1983 and have five children: four sons and a daughter. One is married, two are garment workers and the other two are in school. Som ol is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrián tiene 30 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Elizabet de 29 años, y sus 2 hijos, en su casa que es propia, ubicada en el distrito de LLochegua. Adrián, es una persona que se caracteriza por ser muy idealistas y con muchos proyectos, pero para llegar a cumplirlas debe ser muy precavido. Es así que cultiva cacao, que junto a su esposa, injertan las plantas para lograr obtener un mejor producción, siendo cada fruto un mayor volumen y eso le da mucha ventaja frente a los demás frutos tradicionales. Pero sabe que la falta mucho trabajo por hacer, se sacrifica dia y noche con la finalidad de sacar provecho a sus tierras que todavía aún no cuentan con plantación alguna. Generalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, para que e faciliten en la extracción de sus productos. Este es su primer con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 que solicita, desea comprar más plantas de cacao.
texts.en: 30 year old Adrián lives with his wife, 29 year old Elizabet, and their 2 children in their own house, which is in the district of Llochegua. Adrián is a very idealistic person who has many projects on the go, but, to be able to complete the projects, he needs to be very prudent. For instance, he and his wife grow cocoa trees and they graft the plants so that they will have improved production and so that each fruit will be a good size, and this gives them a great advantage over the traditional fruits. But he knows that he has a lot of work to do, he works day and night with the goal of getting the best yield from the land that he has not yet planted. He generally gets help from his family, who help him to harvest his crops. This is his first loan from MFP and he promises to make his repayments punctually. He will use the $550 he is requesting to buy more cocoa plants.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa trees.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia Patricia tiene 36 años, su actividad económica es la venta de res y cerdo. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios se dan porque ella es una mujer muy humilde y la responsabilidad de sus hijos contribuyeron a que ella buscara un medio de medio de ingreso para su hogar, así fue que poco a poco ella fue creciendo con esta actividad. Por lo que ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar carne y cerdos. Su deseo es que sus hijos en futuro se hagan cargo del negocio.
texts.en: Claudia Patricia is 36 years old and sells beef and pork; she has been doing this for more than 6 years.  This venture initiated because she is a humble person and being responsible for her children made her search for the means to generate an income for the household, this allowed her to steadily grow her business.  She now solicits this loan as working capital to purchase beef and pork.  Her wish is to have her children take over the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beef and pork

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and has three children attending school.   The primary source of her income comes from selling kitchenware to people in her village and the nearby towns. Her other source of income comes from raising hogs for future sales. By selling basins, hangers and baskets, she usually earns about PHP 4,000 each month.

Elizabeth has insufficient funds to diversify her business.  That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional kitchenware to sell such as stock pots, basins, chairs and plastic mats.

She needs to earn consistent profits to save for the college education for her children.

loans.use: buy kitchenware

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 38 years old, married to Rose and they have three children. 

Charles has a business of selling shoes and handbags and has been in the business for the past ten years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to increase his inventory of shoes and handbags. He hopes to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is 23 years old. She is IDP (internally displaced person). Gulnar is married with two children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows and several sheep. Her monthly income is 200 USD

Now Gulnar wants to expand her business and, as her children are growing up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help. So she is asking for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase cattle and cows. Gulnar wishes to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Cheikh Dahi

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 4 enfants dont deux sont à l'école.Il est maçon de formation.Il exerce ce métier mais pratique égaleùent l'agriculture et l'élevage.Il dispose de 4 ha de terre sur lesquelles il cultive de l'arachide, du mil et du maïs.Chaque année, il achéte des vaches qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de quatre mois.Cette diversité d'activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.Actuellement il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter deux vaches.Son ambition est d'élargir ses activités agricoles et d'élevage.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, who is father to four children, two of whom are at school. He is trained builder and works as a builder, but he also has a farming and animal rearing activity. He has four hectares of land on which he grows groundnut, millet and corn. Each year he buys cows which he fattens up and resells after four months. This diversity of activities allows him to provide for his family's needs. He is currently requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy two cows. His ambition is to expand his farming and animal rearing activities.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a hardworking father of seven children, ages 2-14, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He has no other dependants and lives in his own house. 

For three years, Godfrey has been selling local gin. He started with a 5 liter jerrycan but now has over 50 liters of gin. He faces the challenge of poor transport systems. He hopes to improve his business further in the future. Godfrey needs this loan to buy local gin to sell.

loans.use: to buy local gin.

loans.name: Francisco Guadalupe

texts.es: Francisco Guadalupe de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una granja donde cría gallinas se ha hecho de mucha clientela y su negocio es muy competitivo en el mercado, pues su producto es de muy buena calidad y a precio realmente accesible. Francisco es un hombre dedicado al trabajo pone todo de su parte para poder salir adelante, piensa que hay que trabajar por lo que se ama para ser feliz y tener un triunfo constante, le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más gallinas y concentrado por mayor. Francisco Guadalupe tiene fe que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisco Guadalupe is 36 years old and lives with his common-law wife and children.  He has a farm where he raises hens.  He has many customers and is very competitive in the market since his products are top quality and low-priced.  Francisco is very dedicated to his work and makes every effort to get ahead.  He believes one has to work for what he loves in order to be happy and have continued success.  He likes to stay ahead of the competition and has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy more hens and wholesale feed.  Francisco Guadalupe hopes this will help him give his family the best quality of life possible.

loans.use: To buy hens and wholesale feed.

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en: Altansuh is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in his own house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a disabled woman who stays at home. His elder son is a college student and the younger one is a school student. Altansuh started his business in 2000 by making furniture for nomads. Now his business is stable and he has many customers. Now that his product demand is increasing he needs to buy automated machinery to make his job efficient and more highly quality. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "This year my son joined a college therefore, I need to work harder to pay his tuition". Altansuh is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy machinery.
