loans.use: To buy machinery

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Fernando le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior, ya que le esta haciendo falta  pintar y realizarle algunos detalles. Solicita el préstamo para comprar la pintura especial y así le dure más tiempo los acabados. 
Don Fernando tiene ya mas de 20 años trabajando en un agencia aduanal y su esposa de dedica al hogar ya viven solos, sus hijos ya están casados y tiene su propia familia. 
Desean mejorar su patrimonio y que este en buenas condiciones. 
El señor Fernando ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA los cuales han pagados puntualmente y han sido para mejorar su vivienda, desea contar nuevamente con su cooperación en este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Fernando’s house lacks interior finishing.  It needs to be painted, and some details need to be taken care of.

He is requesting the loan to buy special paint so that the finishing will last longer.

Fernando has worked in a customs agency for over 20 years.  His wife devotes herself to the home.  They now live alone; their children are married and have their own families. 

They wish to improve their legacy, and they want it to be in good condition. 

Fernando has had two Kiva loans, which he repaid punctually. They have been to improve his house.  He wishes to count on your cooperation again with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy paint to finish the interior of the house.

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en:
Rhona owns a salon which has been in operation for one year. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya, is married, and has two children. She began the business from her personal savings and her salary.

Rhona learned of Milango from her friends and is applying for a loan of Ksh 16,000 to purchase shampoo, weaves and braids. Her main challenge is finding clients during low seasons, and her ambition is to open two more salons. Rhona will save the extra income for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Mamadou Lamine

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 3 enfants dont 1 fréquente l'école arabe.Il exerce les activités d'agriculture et de commerce.Il vend des habits pour enfants et des chaussures.Il pratique cette activité depuis près de 10 ans et arrive à prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille avec les revenus tirés de son commerce.Il est sociétaire de l'UIMCEC et a déjà payé sans retard et en avance 3 prêts de deux fois 500 000 et de 250 000f.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un nouveau pret de 300000f pour acheter 4 caisses de chaussures et 12 douzaines d'habits. Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'import - export et d'élargir ses activités.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, father of 3 children, 1 of which attends Arabic school.  He works in farming and business. He sells children's clothing and shoes.  He has been in this business for almost 10 years and manages to take care of his family's expenses with the revenues from his work.  He is a member of UIMCEC and has already repaid 3 loans without delay and in advance: two of 500,000 fr each and one of 250,000 fr.  To strengthen his business, he is requesting a new loan of 300,000 fr to buy 4 cases of shoes and 12 dozen clothes.  His goal is to get into the import-export business and to expand his activities.

loans.use: to buy 4 cases of shoes and 12 dozen clothes.

loans.name: Esther I.

texts.es: Esther tiene 57 años de edad es casada con 05 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Esther es una mujer empeñosa, que con los deseos de superarse y de contar con un negocio propio estudió corte confección lo que pudo ahorrar con sus trabajos  para la compra de su primera  máquinas de coser, debido a la demanda de clientes en su zona adquirió otra máquina  , actualmente cuenta con dos maquinas de coser. Ella se siente orgullosa ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y actualmente a poyar a uno de sus nietos. El deseo de Esther es de comprase otra máquina de coser. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de telas y también lo usara para la graduación de su hijo.  Esther agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por el apoyo que brindan a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Esther is 57, married, and has five children. She is still supporting one of them. Esther is a determined woman, who through her wish to better herself, and to have her own business, studied dressmaking, and was able to save through her work to buy her first sewing machine.

Due to the demand from customers in her area, she acquired another machine. Now she has two sewing machines. 

She feels proud, that thanks to her hard work and dediucation she has been able to support her children with their education, and now supports one of her grandchildren. 

Esther wishes to buy herself another sewing machine. On this occasion, she applied for the loan in order to buy fabric and will also use it to pay graduation expenses for her son. Esther is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support that they offer to people like her.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es: Pedro Ángel de 57 años de edad es un señor  muy trabajador el cual se dedica a la agricultura,  y   posee 40  años de experiencia en este trabajo.  Tito vive junto a su esposa  y dos hijos.  El se dedica a sembrar maíz frijoles y loroco, este último es una verdura que se utiliza para diferentes tipos de comida, todo lo anterior  lo comercializa por mayor, su negocio es bastante estable, en el cual desea invertir lo más posible, ya que es gracias a este como el logra sostener a su familia. Pedro  solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar  abono, pesticidas,  semillas de frijol,  maíz  y loroco para sembrar mayor cantidad de sus productos, y de este modo percibir mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de semillas de loroco para comercializar

loans.name: Kidawa

texts.en: Kidawa 21 years old. She is not married and she doesn’t have a child. Kidawa lives with her mother and her young sisters. She is helping her mother with her young sisters' school fees and uniform. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers to teach life skills to students. Apart from volunteering, Kidawa is running a business of tailoring women's clothes. She requests a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing women's clothes like vitenge and kanga. She will use her profit to buy materials in her shop and keep helping her young sisters.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing women's clothes like vitenge and kanga

loans.name: Alicia Julieta

texts.en:
Alicia is married and is 55 years old. She is a very active and entrepreneurial woman and always worried for the welfare of her family. She has 2 daughters (both are professionals) and her husband is a bricklayer.

Alicia has been a pensioned woman since 1998 and so she had to educate her daughters without her salary. Her pension was not enough for this so she decided to start her own business and opened a store in which she sells clothes, gifts and ceramics. Alicia wanted to support her husband with the family expenses and cover her daughters' studies' cost.

Alicia is requesting a loan of US$ 475 and offers to pay in 5 months. She needs this loan to purchase merchandise to have more than she has now. This is especially important this time of the year when her sales usually increase.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Alicia esta casada y tiene 55 años de edad, es una mujer muy active y emprendedora que esta siempre al cuidado del bienestar de su hogar. Tiene dos hijas y ambas son profesionales, su esposo es un obrero que también hace pequeños trabajos como hojalatería y pintura. Alicia fue jubilada de su trabajo en 1998 motivo por el cual decidió abrir su propia empresa de compra y venta de ropa, regalos y cerámica para continuar ayudando a su esposo en los gastos familia y sacar a sus hijas adelante en sus estudios. Alicia esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 475 a 5 meses para pagar con el cual podrá adquirir más mercancías y tener un mejor surtido en estos últimos meses del año en que se incrementan las ventas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells different kind of footwear within her community. She has acquired skills from the TEACH lending programmes and is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a Kiva loan of $950 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: S. is 44 and her husband is 40. They have four children between ages 10 and 19 - two sons and two daughters. Tam, her oldest daughter, stopped going to school and works as a daily laborer at HCM city. Mrs. S. supports the other three young children who go to school. The family has about two hectares of land to plant cashew nut trees on and intercrop with cassava, but the land is very poor and they have no capital to buy fertilizer, so the family doesn’t harvest much. Mrs. S. suffers from asthma, so she tries to sell bread at a small market. A retail business is important to increase her family income by $1/person/month where the average income is low at $8.5/person/month. S. wants to borrow $75 to improve her bread selling business and to buy fertilizer for her cashew nut trees.

loans.use: Sell breads at a small market and buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees

loans.name: Osawe

texts.en: Mrs. Osawe J. is 37 years old with five children.  She specializes in sales of tailoring materials in the market, a business she started in 1993. She is from Benin City, in the Edo state of Nigeria. She said her business will improved tremendously if she can get a loan of $450 to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Umarat

texts.en: Umarat is a mother of one child. She is 57 years old, a widow, and she lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has been in this business for 6 years. She sells chairs to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy more chairs and tables.

loans.use: To buy chairs

loans.name: Alberto Leví

texts.pt:
Alberto Leví Bié is 47 years old. He lives with his wife and 5 children in the neighborhood of Bagamoyo in Maputo. He has pool tables and arcade games in the neighborhoods of Khongolote and Luís Cabral. He joined the credit program in March of 2006 and his first loan was of 5.000MT. He is now in the 4th cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 15.000MT to invest in the business and continue the construction of his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, KIVA volunteer.

Alberto Leví Bié tem 47 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro Bagamoyo em Maputo.Tem mesas de bilhares e Vìdeo Games nos bairros de Khongolote e Luís Cabral.É cliente do FDM deesde Março de 2006 e começou com um empréstimo de 5.000MT. Está no 4º ciclo e vai tomar 15.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Investe o valor dos empréstimos no negócio e este tem ajudado a contruir a sua própria residência.

loans.use: Buy equipment

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long D., 46, has four children and lives in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To generate income, Long D. works making Khmer cakes, which she sells in an open air market, earning on average $6/day. Mrs. Long D. gets up early every morning to cook her cakes. Two of her children help her cook them and sell them at the market. Mrs. Long D. has humbly applied for a loan to purchase a motor-bike so that her husband, who is currently unemployed, can start a motor-taxi business.  She would use whatever money is left over to buy some tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike taxi

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is a successful entrepreneur from the Kharkov region in eastern Ukraine. For the past twelve years, she has operated a successful sales business at the busy Central Market in Kharkov. Raisa is married and has a daughter. Her business has been a good source of income for her family.

Raisa has requested a loan to help develop a new business venture. This is her sixth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. She has big plans for the future and we are excited to help her turn her vision into a reality.

loans.use: To start a new business venture

loans.name: Thi Hue

texts.vi:
Mrs Huề is an active woman, hard working. She has 3 children, a happy family. Her husband, Thành, is a construction worker. Everyday, Mrs Huề would go to the neighboring hamlets to buy waste metal to resell to the recycling company. Her oldest daughter sells grocery to help out her family. Mrs Huề applies to Binh Minh cdc for a loan of 150 USD. She believes that by saving, she will be able to pay back the loan easily.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Huề là người phụ nữ đảm đang, năng động. Chị có một gia đình hạnh phúc với 3 con. Anh Thành, chồng chị, là một người thợ xây chăm chỉ. Hàng ngày, chị đi thu mua sắt vụn từ các thôn lân cận rồi mang về bán lại cho chủ hàng ở trong làng. Ngoài ra, cô con gái lớn của chị cũng dã đi bán hàng để phụ giúp bố mẹ, tạo thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị tham gia chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc với mức vốn 2006000đ để bổ sung vốn đi chợ. Chị tin rằng chỉ cần biết tiết kiệm chị cũng có thể hoàn trả vốn dễ dàng.

loans.use: Đi chợ mua hàng

loans.name: Diana Aurora

texts.es:
Diana began selling perfumes in February 2003. She had sold clothing and cosmetics before but after finding that a well-known perfume shop in her neighborhood sold perfumes at wholesale prices, she began selling perfumes. Her business has gone well, selling first to friends and, little by little, to others who have been recommended to her. Thanks to this business, Diana can help her husband, who doesn't earn much, with the school expenses of their two children.

Diana now wants to buy more merchandise so that she can have a wider range for her customers. Consequently, she's asking for a US$925 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, that she can use to help her family get ahead. With the additional products she'll buy, she'll attract more customers. With your help, Diana can get ahead and help her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Diana comenzó a vender perfumes en Febrero del 2003 primero vendiendo ropa y cosméticos, pero después se enteró de una reconocida casa de perfumes de la localidad que vendía a precios de mayoreo y fue así como empezó con la venta de perfumes y le fue muy bien, primero entres sus amistades y actualmente en su casa tiene un letrero donde se anuncia, poco a poco la gente va reconociendo el establecimiento de Diana. Gracias a esto Diana a logrado brindarle un apoyo a su esposo que no gana mucho y con la ayuda de Diana han logrado pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos en la escuela.

Sin embargo Diana, desea comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad para sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Diana podrá sacar adelante a su familia, ya que con los productos que comprará, tendrá más gente que le compre. Con tu ayuda Diana logrará salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 52 years old, married and has two children, ages 17 and 20. She sells cold and hot beverages in a bar she started in 2002. The bar is open from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily, and she makes a profit of about $70 monthly from her business.

In the past, Salome took out took a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more beverages to sell in her bar. Now, she hopes for a new loan to buy more chairs. In addition to using them in the bar, she will also start a new business that rents chairs out for functions.

Salome belongs to the loan group Tiger, which totals 25 members who keep each other accountable for paying back loans.

loans.use: To buy chairs for her bar.

loans.name: Victorio

texts.en:
Today Victorio C. Romero (42) is running two different businesses. The first one he started five years ago. He opened a grocery store in his own house, where he sells a wide range of products from food and drinks to cleaning products. The second business includes agriculture and cattle.

Victorio has land where he cultivates crops such as corn, sesame, and tobacco. In addition, he has cattle. As can be seen, Victorio knows how to take advantage of various business opportunities. He is always looking for a good way to make profits. This loan is destined for the purchase of land in order to increase the number of crops.

Victorio lives in Chore and is married to Juana Garcia (40). The couple has 6 children who are attending primary and secondary school.

loans.use: to purchase land

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Anna M.. She is married and has two children aged 5 and 10. She has one dependent. In 2002, Anna established her small retail business. Anna requires a loan in order to open an additional two huts to sell from. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Anna would like to purchase materials to construct two new bandas (wooden huts) from which to sell her goods.

loans.name: Roukiatou

texts.fr:
Married to Mr. Bidabignawé, a plumber for the company Togolaise des Eaux in Lomé, Mrs. Roukiatou S. was born on 31 December 1968 in Pagala-gare in the Prefecture of Blitta. She has two children who are in secondary school. In 2006, she started a large store selling rice, soap, oil, and macaroni in the Agoè-Zongo district in Lomé. She has suppliers in Nigeria and in Ghana who deliver the soap. She is a wholesaler and sells to retailers.

This first loan she is asking for will allow her to resupply her stock by buying 20 bags of rice and 22 boxes of soap.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée à Monsieur ABRESSI-TOURE Bidabignawé qui est un plombier à la Togolaise des eaux à Lomé, madame S. Roukiatou est née le 31 décembre 1968 à Pagala-gare dans la préfecture de Blitta. Elle a deux enfants qui fréquentent et qui sont au collège. En 2006, elle a crée un grand magasin de vente de riz et savons, d’huile et de macaroni dans le quartier Agoè-Zongo à Lomé. Elle a des fournisseurs au Nigeria et au Ghana qui lui livre les savons. Elle est grossiste et vend aux détaillants.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de refaire son stock par l’achat de 20 sacs de riz et 22 cartons de savons.

loans.use: To buy rice and soap

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en: Wendy B. R., aged 34 and the mother of 2, used her Esperanza Bank of Hope loan to start her business of selling crafts and general home products.  Some of the products she makes at home, like candles and Christian novelties, and others she orders, like cleaning products and children's vitamin syrup.  The choice of merchandise may seem odd, but Wendy's business experience has taught her what her customers want.

loans.use: General Store

loans.name: Salome Donatilda

texts.es:
Salome is a member of the "Well-being" Communal Bank.

Salome is 42-years-old and married with 3 children; she lives in the slums of Covadonga. Salome has a store where she sells groceries, meat, and vegetables. The store is open from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. As such, Salome relies upon the help of her children during their free time. Salome and her husband have a car that they use for transportation to the Socos District. Additionally, Salome has land in the Socos District which she uses to grow corn and legumes that are sold in the city of Ayacucho. Lastly, she raises poultry and also produces honey.

Salome needs a loan of $775.00 (2,250 soles) to invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, and milk, and to outfit her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Salome Es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.

Salome es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Salome vive en el asentamiento humano Covadonga, Salome tiene una tienda surtida de abarrotes, carne, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en sus ratos libres. Salome junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el que realizan transporte al distrito de Socos. Además Salome tiene sus tierras en el distrito de Socos en donde produce maíz, arveja que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, también se dedica a la avicultura, produce miel.

Salome necesita un préstamo de 2250 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche y para implementar mas cajones, bastidores.

loans.use:
Purchase of sugar, rice, oil, and milk, and to outfit a small store.
Salome necesita un préstamo de 2250 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche y para implementar mas cajones, bastidores.

loans.name: Sara Silvia

texts.es:
La señora  Sara Silvia B. D. tiene cincuentaitres años   y vive en la calle San Martín 431 del distrito de Mache de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad.
Sus padres tuvieron doce hijos de los cuales preferían que estudien los hijos varones, por lo que ella estudió solamente hasta tercer año de primaria lo que ahora equivale a cuarto grado.
Es madre soltera de dos hijos varones y una hija que falleció siendo niña.
Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado porcino y también a la compra venta de quesillo.
Recuerda con mucho cariño que Manuela Ramos confió en ella y obtuvo un préstamo de 300 soles con los que compró tres ovejas y las vendió en carne.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará cerdos para venderlos en carne (al por menor).
Sara es una mujer de muchas perspectivas de negocio además piensa que las mujeres siempre deben estar organizadas, por lo que ella pertenece al comedor popular Corazón de María y es una socia muy cumplida de su Banco Comunal Progresistas, ya que en el aprende mucho.
Su gran sueño es viajar a Chili donde se encontrará con uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sara Silvia B. D. is 53 years old and lives at 431 San Martín Street, in the Mache District of the Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department. Her parents preferred for, out of their twelve children, the males to go to school. For this reason she only attended school through third grade (now the equivalent of fourth grade.) She is the single mother of two boys and a girl who passed away as a child. She buys and sells pigs as well as cheese. She remembers very fondly that Manuela Ramos trusted her and obtained for her a loan of 300 soles, with which she bought three sheep to sell as meat. With this loan of 1,500 soles, to be paid in four installments, she will buy pigs to sell retail as meat. Sara is a woman with many business prospects. She thinks that women should always be organized, which is why she is a member of the popular Corazón de María dining hall. She is also a very reliable member of her bank, Banco Comunal Progresistas, from which she has already learned a lot. Her greatest dream is to go to Chile to reunite with one of her sons.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Mrs. Malika Ghirire lives in Tikhidewal, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and brother-in-law.  Her husband's name is Mr. Arjun G. and he works in a private office. Her brother-in-law works in the Nepal army.

Mrs. G. opened a grocery shop few months ago to better the living standard of her family. Due to lack of funds, she can't buy goods for her shop. So she is asking for her first loan of Rs 10000.00 ($150 USD) to buy goods like rice, dal, noodles, and other items.

loans.use: To buys grocery goods

loans.name: Rafiqan M.iqbal Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan baji is a 53-year-old widow who lives in Shah Rukn, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. Since her husband died from a heart attack, Rafiqan baji has struggled to give her children a good future. She started sewing clothes for people in her neighborhood which grew to sewing clothes for people in her community. She didn’t marry again because she didn’t want to diversify her responsibilities. Her sons are fruit sellers. They buy fruits from a fruit market to sell on fruit carts in different areas in Shah Rukn. Her eldest daughter helps her in stitching clothes. The two younger daughters are in school. Rafigan successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to expand her sons' fruit-selling business. 

She is joined in her loan group by a three members: Zubaida baji requests a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shabana baji requests a loan to buy clothes for her cloth-selling business. Firdous baji requests a loan to buy material (colored thread and sketches) for her embroidery business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
B. Nasiba, 36 and married, begins work very early each day in order to get ahead and achieve her goal of having her five children finish school and enter University. B. sells footwear and clothes for men in the central market of Penjikent town and, thanks to the support of her spouse and her own efforts, has been able to develop her business to the point where she operates it from a large space and with a substantial clientèle. Requesting a loan of $600 which she will repay in 8 months, she plans to buy a greater variety of winter boots and meet some specific requests from her customers.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is one of the poorest of the 15 former Soviet republics, with a GDP per capita of less than $600. The civil war, which took place soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., severely damaged the already weak economic infrastructure and caused a sharp decline in the agricultural and manufacturing sectors. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. All of these factors have resulted in a severe lack of jobs and have forced hundreds of thousands to leave Tajikistan to find work in other countries, mostly in Russia. While Tajikistan has experienced some economic growth since the end of the Civil War, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON International's mission is to promote sustainable economic development and improved quality of life in Tajikistan by insuring reliable access to financial services for the economically active members of the population. IMON International has eight branch offices throughout Tajikistan and their entrepreneurs work in many parts of the country's economic sector including trade, manufacturing, agriculture, and services. As of October 2008, IMON International had 27,802 active clients and a total portfolio of $28,405,549. Approximately 44% of these clients are women and 65% are from rural areas. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase winter boots for men in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Melaia

texts.en: Melaia F., 55, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the sales business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (~229 USD).  SPBD loans are Melaia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: re-stocking of her shop

loans.name: Panjperan Group

texts.en:
The Panjperan group has three member. All of the members would like to receive money for their businesses.

Anesgul and Sajeda want to take a loan for their husbands' fruit carts. Badamgul is taking a loan for her carpet-weaving business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and earn more money to better support their families.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To see progress in their businesses

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells foodstuffs; she has been in the business for the past 7 years. Christiana is 36 years old and married with 4 children. Christiana is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is very happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support they have given to her. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gorenco

texts.en: Gorenco runs a restaurant. Some of the food scraps from the restaurant are used to feed pigs. Last year she raised two feeder pigs for sale. Now she wants to buy ten feeder pigs, and will sell them in a meat supply business. Her future plan is to increase the number of pigs and earn more profit in both businesses.

loans.use: increase the number of pigs

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf N. is 30 years old. He lives in the town of Isfara. He is married and has a son. Maruf processes and sells dried fruits in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of dried fruits. He purchases dried fruits from local farmers at wholesale prices and after processing sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Maruf to make his business quite successful, and it brings in a stable income for his family. Currently, he needs a loan of $800 USD to buy supplies so he can continue to offer quality products to his customers. Maruf expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.    

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Reina De

texts.es: La sra. Reina L., cuenta con 37 años, casada con el sr. Moisés, contando con una hija de 15 años y viven casa propia, también señalar que su negocio se encuentra en su propio inmueble, contando con computadoras, mas puntos de llamadas, los cuales tiene funcionando hace 55 meses, también percibe renta diaria fija de su taxi y el esposo trabaja de maestro albañil mas un salario de indemnización por la vitalicia de su ojo derecho. Su competencia es mínima en el Internet- punto de llamada ya que no hay muchos en su barrio y dentro de la zona---el destino del crédito fue para la ampliación de su inmueble.-- la cliente cuenta con un buen comportamiento en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Ms. Reina L. is 37 years old. She is married to Mr. Moisés. They have a 15-year-old daughter and live in their own home. They also point out that their business is in their own property. They have computers, which have been working for 55 months, and Call Point. They also receive fixed daily rent from their taxi and her husband works as a master bricklayer. They also have severance pay for life for his right eye. They have minimal Internet/Call Point competition since there aren’t many in their neighborhood or in the area. The loan is to make their property bigger. This client has a good history with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ampliación inmueble

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Florence M. from Mwanza. She is single with one child, who is 10 years old. Florence has been running a beauty saloon since 2007. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair or blue hair and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee.

Florence currently earns about $150 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair and blue hair. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Florance thanks you for the support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair and blue hair

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Mrs. Loreta L. is 47 years old and is from Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a farmer and they have four children: 2 are married and the other 2 are still studying at the secondary level. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2005  and has a very excellent repayment record.
Now she is applying for a loan of Php 55,000.00 to purchase a motorcycle to deliver their farm harvest to the market.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Atsou

texts.fr: Mr. Atsou D. est né en 1986 à Nyigbé dans le Zio. Il est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants. Son activité principale est l’agriculture, grâce à laquelle il arrive à contribuer aux besoins du foyer et de sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit pour s’acheter des fertilisants et autres intrants afin d’augmenter sa production. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses revenus pour un meilleur devenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Atsou D. was born in 1986 in Nyigbe, a village in the Zio region of Togo. He is married and the father of five children. He works primarily in agriculture, which allows him to contribute to household needs and to support his family. He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers and other products to increase his production. This will allow him to increase his income and thereby offer a better life to his family.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and other products

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a 40 year old, married woman and mother to three children. Two of the children are in community primary school while the eldest has completed the senior high school. Leticia is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew at the community where she lives. She started her business about ten years ago while taking care of her home. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use this loan to buy more meat, vegetables and bags of rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business. This will allow her to raise more income to support and provide for her family and finance her children’s education. She desires to sell all that she has in order to send her first-born child to university.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is 35 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She sells groceries, such as noodles, milk, and sugar. 
She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina B. is 55 years old and works as an eye specialist. As a doctor, she is also practicing her knowledge in operating a business in her optical clinic located at Tagaran, Cauayan City. She and her husband are already separated and she is left with their two children who are both college graduates. Her eldest, Eloisa, is 29 years old and currently working as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) in Dubai. Josefino, 25 years old, manages a store in their village.

Edwina is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to be used as additional capital in purchasing lenses and prints or optical stock for her business. In addition, she is also planning to put up another clinic at another location to reach out to those who are in need. According to her, she is charging lower prices for her lenses and sunglasses.

Edwina is hoping to obtain her loan because it will be of great help to her business. She has been working hard for a very long time for her children and for future needs. Being separated from her husband is quite difficult because she is the only one supporting her children. She tries to work hard to prove that she can also be a good parent to her children without their father. Providing them with a complete education is already a great achievement for her.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Diez De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Diez de la Mañana, está formado por Ivonne Guadalupe J., Verónica M., María del Socorro S., provenientes del Barrio San Judas, ubicado en la Ciudad de Managua.

Doña Ivonne Guadalupe J. de 51 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo; quien desde hace mas de 4 años inicio una pulpería en su casa, con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su casa y las condiciones en las que sus hijos se iban a criar. 

Afirma que con los créditos que ADIM le ha facilitado a podido incrementar sus productos y satisfacer la demanda que tiene por parte de sus clientes, su crédito pretende invertirlo en seguir surtiendo su pulpería y así poder recibir más ganancias para poder sacar adelante a su familia.

El grupo Diez de la mañana tiene 2 años de estar trabajando con ADIM, éste es su quinto ciclo de crédito, y están muy satisfechas con el trabajo realizado.

Doña Verónica M. quien confecciona ropa de todo tipo (Pantalones, ropa de niños, vestidos de dama, entre otros)es la segunda integrantes del grupo y  María del Socorro S. quien elabora jugos a base de frutas, bebidas típicas Nicaragüenses y Refrescos (Coca-Cola, Pepsi-cola) es la tercera.
texts.en:
The "10 de la Mañana" group is made up of Ivonne Guadalupe J., Verónica M., and María del Socorro S., all natives of the San Judas neighborhood in the city of Managua. Ivonne Guadalupe J., 51, the group's coordinator, opened a grocery store in her house more than four years ago in order to improve her home, her standard of living, and the conditions in which her children would grow up. She says that the loans from ADIM have helped her offer more products and satisfy her customers' needs. She intends to invest her loan in continuing to stock her grocery store so she can earn more profits and get her family ahead. The "10 de la Mañana" group has been working with ADIM for two years. This is their fifth loan cycle, and they are very satisfied with the work they have done. Verónica M. sews all types of clothing (pants, children's clothing, women's clothing, etc). María de Socorro S. prepares fruit juices and traditional Nicaraguan drinks, and sells soft drinks (Coca Cola and Pepsi).

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: La familia de Reynaldo está compuesta de  4 integrantes  él su esposa y sus dos hijos pequeños, la familia alquila la casa donde viven y trabajan. Reynaldo es mecánico  cuenta con su taller y su tienda de venta de  repuestos para movilidades en general que es atendido por la esposa. La competencia es media ya que hay otras personas  que desarrollan las mismas actividades, pero por su buen servicio  y antigüedad tiene buena cantidad de trabajo. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo en su negocio de comercio de repuestos lo que mejorara sus ingresos. Son excelentes clientes de la institución .

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to purchase fox poles to sell.  Elizerbeth is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man . She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build store for charcoal and fox poles. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase fox poles to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” ubicado en  Villa Queñuani, del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 53 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 08 hijos, vive en el Barrio Central, estudio solo el primer grado D. primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años ella es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. abarrotes.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar saquillos y sacos D. polietileno, además algunos abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, por toro lado ella se ayuda con la venta D. ganado.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen del Rosario" located in Villa Queñuani in the District of Yunguyo, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in a central neighborhood and has a first graD. education.

Antonia has been working with Manuela Ramos for several years since she one of the founding members of her Communal Bank. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles enabled her to increase her business capital for buying and selling groceries. She is now requesting a new loan of 1200 soles to purchase paper sacks and polyethylene bags, as well as grocery items such as rice and sugar. In addition, she plans to acquire a bull for her livestock business.

Her greatest wish is to continue working. Antonia enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paper sacks, polyethylene bags, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Maria Omier de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos que procreo de 5,13 y 16 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad y sus ingresos son bajos, es por eso opto por iniciar su propio negocio en donde pudiera tener entradas económicas para el bienestar de su familia, tiene una pequeña pulpería en donde vende, granos básicos, golosinas, venta de huevo, gaseosas y una variedad de producto, con este financiamiento comprara granos básicos, , producto de higiene personal, verduras, carnes ya que también los fines de semana hace sopa, baho para vender y obtener mejores ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades personales. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de este primer crédito que espera que sea uno de muchos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Omier is 45 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is married and has three children who are 5, 13 and 16 years old. Her husband works as a security guard, but since he doesn't earn very much she decided to start her own small grocery store in order to earn enough to provide for her family's well-being. She sells basic grains, sweets, eggs, sodas and a variety of other products. She also prepares soups and baho (a traditional Nicaraguan stew) to sell on the weekends, so that she can earn more and cover her own basic needs. With this loan, she will buy basic grains, personal hygiene products, vegetables, and meat. She is grateful to Afodenic for giving her the opportunity to take out her first loan, which she hopes will be the first of many.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Ngin S. is 54 years old and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Ngin S. makes a living planting crops in the village. Her husband has been a fisherman for years. Ngin S. has given birth to five children, three of whom are married and live away from home. Her two school-aged children live with her and work on the farm when they are free from studying. 

This harvest season, Ngin S. is applying for a loan to use as capital to buy rice in bulk from the rice growers. She will sell the rice when it commands a good price.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk from the growers, to sell when the rice is commanding a good price.

loans.name: Maroum

texts.fr: Maroum KEBE est une femme de 28 ans elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi et a eu 7 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, cette activité lui donne des bénéfices qui lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Maroum Kébé, aged 28, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of a village bank for three and a half years and received seven loans. She produces and sells peanut butter. The profit from this activity enables her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra separada de su esposo y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Enith se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace seis meses y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò productos para cabello.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que será utilizados en la compra de zapatos para vender por campaña navideña. 
El sueño de Enith es tener una boutique y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Enith is a dynamic and hardworking woman. She lives in Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 31 years old. She is separated from her husband and has two young children. Enith sells beauty products from her home. She has been a member of the “Las Fresitas” communal bank for six months. The first loan she received was for PEN 300.00. and with it she bought hair products. She currently needs a loan of PEN 500.00, which will be used to buy shoes to sell during the Christmas shopping season. Enith’s dream is to have a boutique and to get ahead in life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell during the Christmas shopping season

loans.name: Liny

texts.en:
Liny I. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Liny owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling viand (meat) in the local community. Liny has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Liny joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Liny is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Liny from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S., 28, is married and lives with her two children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. S. raises pigs at home and she is able to earn US $3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2003. Her husband is employed at the Siem Reap International Airport earning US $5 per day. 

S. and her husband work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase more piglets to raise. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: E Retoño Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO "EL RETOÑO" SE ENCUENTRAN EN SU 5TO CICLO, ES UN GRUPO UNIDO QUE AL PASAR LOS CICLOS HAN IDO DEPURANDO SOCIAS QUE NO CUMPLIAN HASTA QUEDAR LAS PERSONAS MÁS RESPONSABLES Y SOLIDARIAS ENTRE SI, TODOS VIVEN EN LA URBANIZACION D. "EL RECREO" UNA ZONA ALEJADA D. LA CIUDAD. 

LA SEÑORA MARIA DEL CARMEN ES LA NUEVA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. COMIDA CENA ENTRE SEMANA Y LOS FINES D. SEMANA VEND. COMIDA EN LAS MAÑANAS YA QUE PREPARA PATASCA, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA D. PRODUCTOS D. PRIMERA NECESIDAD Y ASI PODER PREPARAR SUS RIQUISIMOS PLATOS. 

EL SEÑOR LUIS ES UN INTEGRANTE ANTIGUO QUE TIENE SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO D. REPARACIÓN D. CELULARES Y VENTA D. REPUESTOS EN EL MERCADO DEL PLAN 3000, EL DESTINO DLE CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA D. HERRAMIENTAS Y REPUESTOS QUE UTILIZARA EN LA REPARACION D. LOS CELULARES. 

LA SRA. NOEMI ES SOCIA ANTIGUA QUE TIENE UNA TIENDA D. ABARROTES EN EL BARRIO, SU TIENDA ES BIEN SURTIDA, ELLA SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA PERSONA MUY REPSONSABLE TIENE A SU CARGO DOS HIJOS Y UN NIETO D. HIJA QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN ESPAÑA, SU SUEÑO PODER PONER UN MICROMERCADO EN LA URBANIZACION PUESTO QUE ELLA CUENTA CON MUCHOS CLIENTES Y SU TIENDAS ES D. LAS MAS CONOCIDAS EN LA URBANIZACIÓN, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA D. ABARROTES AL POR MAYOR.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON RESPONSABLES Y TRABAJADORAS, ESTAN AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial group "El Retoño" is on its fifth cycle. It is a unified group that, as cycles pass, has removed members that do not participate until the most responsible and supportive persons are left. They all live in the "El Recreo" housing development in an area away from the city. Mrs. Maria del Carmen is the new president of the group. She focuses on the sale of dinner during the week. On weekends she serves breakfast, preparing Patasca [a nutritious sheep and beef soup]. The loan is for the purchase of basic products so that she can prepare her delicious dishes. Mr. Luis is a long time member who owns a small business repairing cell phones and selling parts in the Plan 3000 [an area in the city of Santa Cruz] market. The loan is for the purchase of tools and parts for cell phone repair. Mrs. Noemi is a long time member who has a grocery store in the neighborhood, her store is well stocked. She considers herself a responsible person, caring for two children and the grandson of a daughter who is in Spain. Her dream is to open a mini market in the development since she can count on so many customers, her store is one of the most well known in the area. The loan is for the purchase of groceries in bulk. All of the partners are responsible and hardworking, they are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their support and for awarding the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia G., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to prepare food

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 38-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Abass has been selling automobile spare parts and car repairing tools since 2001. 

Abass is special in his work because of his experience in sales. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car spare parts for his work. This is his third loanr and he has alwayse paid on time. 

When Abass first started his business, he had some financial issues. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job, as well as due to his experience. In the future, he plans on enlarging his business.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts for his work

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity A. is 28 years old and married to a peasant. She has two school-aged children. Charity is currently in the business of selling onions, tomatoes and dried fish at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock Irish potatoes and dried cassava tubers. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a fridge for home use.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock Irish potatoes and dried cassava tubers

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Like other mothers, Maribeth only wants the best for her children. She dreams of having her three children finish college and find decent jobs for themselves. She works hard to achieve her goals. She runs a sari-sari store situated at her house. She hopes to grow her store and earn a better income. She also makes tocino, a marinated pork delicacy and very popular in the Philippines. She mostly sells them to her regular customers.

Maribeth applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI. She will use it to buy additional merchandise and she will also buy pork meat to make tocino.

loans.use: Additional inventory and meat for making tocino

loans.name: Limaniya. Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe LIMANIYA (8 femmes mariées et 2 célibataires) avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 3 enfants  vivent dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Les membres du groupe  mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus,  d’huile alimentaire,  de friperie, de chaussures,  de fruits et légumes, de tubercules,  des produits de beauté,  des produits alimentaires et la restauration tels Wassa O..
Wassa comptent acheter avec son  prêt 1 sac de 100kg de riz + 3paquets de condiments et 1 chargement de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Elle  vend au  marché du quartier à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group LIMANIYA (eight married woman and two unmarried women) average 29 years of age and three children living in polygamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  These women are on their first collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. The group members have various businesses, which include selling cloth, vegetable oil, second-hand clothing, fruit and vegetables, tubers, beauty products, and food products, and they work in food catering, as does Wassa O.. Wassa intends to use her loan to buy a 100-kg sack of rice, three packets of condiments, and a cart load of firewood.  She gets her supplies at the big market of Sikasso City and neighboring towns.  Accepting cash most of the time, she sells at the local market to a customer base composed of men and women.  She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,500 francs CFA.  Part of the loan will be put into savings for societal purposes, and the other part will be invested in the businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for cooking food

loans.name: Mrs. Phara Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Anlong Ta Sek Leu village in Kandal province, seven people make up a village bank loan group. Mrs. Phara L. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will each use their loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Thorn Orauk, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow rice and vegetables on to sell to support their famiL.. Their problem is that their farm is a long way from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Phara L. is requesting a loan to buy hose. Through this activity, they support three children, two of whom are attending in local public school, while the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy hose

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Pring Y., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries at home for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a rice field farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to support her children's education. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Rakita Ole

texts.en:
Rakita Ole K. is 32 years old. He is married to Esther K. and a father to two school-age children.

Rakita is a farmer who has his own piece of land which he has been cultivating for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET from a friend who is a registered client of KADET in his community. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to prepare his ten acres of land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by leasing a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

Rakita's dream is be a large scale farmer with his own farm machinery.

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare his land for wheat production

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter W. M. is a married man with one pre-school age child. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. Peter joined Yehu in order to obtain a loan to uplift his standards of living. 

For the last two years, Peter has operated a barber shop, both as retail and from home. His main customers are mostly men and school-going children. He faces the major challenges of theft and machine breakdown. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), he wants to purchase a water heater and an electric hair-cutting machine. In the future, Peter hopes to open another barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase a water heater and electric hair-cutting machine.

loans.name: Joefemia

texts.en:
Joefemia D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 30 years old. Joefemia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joefemia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joefemia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years. She wishes to have a successful business and for her children to finish college and have a bright future.

Joefemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joefemia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Joefemia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Joefemia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Carmen Hermelinda

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Hermelinda M. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su rica cultura, su centro histórico, su variada gastronomía, la belleza de su vegetación y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Señora. Carmen Hermelinda se encuentra en su segundo ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación Espoir, se dedica a trabajar en un restaurante hace 2 años laborando desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m. y todo el tiempo libre se dedica realizar manualidades para adornar locales para fiestas, también elabora muñecos de felpa, estas habilidades aprendió  en algunos cursos y se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años.

Doña Carmen tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 14 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad.

Su  nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: cintas, silicona etc.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Hermelinda M. is a member of the Communal Bank “Medio Ejido”. She lives in the Orquídeas sector of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rich culture, its historical center, its various cuisines, its beautiful vegetation, and the warmth and friendliness of its people.

Sra. Carmen Hermelinda is participating in her second loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR. She has been working at a restaurant for two years, where her schedule is from 9am to 4pm. During her free time she makes handmade party decorations and plush dolls. She has been making crafts for ten years and learned this skill by taking a few courses.

Doña Carmen is 39 years old, married, and has three children (ages 23, 20, and 14). Her oldest child is married and lives independently. The second child is working and helps with the household expenses. Her youngest child attends high school in the city.

Her new loan will be invested in the purchase craft materials such as ribbon, silicon, and other products. Carmen says her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, ribbons, silicon, thread, and other craft materials

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba J. is currently in the business of selling sorghum, beans and maize at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour, beans and cassava to sell. 

Araba is 30 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 5 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods.

loans.use: to stock more bags of maize flour, beans and cassava to sell

loans.name: Peter Ngugi

texts.en:
Peter has been in the transportation industry for a year. He is 27 years old and married to Mary Wangare. They have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to set up a milk shop, which he will give to his wife to operate.

Peter hopes to grow both businesses but mainly focus on the milk shop, making it a large supplier of milk around the town of Naivasha.

loans.use: To set up a milk shop for his wife

loans.name: Naseem Zafar Iqbal's Group

texts.en:
Naseem does embroidery to ease her family's financial burden. She lives in Arifwala which is a small city located in the Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her husband and family in a two-room brick house in the colony named Zia Nagar. Naseem is married to Z. I. who is a private entrepreneur and has a vegetable selling business. He buys vegetables from the vegetable market and sells them to different vegetable shops to make a good profit.
  
Naseem is the mother of three sons. Her elder son works as a laborer and the other two stay at home and don’t do anything. None of her sons could get an education due to financial constraints. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy seasonal vegetables in bulk to improve his selling. 

Naseem is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes in her husband’s business and that his dream of starting his own vegetable shop in the market will become true with the help of the profit earnt through the loan. She is a regular borrower from Asasah and this is her second loan application. With her previous loan, she has proved herself to be a responsible person who has paid her installments on time and has never missed a meeting.  

Note: In the photo, Naseem is the lady who is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hand.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hau's Group

texts.en:
Hau T.  N. is 47 years old wiT. two children. One of them works. Being a farmer for many years, her activities focus on growing rice and beans and raising pigs and chickens.  This agricultural business  is used to feed the family and to sell to create daily income. Having joined our credit program in 2003, she has used loans effectively to expand her farming activities. Currently, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy four more pigs to raise.

 Ha T.  T. D. is 41 years old wiT. two children who are attending high school. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises 200 chickens. She is  in need of a loan of 2,398,000 VND to buy feed for the chickens.

 Yen T. N. is 49 years old wiT.  two children who are in high school. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises 200 chickens. Currently, she wants to have a loan  of 2.398,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.
 Huyen T. T. N. is 27 years old wiT. two small children. She is raising  10 pigs for meat. She is in need of a loan  of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them.

Liem  T.  N. is 38 years old wiT. three children who are in high school and secondary  school. She  has been a tailor for five years. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 3,706,000 VND to  buy cloT. to  meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more T-shirts and men underclothes

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo, 37, lives with his family in the village of San Pablo de Escurre in the district of Olmos, a rural region with many small farmers, in northern Peru.

Lorenzo has a small farm on which he raises cattle, goats, sheep and various fowl including ducks, chickens and turkeys. He has been raising these animals for some time and is a skilled caretaker. He enjoys earning income for his family independent of a boss or major company. He is proud to provide in this manner.

The requested loan will be used to purchase an additional cow. Because prices are low at the moment, he will be able to purchase a higher quality animal at a more reasonable price. Lorenzo hopes that by expanding his herd he will be able to increase his family’s income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase a cow.

loans.name: Tiarogot Ole

texts.en: Tiarogot Ole K. is 39 years old. He is married to Kinyikita K. and he is a father of six children between the ages of four and twenty. Tiarogot is a businessman involved in buying and selling sheep in his area for the past six years. He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET LTD registered client. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy more sheep to sell after a short period of time. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to pay for his children’s education and his basic needs. Tiarogot’s future dream is that he will be able to sell the sheep and become a renowned businessman in his residence area. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy more sheep to sell.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: La señora Otilia vive en Pacaya 24 Kilómetros de El Torno,  ella vive y trabaja juntamente con su esposo y sus 2 hijos quienes le ayudan en el sembrado y posterior cosecha de los productos que siembra,  es nacida el 6 de mayo en Chuquisaca. Hace 25 años por motivo de trabajo llego al torno, buscando tiempos mejores, tuvo la suerte de conseguir una pequeña parcela para empezar a trabajar y así después se compro otra parcela que estaba a su lado, compro ganado, ovejas y le va muy bien, con el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas y en lo que es preparado de la tierra, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Otilia lives in Pacaya, 24 kilometers from El Torno.  She lives and works together with her husband and two children who help her to grow and harvest her crops.  She was born on May 6th in Chuquisaca.  Twenty-five years ago, for work reasons, she arrived at El Torno looking for better times.  She was lucky enough to acquire a small plot of land that she could start to work on.  She bought another plot of land beside the first one, bought cattle and sheep, and her business is doing very well.  She will use her loan money to buy seeds and to prepare her land.  She is very grateful to our institution for the support that she is receiving.

loans.use: To burn grasslands and sow corn

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi F. is a fishmonger at Abura. She also cooks food for sale. She is single but takes care of five dependants. She has been in this trade for two years. She is responsible for the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy foodstuffs to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependants. In this picture, Esi is showing some of the plantains she fries and sells.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary AkwenN. was born on the 6th of August, 1956 is a widow and the mother of four children, one of them under 15. She shares six rooms with her children and grandchildren in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

She has encountered many difficulties in life including the failure to attain a quality education due to the untimely death of her father, and that of her husband in 2006, which has put her into her present state of trying to support her family. In addition, thieves broke into her home and made off with valuable materials and, in 2000, her house collapsed because of heavy rain and wind. With the many problems and the children under her care, she has still been happy because, among  the widows in her area, she is one of those who gets help from GHAPE solving her problems. If given another loan of 400.000frs, she plans to buy day-old chicks, seedlings, and fertilizer. She is convinced that the business will succeed because a previous loan from GHAPE was successful. The loan will help her community because she will be able to provide general food provisions so they will not need to incur transportation costs to buy in distant places. 

She will plough her profits back into her business and use part to care for her family, pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. Sthe also hopes to open a workshop for her son.

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she receives, the follow-up, and that GHAPE does not ask for collateral, as well as the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan. 

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy day-old chicks, seedlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Freddy Raul

texts.es:
Freddy M.  está renovando su credito que es el tercero  que hace con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pero es su segundo CrediKiva, con el cual  comprará vidrios de diferentes  diámetros,  para tener existencia y poder cumplir de forma puntual con los clientes;  esta inversión augura éxito porque es una temporada en que la construcción se reactiva, debido a que muchos clientes utilizan sus cesantías para el arreglo o remodelación  de sus viviendas y por eso Freddy estará con sus materiales listos para responder a la temporada una vez tenga disponible su credikiva. El finaciamiento anterior le sirvió para comprar materiales e hizo muchas ventanas y puertas y compró muchos vidrios y espejos, que le ayudaron a aumentar su capital de trabajo.
Freddy saluda respetuosamente a sus financiadores y les pide que sigan prestando dinero a mas personas trabajadoras, para que puedan aumentar sus ingresos y se mejore el nivel de vida de todas las poblaciones Colombianas y en el mundo.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Freddy ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/180570
texts.en:
Freddy M. is renewing his loan, which is the third that he has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, but that is his second Kiva loan.  With this loan he will buy windowpanes of different sizes in order to have business and to be able to service his clients punctually.  This investment will bring success because it is the season in which construction gets going, as many clints use their pensions for the fixing or remodeling of their homes, and so with his materials Freddy will be ready to respond to the season once his Kiva Credit is available.  His prior financing served to buy materials and he made many windows and doors and bought many windows and mirrors, which helped him to grow his working capital.  

Freddy respectfully greets his financiers and asks that they continue lending money to more hardworking people, in order so they may increase their incomes and improve the quality of life of all the towns in Columbia and in the world.

If you would like to know Freddy's history, click on the following link:  http://kiva.org/lend/180570

loans.use: To buy windowpanes of different sizes

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en: Javzandulam, 50, lives with her husband and three children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.
