texts.en: Soem S. is a 24-year-old farmer who lives in the province of Pursat. She also has handicraft equipment which she uses to weave brooms for sale.  Her husband raises pigs and works on their farm. Soem S. married years ago and is blessed with one young child who is in school. Soem S. wants to grow rice but she lacks the money to do so. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to purchase three sacks of fertilizer and to hire a labourer to plough a piece of her farmland. She will then begin planting a rice crop. She and her husband are pictured in their field.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to hire a labourer

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en: M. Irene is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 25 years old and married with 3 children aged 5, 3 and 1 year. Her first-born child is in school. Hers is a success story. M. got pregnant with her first child while still very young. Her (now) husband has helped to make sure she continues her schooling at the University on the evening programme. During the day, M. is a businesswoman operating a grocery store. She sells general merchandise in Kirinya trading centre. She also has a poultry business at home with broilers for meat. She is a hard working young lady with a strong drive to succeed in life. Irene needs a loan to help buy more goods for her shop. She will use the funds to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread and so on, as well as to buy chicken feed for her broilers.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop, as well as chicken feed.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Vilma del Socorro C. vende en su establecimiento los productos del hogar como perchas, pastes, cepillos, tendedores de ropa, entre otros. El crédito que ha solicitado lo utilizará para la compra de dichos productos para abastecer el negocio y por esta razón es que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el apoyo por medio de dicho crédito para suplir su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de los productos

loans.name: Kuburat

texts.en: Kuburat sells sarongs of various colours and shapes. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La señora Eleuteria es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” ubicado en Villa Queñuani, del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 65 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Barrio Central, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ganado.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar D. ganado vacuno para engorD., tambié tienen ganado ovino para engorD..

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y los encuentros,
texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria is a member of the communal bank “Vírgen del Rosario” located in Villa Queñuani, Yunguyo District, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno; she is 65 years old, is married, and has two children. She lives in the Central neighborhood and she has completed primary school (6th graD.). Eleuteria has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost one and a half years. Her first loan was for PEN 500, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business buying and selling cattle. Today, she is requesting a new loan of PEN 1,000, which will allow her to buy more cows, fatten them up, then resell them. She already raises sheep to fatten and sell. Faustina's biggest wish is to keep working. She loves to save and to go to gatherings.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Melba Isabel

texts.en: Melba Isabel has three children, ages 6, 9, and 12, and all are in school. Melba Isabel is 36 years old. She manages two businesses: the sale of clothing and the butchering of pigs (pictured). She began her clothing business about six years ago, selling clothing on foot when her husband was ill and could not work for an extended period of time. She now uses her home as display space for her merchandise. She will use this loan to purchase more clothing merchandise, adding to her selection of products. Melba Isabel dreams of being able to ensure that her children don’t go without a meal everyday and that she will be able to provide a good education for them.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 22 años, es soltera, vive en su casa propia, y lo que más desea es forjarse una buena vida.
Su carisma es una de sus armas más importantes a la hora de desempeñar su labor, ella es la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en la combi número 12 que brinda servicio de transporte urbano por las calles de Juliaca. Su día comienza muy temprano por la mañana, teniendo que permanecer en su labor hasta casi las 9 de la noche.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede conversar con sus pasajeros y hacer más ameno el viaje, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día parada, ya que los pasajeros ocupan todos los asientos. 
Para más adelante, anhela tener su propia combi, con la cual pueda trabajar y obtener sus propias ganancias.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Nilda con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los dos mil soles solicitados planea apoyar en los arreglos de la combi donde trabaja, ya que si se malogra, ella no tendrá trabajo.
texts.en:
Nilda, 22, is single and lives in her own home; her greatest wish is to build a good life for herself. Her charisma is one of her most powerful weapons in her work since she is the person charged with collecting fares onboard minibus #12 which provides urban public transportation services on the streets of Juliaca. Her workday begins very early in the morning and doesn't end until almost 9 at night. What she most enjoys about the job is being able to converse with the passengers and make the trip more pleasant. She has had this job for two years and feels that the most difficult part of it is having to stand all day since the passengers take up all the available seats. For later in the future she would like to own her own minibus with which to work and earn her own profits. This is Nilda's fourth loan with MFP. She is aware that she needs to repay in a timely fashion and is prepared to do so since she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she is a well-liked and admired member. With the 2,000 soles requested she plans to help defray repay costs for the minibus that she works on because if it breaks down she won't have a job.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Minibus repair.

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Sea K., 47, is a widow with two school-aged children. She resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, with her parents and children. To make a living, she runs a business of selling Cambodian traditional foods made from fish. This kind of food can be kept for a very long time over the year. She is able to earn an income of US $5.9 per day.

K. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more traditional food to expand her business. She hopes that she will be able to make more profit when she retails the food to her customers. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more food for resale

loans.name: Joanne

texts.es:
Joanne es una socia activa y muy colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 40 años y es madre de tres hijos (1 mayor de edad).
Joanne se dedica a la compra y venta de granos (arroz, maíz, etc.) junto a su esposo. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace ocho años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar productos de primera necesidad para vender desde su casa.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sacos de arroz y maíz  adquiridos directamente de los agricultores para luego ser vendidos a los molinos. 
La meta de Joanne es dedicarse al engorde de ganados para luego venderlos.
texts.en:
Joanne is a collaborative and active client who lives in the Campo Verde district in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and has three children (one of whom is grown up). Joanne's business is the purchase and sale of grain (rice, corn, etc.) which she runs with her husband. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Las Nazarenas” for eight years and the first loan she received was for 300.00 new soles, which she used to used to buy essential household items to sell from her home. Currently, she needs a loan of 3000.00 new soles in order to buy sacks of rice and corn directly from the farmers in order to later sell them to the mills. Joanne's goal is switch to the business of raising cattle for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan in order to buy sacks of rice and corn directly from the farmers in order to later sell them to the mills.

loans.name: Eleoteria

texts.en:
Eleoteria B. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Eleoteria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling confectionary products in the local community. Eleoteria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Eleoteria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Eleoteria is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products offered for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Eleoteria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand products offered for sale

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia D. is from the village of Caputol. She is 36 years old. Nelia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a snack vending business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Nelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: G.s . Los Cocos Group

texts.es: Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario y Ángela conforman el grupo solidario Los Cocos. Cada una tiene diferentes actividades económicas. Maria de se dedica a la venta de leche, Eulalia a la venta de tortillas, Cristina a ofrecer los servicios de costura, Rosario a la venta de leche y leña y Ángela a un taller de costura. Son personas muy trabajadoras y con muchos intereses de salir adelante con cada uno de sus negocios, cada una busca la manera de sufragar los gastos del hogar. Todas tienen muchos sueños y esperanzas que desean cumplir pues todas son madres y quieren proporcionarles a sus hijos sus estudios, ya que todas ellas trabajan fuertemente todos los días. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario and Ángela make up the Los Cocos communal bank. Each has her own commercial activity. Maria sells milk, Eulalis sells tortillas, Cristina is a seamstress, Rosario sells milk and firewood and Ángela has a sewing shop. They are very hard-working people who are very interested in gettting ahead in life through their businesses. Each one seeks ways to meet her household expenses. All of them have dreams and hopes that they hope will come to pass because they are all mothers and want to provide their children with an education because each of them works very hard every day. The funding will be used to buy raw materials and supplies for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Estela Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Estela M. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y especialmente a la venta de papayas en su propio puesto en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que ha sabido salir adelante en el negocio de venta de las papayas y está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de dichas papayas y así continuar en su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Estela M. is a very hard-working lady, whose business is selling vegetables and fruits, especially papayas, from her own stall at Managua's Mayoreo market. She stands out for being a very hard-working woman who has figured out how to get ahead in her business of selling papayas. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest the funds to purchase more papayas, and thus continue her business in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying papayas

loans.name: Fady

texts.en: Fady, 44, lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Fady has been working as a car repairer since 2006. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he said that, as with every startup business, he had some difficulties, but nothing to talk about. He decided to start his own business because of his experience, his enjoyment of this trade and his desire for independent work. He has requested his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his garage

loans.name: Wilma's Group

texts.en: Wilma S.'s main source of income comes from providing general services to local community members. She is 59 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the village of Cawa-cawa. Wilma has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC and her second with Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Wilma is the leader of this two member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a rental yard. They have been living together in their current home for four years. His wife, Saihantuya, is 39 years old and operates a movie rental business.

Currently, Erdenebat operates a taxi service in his town. He has been operating his business since 2004, and has gained much experience during these years. He is a very hard working person and he says, “I would like to expand my business and to improve the quality of my family's life.” He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (~1407 USD) to purchase spare parts for his car for his taxi service and more DVDs for his wife's movie rental business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi and DVDs for a movie rental business

loans.name: Alirio Josè

texts.es:
En el barrio la Luz de la ciudad de Barranquilla, vive un hombre muy trabajador él es Alirio José B. de 41 años, muy dedicado a su negocio de elaboración y venta de almuerzos y a su vez comidas rápidas; su grupo familiar lo conforman  su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos entre 4 y 14 años, que son la razón por lo que esta familia se esmera trabajando para salir adelante. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a un monto de $1.300.000, con él planea comprar mesa y materiales para la elaboración de sus almuerzo y  comidas rápidas, tales como arroz, aceite, margarina, carne, pollo, queso, salsas y embutidos.

Alirio es proveniente del departamento de Córdoba, localizado al norte, en la Región Caribe Colombiana, frente al mar Caribe, donde las ciénagas, ferias ganaderas, los festivales como el del burro, reinados y sus tierras fértiles, aseguran un agroturismo de belleza inigualable; este es el escenario donde hace 5 años  inició su negocio de venta de sopas y almuerzos, que hoy continua en Barranquilla, y al que le agregó comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, hamburguesas, arepas rellenas, chuzos y maíz desgranado. Alirio tiene una ayudante todos los días para preparar los almuerzos de sus clientes  y adiciona otro los fines de semana para vender los ya famosos perros calientes, hamburguesas y carnes frías. Como su  negocio funciona en su residencia, su familia es bien reconocida en la comunidad. Su meta principal es organizarlo muy bien, ofreciéndoles a sus clientes mayor comodidad con más sillas y mesas, porque eso es precisamente ser oportuno en sus preferencia,  y es también, prestarle  un mejor servicio a quienes le compran. Su mayor desafío es no tener el suficiente capital para que su negocio funcione con las herramientas requeridas y la excelencia en el servicio.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of “La Luz” (The Light) in the city of Barranquilla lives a hardworking gentleman named Alirio José B.. He is 41 years old and dedicated to his business selling lunches and occasionally fast food. His family consists of his wife and three children between the ages of 4 and 14, who are the reason why he strives in his work to get ahead. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he has requested the amount of 1,300,000 COP. He plans to buy a table and ingredients for preparing lunches and fast food such as rice, oil, margarine, meat, chicken, cheese, sauces, and sausages.

Alirio is from the Department of Córdoba, which is located to the north in the part of Colombia facing the Caribbean Sea. This area is known for its swamps, livestock fairs, festivals (such as the one celebrating the donkey), pageants, and fertile soil. Here he started his business five years ago selling soups and lunches. He continues his business in Barranquilla and has since added fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, stuffed “arepas” (corn bread), skewered meats, and kernelled corn. Alirio has an assistant who help every day preparing lunches for his customers and on the weekends sells his famous hot dogs, hamburgers, and cold cuts. Since he operates his business out of his home, his family is well-known in the community. His main goal is to be well-organized, so he provides his customers plenty of chairs and tables to make them more comfortable. Alirio prefers it this way because it allows him to provide better service to his paying customers. His greatest challenge is not having enough capital to run his business with the necessary tools so that he can provide excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a table & ingredients for preparing lunches and fast food

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 25-year-old married woman with one son. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over three years. 

She is a seamstress and her clientele base is her neighbors.  Although she works seven hours a day, she manages her house very efficiently. She takes care of her son and her husband as well. 

Her husband's name is I. A.. He operates an electric shop where he sells electric supplies such as wires, switch boards, and tube lights in the market. His earnings allow him to manage the financial expenses. 

Zubiada is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah to purchase electric supplies in bulk to increase the profit of her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase electric supplies for her husband to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita C. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur.  She is 54 years old, married and the mother of three adult-aged children.

To make a living, Angelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  Her main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products in her community.  Angelita has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Angelita has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, to improve her living situation and to engage in business.  Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  

Angelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 

----------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. T. was born in 1983. She is married with a son. Not only does she grow rice, but also she raises pigs and sells noodle soup in the morning with her husband. Now, she raises seven pigs and some chickens. They have a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). This is the first time she is participating in SEDA. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her restaurant and buy food for pigs. She hopes she can participate in SEDA forever and try to repay punctually.

loans.use: To invest in her restaurent and buy food for pigs

loans.name: Zerpher

texts.en: Zerpher S. is currently in the business of selling fruit such as pears, avocado, passion fruits, etc. and is requesting a loan in order to stock jack fruit and apples to sell. Zeripher is married with four children who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock jack fruit and apples to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 45 años de edad, reside en el municipio El Tránsito, departamento de San Miguel, es padre soltero vive son su hijo de dos años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar. 
El negocio lo aprendió, muy joven por la necesidad económica y la falta de empleo, el vende ropa y artículos para el hogar de forma ambulante por la calles del Tránsito, no tiene horario fijo, es un padre responsable, trabajador y honesto, actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa  camisas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa para niños, con nuevos estilos para ofrecer a su clientes. Esto contribuirá a mejorar el negocio de Miguel, aumentar sus ventas para ayudar a su pequeño hijo y suplir las necesidades.
Las aspiraciones son tener su propio negocio, mejorar los ingresos para apoyar a su pequeño hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel is 45, and lives in the Transit municipality of San Miguel department. He is a single father and lives with his two-year old son. Migual sells clothes and housewares. Migual learned about business at a young age due to difficulty finding work. He sells his items walking around the streets of Transit, and does not have a fixed schedule. He is a responsible father, hard worker, and honest. He is asking for a loan to invest in buying clothes - shirts, pants, dresses, childrens clothing, and new items to offer his clients. This loan would improve Miguel's business, and increase his sales and income. Miguel hopes to have his own business one day, and earn enough to support his young son, and have a nice quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old divorced woman with one child. After the break up she decided to take on the responsibilities for her child, so she opened a beauty salon in 2006 after having 6 years of experience as a hairdresser. As she said, she always tries to offer all the new cuts and models to meet the requests of her customers and to attract more clients to her shop. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,200 to expand her business by adding new services and purchasing more equipment and beauty supplies. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in her picture, not indicating her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit partners.kivaorg/partners/115

loans.use: Adding new services, purchasing more equipment and beauty supplies

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn P. is from the village of Pontod, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old. Jenelyn is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jenelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina S. is currently in the business of selling coffee, simsim (sesame), beans and rice at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell. Katerina is 40 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Monico

texts.en: Monico D. is from the village of Cabaruan. He is 50 years old. Monico is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Monico raises pigs for fattening and sale. Monico has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Monico joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monico has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. Monico is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Monico from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah A. is from the town of Banga. She is 34 years old. Leah is single and hopes to have her own family someday. To make a living, Leah owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Leah also sells mobile phone credit loads in her neighborhood. She said it helps in their daily needs.

Leah joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to buy feed and additional mobile load credits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional mobile load credits to sell.

loans.name: Sea

texts.en: Sea R., 27, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. R. sells groceries for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband produces clay pig banks to sell, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  R. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to improve the current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Rec Kossoh Towm Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the REC Kossoh Town School, in Waterloo, a small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded in 1964. The school is staffed with eleven teachers and has 287 pupils.   

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 7,500,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone can not do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials; some will buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while others will invest the loan in business. 

Nat J. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kossoh Town, near Waterloo, Nat is married to a clerk and the couple has seven children who are attending secondary school. Nat has served in the teaching profession for thirty-eight years now.  Nat will use part of his share of this loan to renovate his house and use the rest to buy seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.use: renovate his house and  buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Lucia Silvia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 02 hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de revistas y periódicos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la mercadería de su negocio.
	
Su sueño para el futuro es prosperar más en el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, las charlas y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mensajeras” (The Messengers), which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and has two children. Lucia completed her higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which helped increase her business capital for selling magazines and newspapers.

Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN to invest in merchandise for her business. For the future, Lucia dreams of continued prosperity in her business. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the meetings, the discussions, and the unity.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of her news stand

loans.name: Mdigo

texts.en:
Mdigo B. is a 24-year-old single man who runs poultry farming as his primary business and bicycle transport ("bodaboda") as his secondary business. He has been in the poultry business for the past year.

 This will be his first loan with KADET and he plans to purchase young chicks which he will keep and latter resell once they are big enough. He plans to use the anticipated profits in boosting his poultry business.

His hope is to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: buying young chicks to raise

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Norma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In July 2007, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Norma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Maame Abana

texts.en:
Maame Abana K. is married and has five dependents.  Her husband is an electrician. Abana has received a junior high education. She cooks beans and serves them with gari (cassava) and fried plantain at Abura. . She assists her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to cook for sale. Abana hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.
In this picture, Abana is dishing out the beans. The bowl in front of her has fried plantain in it.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise sells beans, sorghum, peanuts and maize. She is 30 years old and married to a businessperson. They have two children who are six and eight years old.

Francoise has spent eight years in this business. She says that her business is very impoortant to the family savings because she has managed to build a house from the profits she has earned. She requested this loan to buy more beans and tomatoes to sell. With the profits from this business, she will increase the sales as well as set up a new construction project. She will also save some of the loan for her children’s school fees. She hopes to become a food product supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and beans to sell.

loans.name: Aracelly Esther

texts.es:
Doña Aracelly Esther Z. J. es trabajadora de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Gestora Colectora, desde hace 10 años.

Es Casada de 31 años de edad, con Tres personas a su cargo dos de estas están en edad escolar. Ella vive en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Tipitapa desde hace 13 años.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL, el que solicita para Mejora de vivienda, agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle este préstamo y darle la oportunidad de brindarle a su familia una vida mejor con una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Doña Aracelly Esther Z. J. has been managing collections at a water and sewerage company for the past ten years.   She is 31 years old and married.  She has three dependents, two of whom are school age.  For 13 years she has lived in the city of Managua in the municipality of Tipitapa.  This is her first loan with CEPRODEL which she is requesting for home improvements.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL for providing her with this loan and giving her the opportunity to give her family decent housing and a better life.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon H., age 42, and her husband Ou Choeun, age 46, live in the province of Kompong Cham. For over ten years, they have earned their living by cultivating rice crops. Phon H. wants to plant a potato crop, but she doesn’t have funds to do so yet. In order to achieve her plan, Phon H. would like to ask for a Kiva loan in order to buy potato seeds for planting. She hopes to use the remainder of the funds to enlarge her house. The couple is blessed with three children, two of whom earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland, and the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds for planting. She hopes to use the remainder of the funds to enlarge her house.

loans.name: Sorie S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Micronfinace Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you the teachers of the King Fahad Mission Primary School.  These members of this school have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 2,400,000.00 in order to buy furniture, house building materials, and pay school fees for their children.

Sorie S. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. This 44-year-old was born in a village call Mange Loko. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has 7 children.  Sorie is a teacher and has been in the profession for 6 years. He has requested a loan of SLL 700,000 from Kiva lenders in order to buy house building materials and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Buy house building materials and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Nhoem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen members who will use their portions to support different purposes. Nhoem was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Nhoem was born in 1945. His wife stays at home and cooks for the family. Nhoem is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice and lotus to make a living. He faces a problem with money and would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support his crop growing. The couple has a child who also helps with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support his crop growing

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: El Sr. L. y su esposa, con esfuerzos han estado construyendo poco  a poco  su casa, en donde ya tienen varios años viviendo es por  ello que cada vez que pueden le avanzan a la construcción y al mejoramiento de la misma , en esta ocasión le están instalando el vitropiso a toda la vivienda, ya que por algunos años  tenían el piso de tierra dentro y fuera de la casa, el Sr. L. pensando en todo el trabajo que tiene su esposa de barrer y limpiar tanta tierra todos los días en el interior de la casa, decidió empezar a instalar el vitropiso para ahórrale trabajo, además de que durara la limpieza por mas tiempo y la vivienda se vera mucho mas agradable a la vista de las visitas.
texts.en: With effort, Mr. L. and his wife have been building their house bit by bit.  They have already been living there for several years, so every time they can they move forward with construction and improvements.  This time they are installing tile in the entire house, since for years they have had a dirt floor inside and outside.  Mr. L., thinking of all the work his wife has to do sweeping and cleaning so much dirt inside the house every day, decided to start installing the tile to save her work, keep the house clean longer, and make it much more pleasant for guests.

loans.use: to install tile

loans.name: Tenke Ole

texts.en:
Tenke Ole,  aged 51 years old, is married to Saruni who is a farmer and together they have four children: Joseph aged 29 years and working; Naumi aged 24 years in college; Sophia aged 22 years also in college; and Elijah aged 16 years in form four. They live in Bissil. Tenke is a livestock trader and his business is located at Bissil market which is a busy market. He sells his livestock to customers from Kajiado, Kitengela, and Nairobi. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client of KADET.

Tenke’s business of 21 years gives him a monthly profit of Ksh.26,000 and this loan of Ksh.80,000 is his second loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use it to purchase more livestock for trading. If the loan boosts his business he plans to establish a dairy farm. 

Tenke’s hope for the future is to be selling milk to Kenya Creameries and factories. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock for trading.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 14 people. Mrs. Yun is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Her husband, Mr. Keo, is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. This couple has a child who is seamstress in a garment factory. 

Her husband's income is not enough to support the family. In order to improve the family’s condition, she would like a loan to buy vegetables for selling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa  de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos,la cual cuenta con sólo con agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío chacupe Alto, es una zona  rural que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria y esta a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Sus actividades principales en esta zona son la agricultura, artesanía y crianza de animales.
Nicolasa se dedica hace algún tiempo a la venta de leche, crianza y venta de animales (gallinas, patos, vacas y chanchos), sus corrales se encuentran en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales y una vez que alcancen su tamaño y peso ideal los oferta en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo, permitiéndole mayores ingresos para los gastos familiares.
Mediante el préstamo otorgado por por Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles a Nicolasa, el cual será destinado para la compra de útiles escolares de sus hijos y también para seguir comprando y criando aves de corral, ya que es un negocio muy próspero, mejorando sus ganacias considerablemente .
Nocolasa es una madre de familia muy dedicada a sus labores y a sus hijos que día día trata que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Nicolasa, 39, lives in her own house with her husband and three children; the house only has water and electricity and is located in the hamlet of Chacupe Alto, a rural area belonging to La Victoria District, Chiclayo Province.  This area’s main activities are farming, crafts and raising livestock.

Nicolasa has sold milk and raised animals (chickens, ducks, cows and pigs) for some time.  Her corrals are located in her back yard for increased security.  She feeds them natural grasses and nutritionally balanced feed and once they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the various markets in Chiclayo producing higher income for her family’s expenses.

Through a 500 new sol loan granted by Edpyme Alternativa, Nicolasa will buy school supplies for her children and also continue buying barnyard fowl which is a very profitable business thus improving her profits considerably.

Nicolasa is a mother who is very dedicated to her work and to her children who she hopes will get ahead some day.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man living with one parent and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop for more than 10 years. His work consists of changing car oil and tires. In addition, this hard worker repairs vehicle bodies. His work income is vital to take care of his family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools and products. He is certain that with these purchases he will be able to serve more customers. This will be his second Kiva loan, and we note that he has been a good client with punctual payments.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and products

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 48 years old and married. For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells a variety of products such as toothpaste, soap, and condiments. Visitacion earns about 3,000 PHP monthly.

Visitacion is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to offer the community in her store. In the future, she hopes that her general store will someday become a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Solidario Levi Group

texts.es: Solidario Levi. Este Grupo lo Integran tres señoras,Doña Marelin de 19 años ella se dedican a la venta de carne de cerdo y de rez apesar de us corta edad ella a logrado sacar adelante su negocio ella esta solicictando este credito para la compra de rezes ya  que esta convecida de que le falta mas capital para tabajar las otras dos socias se dedican a la venta de tortilla en su domicilio y estan solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña el sueño de ellas es agrandar mas su negocio y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Levi Communal Bank


This group is made up of three women.  Marelin, 19, sells pork and beef.  Despite her young age she has managed to propel her business forward.  She is asking for the loan to buy cattle because she’s convinced that she needs more capital to work.  

The other two members of the group sell tortillas door to door and are asking for the loan to buy corn and firewood.  Their dream is to expand the business and to have better futures.

loans.use: to buy cattle and to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Santa Mónica Group

texts.es:
Santa Mónica es un grupo de formado por 6 mujeres que se encuentra en su primer ciclo con Credituyo. Ellas escogieron ese nombre para el grupo porque así se llama la calle donde realizan sus reuniones semanales.  Las mujeres de este grupo practican diferentes actividades económicas como venta de zapatos, ropa y venta de tamales.

María de Jesús es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 48 años, vive en unión libre, y solo tiene 1 hijo que ya está casado. El esposo de María es vigilante y recientemente se quedó sin trabajo, hecho que obligó a María de Jesús a vender tamales para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. A María le ha ido bastante bien con su negocio de ventas de tamales y con su crédito espera comprar un triciclo más para que su esposo le ayude a vender tamales en las colonias cerca de su casa. A largo plazo, María de Jesús espera poder hacer crecer su negocio lo suficiente para contratar algunos empleados y así poder retirarse.
texts.en:
Santa Mónica is a group formed by six women that’s in its first cycle with Credituyo.  They chose this name for the group because that’s the name of the street where they have their weekly meetings.  The women in this group carry out various economic activities like: shoe sales, clothing sales and tamales sales. 

María de Jesús, 48, is one of the group members.  She lives in a free union and has just one son who is already married.  María’s husband is a watchman and recently lost his job which forced María de Jesús to start selling tamales to help cover household expenses.  María has done quite well with her tamale sales business and expects to use the loan to buy another tricycle cart so that her husband can help her sell tamales in the neighborhoods near her house.  In the long run, María de Jesús hopes to make her business grow enough so that she can hire employees and retire.

loans.use: to buy a  tricycle cart.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es: El señor Anastasio es productor lechero y su familia lo ayuda con las actividades agrícolas. La leche que produce es vendida a la fábrica de productos lácteos PIL. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir una vaca lechera de buena calidad; de esta manera podrá aumentar la producción de leche y también la fabricación de quesos, que es otra actividad a la que la familia se dedica. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi del departamento de La Paz. Es casado y tiene cinco hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron y su historial de relación con IMPRO data desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Señor Anastasio is a dairy farmer and his family helps him with agricultural tasks. He sells the milk he produces to the PIL dairy products factory.

He needs the loan to acquire a good quality dairy cow. Then he will be able to increase his milk and cheese making production, another activity the family makes a living at. 

He lives in his own house located in the town of Achacachi within the department of La Paz. He is married and has five children. The client is very satisfied with the loans he has been given and his relationship with IMPRO dates back to 2007.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 26 лет. Разведена. У нее пятеро детей. Замира живет вместе с родителями. У нее средне - специальное образование. Она работает кассиром в средней школе. Кроме того она два года как занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этом ей помогают ее родители и брат. Она берет кредит для закупа коровы с теленком.
texts.en: Zamira lives in Yavan. She is 26 years old, divorced, and has five children. Zamira lives with her parents. She has a vocational education. She works as a cashier in a high school. Additionally, she has worked in animal husbandry for two years. She breeds cattle for sale. In so doing, she helps her parents and brother. She is taking out a loan to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 
Nancy has a general store and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase canned  goods, noodles, drinks and other products to increase her store inventory. 
Nancy has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Nancy hopes to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyp, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 1 hijo ya independiente.  No pudo concluir la primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovinos y vacunos, compró dos ovejas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará una yunta (ganado) para su respectivo engorde por tres meses, para venderlo a buen precio.  La señora trabaja sola.  Nos cuenta que también cuenta que  vende quinua, papa, cebada en la localidad de Ilave y Pilcuyo.
Su sueño  es seguir y mejorar  los ganados para incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo  y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Estrellitas Unidas de Titicaca” (The United Little Stars of Titicaca) which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has a son who is already independent. Valentina was not able to finish her elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of buying and selling livestock, such as sheep and cattle. She bought two sheep.

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, Valentina will buy a pair of oxen that she will fatten over the next three months and then sell for a good price. She works alone. Valentina says that she also sells quinoa, potatoes, and barley in the towns of Ilave and Pilcuyo.

Her dream is to continue improving her livestock business so that she can increase her earnings. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan and the interest from her savings.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen for fattening.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 30 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Josué de 30 años y fruto de ese amor concibieron 02 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Mery junto a su pareja en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingreso, es la venta de cacao, café y plátano. Poseyendo en total 03 cuadras de terreno. Los frutos de sus plantas los vende en la ciudad de San Francisco y en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros y de esa manera avanza con mayor celeridad en las extracciones de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo está dando sus frutos, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga que atacan sin piedad los primeros brotes de cada plantación. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y trabaja sin causar problemas a la entidad financiera, espera contar en esta oportunidad con el apoyo de ustedes para seguir  prosperando. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
30-year-old Mery is from the town of Santa Rosa.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 30-year-old Josué, and the couple's two children who were born as a result of their love and who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

The hard work that Mery carries out on her farm together with her husband means that their crops are very well cared for and when sale time comes around their produce sells quickly.  Mery's main source of income is selling cacao, coffee and bananas.  She owns a total of 3 'cuadras' of land (one 'cuadra' = approx. 0.75 hectares).  She sells the fruit from her plants in the town of San Francisco and at harvest time she hires laborers so that she can pick her fruit more quickly.

What Mery most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land as this is when she feels that her work is paying off.  She has been in this business for five years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be protecting her crops from the pests that can mercilessly attack the first shoots of each plantation.  Over time, she would like to acquire more land so that she can grow more crops.

This is Mery's third loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her previous repayments and works without causing problems for the MFI.  She hopes that on this occasion she will be able to count on your help so that she can continue doing well.  She will use the 2,000 soles that she has requested to buy fertilizers in order to improve her production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina is 30 years old and earns $3 a day by working as a farmer. Her husband is a blacksmith who earns $5 per day. They have one child, who is one year old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $500 to buy chickens, frogs and fish to cook to sell in the upcoming P’chum Ben festival. She hopes to take advantage of this opportunity to earn some extra money while also being able to care for her small child.

loans.use: to buy chickens, frogs and fish to cook and sell at a festival.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 42 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has one grown child. 

Robina owns and operates a retail shop at home selling mostly grocery items. She has been running the store for eight years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 5,700. To help support the family, her husband drives a motorcycle. 

Robina has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Robina hopes to get enough capital to sustain the business for many years. She also plans to raise some pigs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of feed for resale.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Solidarias. Group

texts.es:
MUJERES SOLIDARIAS
Este grupo esta formado por doña Marcela D. 56 años D. edad casada y tiene 3 hijos,ella es la lider D. este duo tiene una tortillería desD. hace 15 años además tiene un poco D.  producto D. tienda como aguas gaseosas y lo venD., ella esta solicitando este crédito para poder Comprar maiz para su tortilleria  y aguas gaceosas y  vender mas y obtener ganancias, también esta doña Rosa Maria D. 36 años D. edad casada, y tiene 5 hijos, y se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. comales, desD. hace 25 años nos cuenta que necesita este crédito ya que ahora viene el tiempo D. fin D. año y es momento D. comprar comales y tenerlos listos ya que en ese tiempo se escasea porque muchos compran y los van a vender lejos entonces ya no hay y ella quiere prever eso y necesita este crédito confía en que fape le pueda seguir apoyando ya que el crédito anterior le fue D. mucha utilidad y este no digamos les piD. por favor la apoyen.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Solidarias" Group

This group is formed by Marcela and Maria. Marcela is 56 years old, married, and she has 3 children. She is the leader of this duo and she had had a tortilla production and sales business for more than 15 years. In addition she also has some grocery store merchandise that she sells, such as soft drinks. She requests a loan to purchase corn for her tortilla production business, and to purchase soft drinks to increase sales and obtain better profits. Also a member of this group is Rosa Maria. She is 36 years old, married, and she has 5 children. She has been producing and selling grills for the past 25 years. She tells us that she needs this loan because the end of year is approaching and it is the season when grills are bought by resellers and resold in distant places. She wants to have them ready for the season because she sells out with the high volume of sales and she wants to prevent this, and she needs this loan. She trusts that Fape (Kiva Field Partner) will continue to support her. The previous loan was a great help and this one will be too. She asks to please keep helping her.

loans.use: to purchase corn and sot drinks.

loans.name: Aliou Badara

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou est âgé de 55 ans, il habite dans le sud Sénégal. Il est  marié  a une femme et père de 3 enfants :les deux  les plus âgés fréquentent  l'école secondaire et le dernier est inscrit   dans  une école école primaire de la localité ou ils habitent.Il a une expérience de 15 ans dans le secteur du commerce ou il évolue.Il est spécialisé dans la vente d'habillement.Il démarre sa journée de travail a 8h30 et la termine a 21heures le soir.Il est sociétaire de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l'achat d'articles qu'il commercialise. Son objectif est d'augmenter son fond de roulement et  d'élargir son activité commerciale. Les bénéfices que lui procurent son activité l'aident a assurer les dépenses liées a la nourriture de la famille et a la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Aliou is 55 years old, lives in the south of Senegal, is married and has three children.  Two of his children are in secondary school and one attends the local primary school.  For 15 years he has been in the trading industry, and his business advances. He specializes in selling clothing. He begins his day at 8:30 AM and ends at 9 PM. He is a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC. He is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs in order to buy clothing to sell. His objective is to increase his working capital and enlarge his trading business. The profits from his business allow him to pay for food for his family and school for his children.

loans.use: to buy fabric to build up his stock.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, está nuevamente decidido por otro préstamo, ya que ha iniciado los preparativos en la tierra para la siembra de maiz, por lo que necesita insumos como abono y herbicidas, para el cultivo.
José está agradecido por este apoyo de microcréditos, ya que le permiten como agricultor y comerciante en pequeño, mejorar su trabajo y contribuir con su familia, el préstamo anterior le dio los productos necesarios para la tienda y logro pagarlo las cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out another loan, as he has begun preparing his land for planting corn, and needs supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides for his crop.

José is thankful for this support in the form of microcredits. They allow him, as a farmer and small businessman, to do better work, and support his family. The previous loan gave him the products he needed for his store, and he succeeded in making his instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 53-years-old and married with 4 children.

Ana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Ana has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is an artist who crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes and also offers sewing services to her clients. She loves doing her work and tries to design new things to make each dress attractive. The demand for her services among her clients is very high and that is why she receives a good number of orders every month. Razia also prepares wedding dresses for her clients and generates good revenue from that. 

Razia has two children: one daughter and one son. Her son stays at home, while her daughter also operates an embroidery business to serve her family financially. Her husband is a driver by profession.
  
With this loan, Razia will purchase embroidery materials, such as beads, colored thread, and sketches, in bulk in order to prepare embroidered dresses and generate good profits. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials, such as beads, colored thread, and sketches, for her embroidery and sewing business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 28 años convive con Julio de 38 años. Juntos habitan en su propia casa junto a sus 02 queridos hijos Julio de 08 años y Marcos de 04 años, a quienes promete brindarles una buena educación. Norma, es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su puesto de trabajo trata de sobresalir adelante. Es una mujer que se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, chicha entre otros. La tienda de Norma es muy concurrida por los vecinos que la conocen; ya que prepara deliciosos refrescos. Lo que  más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores. Lleva 01 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más y así abastecerse de bebidas. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias y ampliar su puesto de ventas. Este será su préstamo número 03 con MFP y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando bebidas como: gaseosas, cervezas, fruta para los refrescos, entre otros.
texts.en: Norma, age 28, lives with Julio, age 38.  Together they live in their own home along with their 2 dear children; Julio, age 8 and Marcos, age 4, who they promise to give a good education. Norma is a very hard-working woman.  With her job she tries to excel ahead.  She is a woman that is dedicated to the sale of beverages such as carbonated drinks, beer, and liquor, among other things.  Norma's store is very frequented by the neighbors that know it; since she prepares delicious refreshments.  What she likes most about her work is to converse with her clients since this is one of her abilities that she employs to win a greater quantity of customers.  She has had this business for 1 year and considers that the most difficult aspect of the work is to remain standing almost the entire course of the day.  With the requested loan she will buy more stock in order to be supplied with beverages.  In time she hopes to increase her profits and to expand her sales position.  This will be her third loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments promptly.  With the 1,500 new soles, she will buy beverages such as: soda, beer, and fruit for the refreshments, among other things.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and fruit to make refreshments

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a don Juan, tiene 34 años de edad, está separado y de esta relación que tuvo tiene un hijo de 11 años el mismo que  estudia en escuela. El y su hijo viven en la casa de sus padres.

Él para ganar el sustento diario se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y también a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de cacao y maíz, siembra en toda época del año ya que cuenta con bombas de agua para poder regar sus cultivos en toda época del año. En cuanto a la ropa su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, el sale a recorrer los fines de semana días en los cuales entrega y cobra ya que el resto de la semana se dedica a sus cultivos, la mercadería la entrega a crédito y cobra por cada 8 días, su mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil y a Huaquillas,  lleva más de seis años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo y abonos para los cultivos. Esta desde el segundo ciclo que se formó el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado en el Banco para recibir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro para ir a realizar sus recorridos y tener una muy buena producción
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' community bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) owing to the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world.

Here we meet 34-year-old Juan.  He is separated and has an 11-year-old son from his relationship.  His son attends school.  Juan and his son live in his parents' house.

In order to make a living, Juan sells all kinds of clothing and also farms.  He grows cacao and corn.  He grows all year round as he has water pumps which enable him to irrigate his crops year round.  As regards his clothing business, he makes his sales door to door and also to order.  He goes out to sell his products and collect payment on weekends as he is working with his crops during the rest of the week.  He delivers his merchandise on credit and collects payment weekly.  He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil and Huaquillas whenever he needs to.  He has been in this business for more than six years and it is doing very well.

Juan will use this loan to buy all kinds of clothing and fertilizers for his crops.  This is his second loan cycle as a member of his community bank and he enjoys it because of the opportunity that they have given him to receive loans.  

Juan's dreams are to own a car which he can use for his work and to enjoy good production.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fertilizer

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 48 year old woman, married with three sons. She is IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sara has been breeding cattle and cows for the last five years. She was a housewife and her husband`s salary was too low to cover family needs so Sara decided to purchase her first cow. 
Sara usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 250 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sara also keeps milkier cows for personal use and to sell to neighbors.  
She wants to expand her business and the improve life conditions of her family. She applied for a 1200 AZN loan to purchase three cattle, one milkier cow and fodder.

loans.use: purchase three cattle, one milkier cow and fodder.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique, a 57-year-old married father of four children, resides in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines where for the past three years he has operated a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community, each month earning PHP3,600.00.

Enrique joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation and is now requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Gladys Judith

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive en la parroquia del Valle  conocida también como “San Bautista de El Valle que se encuentra situada al sureste de Cuenca, lugar donde se produce de maíz, entre sus atractivos podemos destacar la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras), su gente es amable gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Doña Gladys tiene 26 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 7 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora Gladys hace algunos años trabaja como empleada domestica, labora solo el medio día. En su casa se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y también cría y vende cerdos y pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y materiales de construcción para acabar su casa. 

Su meta es tener un negocio estable como una tienda.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Cochapamba” communal bank.  She lives in El Valle Parish also known as “San Bautista de El Valle” and is located southeast of Cuenca.  It is a corn producing zone.  Among its attractions we can point out the Cochapamba Lagoon (full of Totora reeds).  Its residents are kind and maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.  They are merchants, farmers and raise animals.

Gladys is 26 years old and has a 7-year-old son attending the local elementary school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  The house she lives in his hers.

Gladys has worked as a domestic employee for several years; she works half days.  At home, she cares for her son and also raises pigs and chickens to sell.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and will use her new loan to buy pigs and building supplies to finish her house.  Her goal is to have a stable business like a store.

loans.use: to buy pigs and building supplies.

loans.name: Gyunaydan

texts.en:
Gyunaydan is a 38-year-old man from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have no or little access to credit. Gyunaydan is married with two kids (17 and 18).

Until recently, Gyunaydan worked at a large bread factory in Sliven. Two months ago, however, he started up a bakery in the Roma quarter. Out of his own kitchen, he makes a variety of Bulgarian bread foods – banitzas, mekitzas, pizza – and sells them from a window in the front of his house. We hadn’t met Gyunaydan when he started this, so he has had to make do without credit thus far. This loan will enable him to build out his equipment and expand, since there’s only so much you can do with a small oven. Once he can produce more, his plan is to sell through some of the small grocery stores in town to increase his distribution.

loans.use: Capital equipment

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani is an IDP from occupied Fizulir district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has two children. He started his business in 2000, and borrowed five Normicro loans from Baku branch for a total of $3800. Now he would like to borrow $1200.
